loans.name: Ba's Group

texts.en:
Ba is a farmer who lives in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 54 years old and married with seven children. She grows cucumbers and leeks to support the family. Having been in this business for twenty years, Ba is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Low crop yields resulting from floods is the main challenge for her field business.

Ba has been with VisionFund for five cycles while the other member is new to VisionFund. The past loans have helped to better support the family by having sufficient food to eat. Now she is leading her group of two to request a loan from VisionFund. As the leader, Ba will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. Ba hopes this loan will allow her to make more income through selling good quality crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Djromahuton Group

texts.fr: DJROMAHUTON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à une même famille. La représentante du groupe, Marie dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 45 ans. Marie est mariée à un certain Michel. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les différents besoins du ménage. Marie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quatre ans que Marie mène comme activité la vente des glacières et des ustensiles de cuisine par le système de distribution. Marie exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Marie sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe DJROMAHUTON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Djromahuton is a group of 3 people whose members belong to the same family. The group's representative, Marie (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 45 years old and married to Michel. The couple have 4 dependent children, all of whom attend, or have attended, school. The couple live together with their children and both take care of the different household needs.

Marie did not go to school. She has been selling coolers and kitchen utensils via the distribution system for nearly 4 years. Marie works with passion, which enables her to meet her needs. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Marie is requesting a 4th loan, together with the other members of the Djromahuton group. This loan will be used to better respond to the demands of their clientèle and to earn more profits. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy coolers and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Samart

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Samart is 26 years old and married with two dependent children, both of whom are at school age. Farming rice and selling grocery items are the main sources of the family’s income, which she has been doing for several years. To complement the income, her husband works as a paid car driver. She earns about 33,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 24,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her farming business.

Samart is in the second loan cycle with VisionFund. The first loan has helped her to relieve the family’s burden and improve their standard of living. Now she is requesting another loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for her farmland. Samart believes that her crops will produce good yields so that she can sell them for a higher price, and hence her family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Lobar

texts.en:
Lobar is 24 years old and married with 2 children. Being a responsible mother, Lobar works hard every day to generate income so that she can cover her daily costs and send one of her children to school.  She is dedicated to her farming business, growing wheat and potatoes on her own land. In order to contribute to improving her family's living standards, she has worked hard from early morning till late evening for 6 years.

Lobar would like to develop the business, which is why she is asking for a loan in the amount of 2,500 somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season. She hopes that KIVA lenders won’t reject her loan, and she thanks lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Tuungane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira est membre du groupe Tuungane, âgée de 32 ans, jeune veuve, mère de 2 enfants, son mari est décédé suite à une courte maladie. Tous ses enfants étudient à l’école primaire. Il y a 5 ans qu’elle exerce le petit commerce d’habillement et articles divers. Elle a commence avec ses fonds propre reçu de son mari avant sa mort. Elle expose ses marchandises dans le marché central de Virunga. Ce nouveau crédit va lui permettre d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 4 douzaines d’habits juniors et 6 pantalons, 6 chemises pour adultes, 10 jupes, robes, etc. Le grand obstacle est qu’elle vend parfois en crédit et que certains clients ne lui payent pas ou parfois payent avec retard. En plus, elle est souvent victime de pillage au long de la route. Elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et préparer leur avenir meilleur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The customer, Kavira, is a member of the Tuungane group. She is 32 years old, widowed and the mother of 2 children. Her husband died after a short illness. All her children go to primary school. She has been selling clothing and various items for 5 years. She started her business with funds she received from her husband before his death. She displays her merchandise at the central market of Virunga.

This new loan will allow her to increase her turnover by buying items including 4 dozen sets of clothing for children, 6 pairs of trousers and 6 shirts for adults, 10 skirts and some dresses. Her biggest problem is that she sometimes sells on credit and some customers either make late payments or don't pay at all. She is also often the victim of looting along the road. She would like to see her children grow up and to provide a better future for them.

The customer would like to thank Hekima for its actions in aid of impoverished people excluded from regular bank lending channels.

loans.use: to buy 4 dozen sets of clothing for children, 6 pairs of trousers and 6 shirts for adults, 10 skirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Chiaratou Eniola's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Chiaratou Eniola la responsable est âgée de 36 ans. Mariée et mère de 03 enfants scolarisés dont l'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement de 12 ans et de 04 ans. Elle vend de la quincaillerie depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. En vue d'augmenter son capital et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra d'acheter des cartons de peinture, des tournevis, des cartons de clous et des rouleaux de fil afin d'élargir son commerce et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Chiaratou Eniola se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This group has two female members, who mutually guarantee the loan. Chiaratou Eniola is the representative of the group, and is 36 years of age. She is married and has three children who are at school, the oldest of whom is 12 and the youngest is 4 years of age.

Chiaratou Eniola has worked for several years selling hardware items, and gets her supplies in a market in Benin and abroad. To increase her capital and satisfy her customers, she has requested and obtained a loan from Finadev. This loan will allow her to buy boxes of paint, screwdrivers, boxes of nails and rolls of wire. This will allow Chiaratou Eniola to expand her business and help provide for her children’s education. She is pictured on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two boxes of paint, five lots of screwdrivers, 10 saws, five cartons of nails and five rolls of wire.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha is a 30-year-old married mother of three dependent children, all of whom are still in school. Her family lives in the Ratanak Mondul district of Battabang province, Cambodia. To make a living, Chantha and her husband have planted corn on two hectares of farmland. This business earns them about 30,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day. Low crop yield due to insects is the main challenge for their business.

Chatha has already successfully paid back four loans with VisionFund. Now she is leading a group of three women to ask for another loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to produce her crop on time and with a good yield to increase her income and improve her life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es:
Milagro, se dedica a la venta de productos básicos, el negocio tiene como nombre “Tienda Milagro”, ella está casada vive con su familia, tiene dos hijos de 10 y de 5 años de edad.
El negocio nace como una oportunidad de obtener ingresos para subsistencia de su familia. Ella nos expresa que necesita un financiamiento para  la compra de mercadería como ejemplo, huevos, cereales, enseres, este préstamo servira para aumentar el inventario y poder crecer en clientes y obtener más ganancia.
Sus sueños están plasmados  en la reparación de su hogar y salir adelante con las obligaciones que le demanda su familia.
texts.en:
Milagro makes a living selling basic products.  She's married and lives with her family, and has two children, ages 10 and 15.

Her business is named Tienda Milagro.  It came to be as an opportunity to earn income for her family's survival.

She says she needs a loan to buy merchandise such as eggs, cereal, and supplies.  This loan will serve to increase her stock and customers, and to earn more profit.

Her dreams are to fix up her house and get ahead with her family obligations.

loans.use: to buy eggs, cereal, and supplies

loans.name: Gloria Elcidia

texts.es:
Gloria, está decidida a continuar trabajando, ha solicitado otro crédito por que necesita comprar más frutas y verduras tales como: repollo, manzanas, zanahoria, chiles, tomates, etc.
Expresa, que del crédito anterior tubo  resultados positivos, ya que compro mas producto y aumento el negocio, considera que a traves de esos prestamos ha realizado compras periodicas. Su familia se mantiene, sus ingresos han mejorado ya que hoy se vive mejor.
texts.en:
Gloria, who is determined to continue working, has applied for another loan because she needs to buy more fruits and vegetables like cabbage, apples, carrots, chili peppers, tomatoes, etc.

She states that from the previous loan she had positive results, since she bought more products and increased business.  She considers that it is through those loans that she has been able to make regular purchases.  She supports her family and her income has improved and so today she lives better.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, apples, carrots, chili peppers and tomatoes.

loans.name: Fifadji Jérônime

texts.fr: Fifadji Jérônime est âgée de 36 ans et a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Fifadji Jérônime ne vit plus avec son mari. Fifadji Jérônime est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Fifadji Jérônime vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule les divers besoins des enfants. Pour subvenir aux différentes charges, Fifadji Jérônime vend depuis deux ans, divers articles et des boissons par le système de distribution. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Fifadji Jérônime s’approvisionne au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Fifadji Jérônime sollicite pour la cinquième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Fifadji Jérônime is 36 years old. She stopped her studies at the primary school level. She no longer lives with her husband. She is the mother of two children, both of whom have received schooling and live in her care. She lives with her children and provides for their various needs on her own.

In order to cover her expenses, Fifadji Jérônime has been selling beverages and other various items by the distribution system for two years now. This business allows her to provide for her needs without much difficulty. She stocks up in Togo.

Fifadji Jérônime is seeking a fifth loan from ALIDé to help her achieve her goal of satisfying her customers and increasing her sales and revenue. The loan will allow her to expand her business and increase both her customer base and her revenue. The previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy beverages and other various items

loans.name: Azamat

texts.en: Azamat lives in a village with his wife and has a little son. The family gathers their main income from farming; they cultivate potatoes and wheat. In addition to farming, Azamat also would like to get involved in cattle breeding. He has applied for this loan to purchase cattle and mineral fertilizers. Such expansion will significantly increase the profit from agriculture, which Azamat plans to use for purchasing more cattle in the future.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and cattle.

loans.name: Shumaila's Group

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 35-year-old woman who is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, daughter and a son. Her son is 1 year old while the daughter's age is 10 years; she is studying in the 5th class. Shumaila's husband works at a boutique shop, but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses.

Shumaila is a very hardworking and independent woman. By stitching clothes, she helps her husband meet the family's needs and her children's education expenses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past two years, and her clients always appreciate her work.

Shumaila, as a member of an eight-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing a new sewing machine so that she can work more efficiently in the future. As she is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams to build her own house. She also desires to increase her business and to provide a quality education to her children. Shumaila and her family are very much thankful to both BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Ra lives in a village in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. She is 29 years old and married with one dependent daughter who is under school age. To support the family, she farms rice on 1 hectare of farmland, and her husband works for others for fees. Ra has been farming rice for three years. As with other farmers, drought is still the main challenge for her rice farming business.

This is the first loan for Ra’s group with VisionFund. Each member of the group is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 Cambodian riels (KHR). Ra was appointed to be a group leader by her members, and she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes the loan will allow her to grow higher yield crops so as to sell them for a higher price so that she can fulfill her dream of having a decent house for the family and an orange plantation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: I Wayan

texts.en: I Wayan receives his new loan to purchase piglets and also maintain his car. As a driver, he travels every day about 240 km, and his wife keeps the pigs at home. He plans to save all the profit this period for the preparation of his children's education. Now he has four children, and all of them are still in school. He has a dream to support his children until higher education.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and also maintain his car.

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Channa is a resident in a village located in the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 23 years old and single. To support herself, Channa works as a salesperson in a local bookshop in her village, and she is also involved in a trading business in which she gives the rice seeds to farmers for growing, and when the harvest season comes, she collects the rice which can be sold at the market. 
 
Channa has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle, while the other member has been with VisionFund for six cycles. The first loan has helped Channa to expand her business. She is now leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy more rice seeds for trade with the farmers. She hopes to make more income so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds for trade.

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en:
Leap is a 58-year-old married mother of eight children. Her family lives in the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has made a living through selling cakes for several years, while her husband works for others for a fee. 

Leap’s group consists of two female members who live in the same village. This is the second microloan for her group with VisionFund. The first loan has helped her to expand her current business and improve the standard of living of her family. Now she and her group member are requesting another loan with VisionFund of 1,200,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) each. Leap, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy more cakes for resale, and hopefully, this business generates her more income so that she can build savings for getting a new motorbike for her children.

loans.use: To buy more cakes for selling.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is a 41-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is a mother of five children, ages 20, 18, 15, 13 and 7 years old. 

She is engaged in retailing business, selling beauty and cosmetic products to the her friends and other buyers. This is the source of her income.

Charito is asking for a loan worth 18,000 PHP to buy more stock to sell such as cosmetics and other personal care items. Through this, she will be able to cater to more customers, thus giving her more chance of increasing her sales.

In the future, Charito wants to reinvest in her business so that it will continue to generate more income for the family and for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and personal care items to sell.

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en:
Yorn, a farmer, lives in a rural area of Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province. She is married and has three children, two of whom are staying with the family and helping with the family’s business. Growing corn on a two-hectare area of farmland is the main family business, which she has been in for 25 years. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR and allows her to save about 3,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Yorn’s group consists of four female members and she is in her first loan with VisionFund. Yorn is now leading her group to ask for another loan. She will use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her corn field and use a portion of it to buy pesticides. She hopes the crops will produce a higher yield so as to increase her income in order to expand her business and support her family to have a better life.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her corn field.

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.en:
Ismatullo is 20 years old, hardworking and dedicated to his own business. He is not married and lives with his parents.  

He is a farmer and has been raising seasonal vegetables for the last three years. He chose this business because it is profitable and his fresh crop is in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made of vegetables.

Ismatullo sells his crop in the local market. His father actively helps him to raise the crops.

As these products are in high demand, Ismatullo wants to expand his business and produce more vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 8,000 TJS. He will buy seeds and fertilizers and also cattle. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and cattle.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Don Julian de 53 años de edad,   agricultor, casado, con 7 hijos quienes tres de ellos de sexo masculino y 4 de sexo femenino, dos  ya casados y de los 5 que viven con el 1 es estudiante, vive en Sololá cultivando y cosechando verduras como cebolla, papa y maíz para luego venderlos en el mercado de su pueblo, lleva realizando esta actividad desde hace 35 años la cual fue el trabajo que le enseño su padre para sostener a su familia, y sigue haciéndolo ya que es la primer fuente de ingresos económicos para toda su familia donde lo ayudan sus hijos he hijas por tal razón se ve en la necesidad de seguir cultivando este tipo de verduras ya que próximos a entrar en otra temporada del año donde la cosecha es de mayor calidad y rentabilidad, donde el solicita un préstamo de Q4000.00 para comprar semillas de papa y cebolla así como  demás insumos agrícolas que el necesita,  el quiere seguir apoyando a su único hijo que sigue estudiando y su mayo sueño es verlo graduarse de una carrera académica
texts.en:
Julian, age 53, is a farmer.  He is married and has seven children, three boys and four girls.  Two of them are married, and of the five that live with him, one is a student.  Julian lives in Sololá.

He cultivates and harvests vegetables like onions, potatoes, and corn.  He later sells them in the market in his town.  He has been doing this business activity for 35 years.  This is the work that his father taught him in order to support his family.  He continues doing this work because it is the primary source of income for his whole family in which he helps his sons and daughters.

That is why he needs to continue growing these types of vegetables.  Another season is soon to start, and this is the season when the harvest is of better quality and more profitable.  He is requesting a loan for 4,000 quetzales to buy potato and onion seeds and other farming supplies that he needs.

He wants to continue supporting his only son that continues in school.  His biggest dream is to see him graduate with a career.

loans.use: to buy potato and onion seeds.

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
Gloria, quiere seguir trabajando con nuestra institucion, nos ha solicitado un crédito por que necesita invertir en la compra de productos para aumentar su inventario en la tienda, comprara Arroz, azúcar, carne, frijoles, detergentes, golosinas, papel entre otros.
El crédito anterior le fue de gran ayuda, ya que le permitio obtener mas ingresos y salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, la familia se mantiene en condiciones estables.
texts.en:
Gloria wants to continue working with our institution. She is requesting a loan because she needs to invest in products to increase her store’s inventory. She will purchase rice, sugar, meat, beans, detergents, sweets, and paper, among other things. 
The previous loan was a great help to her. It allowed her to earn more of an income and get ahead with the household expenses. The family is enjoying stable conditions.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, meat, beans, detergents, sweets, and paper

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 42 years old, married and has children attending to school. Her spouse provides motorcycle transport services, from which they gain income of about 3,000 Philippines pesos (P) each month that goes for their sustenance. She is now asking for P7,000 to buy tires and gasoline used in the transport business. This will help her spouse continuously provide the service.

The couple's main goal in life is to give the best education to their children as the greatest legacy to pass on to them.

loans.use: to buy tires and gasoline used in her transport business.

loans.name: Virgilita

texts.en:
Virgilita is from Sta Cruz, Jimenez. She is 42 years old. Virgilita is separated and has 2 children. To make a living, she makes and sells food. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns about 9,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2011, Virgilita joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Virgilita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is a married woman from Baclayon, Bohol. 

She is a merchant and a dressmaker. Charlyn sells detergents and personal care products to the people in the neighborhood. She works hard to support her family and and earn an income for the schooling of her children. 

Charlyn has requested a loan worth 25,000 PHP to purchase clothes, thread and items to sell. Charlyn hopes to have a progressive business in the future and experience the fullness of life together with her family and children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, thread and items to sell.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma is a 42-year-old woman who is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband, six sons and two daughters. Her husband is a heart patient and she always worries about his health. 

For 16 years her husband has run a wood shop, which is the only source of income for their family. All of her sons are very hardworking and help their father in his business a lot. 

As a member of an eight-person lending group that has requested a loan from Kiva partner Brac Pakistan, Najma will use her portion to help her husband in purchasing a wood machine and some wood material for his shop. As they have no other source of income, with the help of this loan, her husband will be able to continue his business, and with the net profit he will open a new shop for his son.

Najma dreams for her children's bright future and prays for her husband's good health. She wants to say that Brac is working very well in the field of micro finance, and she is very thankful to Brac and Kiva for helping her.

loans.use: To purchase a wood machine and some wood material for her husband's wood shop.

loans.name: Sabiniana

texts.en:
Sabiniana is a married woman and a mother of four school-age children from Baclayon, Bohol, Philippines. 

She is engaged in a food-vending business and makes torta. Torta is a sponge cake made with flour, egg yolks, milk, and salt, and it resembles a large cupcake. Torta is offered as dessert with butter, sugar, and/or cheese on top and some are made with raisins. 

This is a lucrative business for Sabiniana. Through this business, Sabiniana was able to support some of the needs of the family, especially the schooling of her children.

Sabiniana has requested a loan worth 10,000 PHP to purchase flour, oil, eggs and other cooking ingredients. Sabiniana dreams of making her own bake shop someday so that she will be able to sell more than what she normally sells. In addition, she wants to see her children become successful professionals some day.

loans.use: to purchase flour, oil, eggs and other cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Umedajon

texts.en:
Umedajon has run a clothes sales business since 2008. There are five people in her family. She lives with her husband, Nizom, and her three children, a boy and two girls. Her husband’s salary is low. 

Since last year, Umedajon has been rebuilding her house and there is still some work to be done to finish it completely. She wants to build a kitchen and a bathroom.

The loan of 4,000 TJS will be dedicated to covering some missing building materials for rebuilding her family house.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood and bricks for rebuilding her house.

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Bilha is a 28-year-old, single mother of three children, ages 10, 8 and 5 years, respectively. She owns a retail shop, a business she started 5 years ago, and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

Bilha has requested a second loan worth 20,000 KES to purchase bales of maize and baking flour, cooking oil, bar soaps and washing detergents for sale. The anticipated profit will aid her in buying additional stock for her business. Her dream is to purchase a piece of land and build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase bales of maize and baking flour, cooking oil, bar soaps and washing detergents.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina of Sibarok, Jimenez supports her family through a charcoal-making business. She’s a 60-year-old, married woman with 3 kids who tries her best to earn on her own. For 12 years, she has managed this business and earns about 4,500 PHP per month. For the time being, she’s in need of purchasing coconut shells for making charcoal. Paulina joined last 2011, and thanks GDMPC micro finance for the loan of 4,000 PHP they provided to her. Paulina desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells for making charcoal

loans.name: Urunboy

texts.en:
Urunboy is 51 years old. He is a driver and his work keeps him busy. He has been running this business for five years and has many regular customers. 

He lives with his wife and two children in a house that was built with great dedication by his father. His house is old, since it was built many years ago, and it is in need of repair. There is too much heat loss through windows and doors during winters, due to the damage.

Urunboy has decided to replace his windows and doors. He is requesting a loan of 10000 TJS to cover the cost of new windows and doors, as well as to cover the cost of hiring workers.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair his house.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu lives in the town of Tiribe. She is 39 years old and works at home in renting of wedding tents. She is married and has four children, all in school. 

Mesalimu notes that she has been working since she was still at her parents' home, and she brought these skills and experience to start her own business. She has been in this business for the last one year and she says that her profits increase during August and December, when many people have wedding ceremonies. By virtue of her work, she is getting ahead and helping her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy more tents so that she will be able to continue working and meeting her customers’ demands while at the same time helping her family.

loans.use: to buy more tents to rent.

loans.name: Ma. Evangeline

texts.en:
Ma. Evangeline is a retail store owner who lives at Cataggaman with her spouse and a child. To make a living, she patiently attends customers who buy grocery items for the people in their village. 

She is asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 because her income of PHP 300 a day is just enough for their sustenance. She wants to increase her sales. From her loan, she will buy soft drinks, noodles, canned goods and biscuits to sell. She hopes to keep extending good products and friendly service, leading to the improvement of her income and their life as well.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, noodles, canned goods and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Bohol, Philippines. She runs a tricycle transportation business. Her husband drives the tricycle, transporting passengers from one place to another. This is the source of their income.

Mercy wants to invest in another business to improve their daily income. At this time, she is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fuel, spare parts for the motorcycle, and piglets to raise. In the future, Mercy hopes to expand their businesses and save for future schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy fuel, spare parts for the motorcycle, and piglets to raise

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mujeres alegres.
Este grupo está conformado por la señora Rosa ella es originaria de aldea pacorral Tecpán Guatemala, se dedica a la  elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace años ya que es el único medio que ella ha tenido para ayudar a su familia, gracias a Dios su producto se vende muy bien, su punto de venta es en el mercado municipal de la localidad donde ella vive, el sueño de ella es poder tener un negocio más grande para obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar la calidad de vida tanto para ella como para su familia, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos típicos.
texts.en:
Dúo Mujeres Alegres.

One of the members of Dúo Mujeres Alegres is Sra. Rosa. She is a native of the village of Pacorral in Tecpán, Guatemala. She has been weaving traditional goods by hand for years because it is the only means she has had to help her family. Thankfully, her products sell very well. Her point of sale is in the town market in the area where she lives.

Her dream is to have a larger business in order to earn more income and improve her own and her family’s quality of life. She is requesting this loan to purchase the materials to make traditional woven goods..

loans.use: to purchase the materials to make her traditional woven goods.

loans.name: Boya

texts.en:
Boya, age 28, is a person who devotes himself completely to his work. He does this with the determination to get ahead and to give his wife and one child all of the necessities. He operates a motorcycle taxi.

Boya works transporting people to different destinations like schools, churches, and the different departments in the country. He wishes to improve his business. He is requesting a loan from Yehu to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle. His safety and that of his customers is very important to Boya. The replacement parts will also allow him to have very good references, and more people interested in contracting his services.

What Boya yearns for the most is to be able to get ahead and to have better stability for his household and his family.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Jose Camilo

texts.es:
José, tiene su propio negocio de venta de lácteos, está casado, vive con su familia, no tiene hijos, el trabajo lo aprendió por cuenta propia y tiene catorce años de experiencia.
Ha solicitado un crédito con la empresa porque necesita comprar mercadería como lo son: leche, queso, crema, requesón, quesillo, cuajada, y loroco.
El crédito le ayudara a mejorar su negocio y generar más ingresos para el hogar, los sueños que él pretende que se le realicen es en primer lugar mejorar su negocio y  su casa, para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José has his own business selling dairy products.  He is married, lives with his family, and has no children.  He learned the work on his own and has 14 years of experience.

He has requested a loan with the organization because he needs to buy merchandise such as milk, cheese, cream, curd, soft cheese, and loroco [an edible flower].  The loan will help him improve his business and generate more income for his household.

The dreams he hopes come true for him are, above all, to improve his business and his house, to be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy milk, cheeses, and curd.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 40 years old. She is married with five children. Mercedes is a responsible mother who is engaged in a retailing business. She has been in her sari-sari (convenience) store business for three years and earns about 300 Philippines pesos (PHP) a day. 

Mercedes wants to have more groceries to sell. To make it possible, Mercedes is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, bread and condiments to sell in her business. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, bread and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married with two children. She is 42 years old and lives in Dinas, Sinacaban. Marilyn owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for seven years and earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Marilyn is a new member of Kiva's partner GDMPC. Marilyn aims to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha, 27, is a single lady who has her own business. She has had a small store for four years in a strategically located spot in the town of Tiribe. She sells assorted articles of clothing like shirts, blouses, and khangas (traditional African cloth garments) for cash and on credit. Thanks to her sacrifice, she’s getting ahead and also helping her parents with everyday expenses.

She’s asking for the loan to increase her stock of clothing because sales always increase, and she wants to be prepared in the best way possible to provide her customers with a variety of quality clothing.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna is 40 years old, married and has three children. 

To earn income for daily allowances, she sells grocery items from her small store at the village where they live. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to invest in buying noodles, biscuits, breads, and eggs to sell. She would like to make her business more profitable so she can pay the tuition fees of her children. 

Some day, Digna hopes to reach a good income and keep investing for the progression of the small retail business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, biscuits, breads, and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is a 63-year-old resident of Rizal, Jimenez. She provides for her five children's needs from income from her own piggery business and from her husband's income. She earns 4,000 PHP monthly from her piggery business, a business she has operated for 12 years. In 2008 she became a member of GDMPC. She has applied for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies for her pigs. Divina wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is from Rizal, Jimenez. She is 42 years old. Margie is married and has six children. To make a living, Margie is raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for nine years and earns 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Margie joined GDMPC. Margie is requesting a loan of 2,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Don Vicente  tiene  55 años de edad,  soltero, hombre trabajador con muchas ganas de salir adelante con su familia, el tiene 8  hijos quienes 5 de ellos ya casados y actualmente viven con el dos de sus hijos de 18 y 20 años de edad que son estudiantes y una hija de 15 años de edad,  vive  en Sololá, cultivando verduras como  papa, cebolla, ejote, y maíz  para luego  cosecharlas y comercializarlas en el lugar de su residencia, realiza este trabajo desde que tenía 18 años  cuenta que esta labor lo heredo de su padre donde  creció en el trabajo de la agricultura,  el sigue realizando esto ya que es la fuente de mayores ingresos económicos para su familia, por la misma razón quiere seguir cultivando mas cantidades de verduras  para obtener mejores ganancias, el solicita un crédito de Q 3,000.00 quetzales para comprar más semillas e insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de papa que es la verdura que se siembra en esta época del año,  el sueña en un futuro  seguir dándoles  mejores estudios académicos a sus hijos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Vicente is 55 years old and single.  He is a hard-working man with a great desire to get ahead with his family.  He has eight children; five of them are married.  He currently lives with two of his sons, ages 18 and 20, who are students, and his 15 year old daughter.  He lives in Sololá.  

He grows vegetables like potatoes, onions, green beans, and corn.  He later harvests them and sells them where he lives.  He has been doing this work since he was 18 years old.  He says that he inherited this work from his father, and that he grew up with farm work.  

He continues doing this because it is the source of greater financial income for his family.  For the same reason he wants to continue to grow larger quantities of vegetables in order to get better income.

He is requesting a loan for 3,000 quetzales to buy more seeds and farming supplies for his potato crop.  This is the vegetable that he plants during this season.

He dreams in the future of continuing to provide his children with the best education.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 53 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. Ruth manage a gardening business and earns 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 15,000 PHP at GDMPC to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Ruth been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Ruth hopes to expand her gardening area to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a metal sheeting to install in the roof of her home

loans.name: Hikoyat

texts.en:
Hikoyat lives in a little house that badly needs repairs. Her husband Mirzoaly is a welder with a limited income. They have two children. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than 16 years but her income is not enough to repair her house. The bathroom of her house is in especially poor condition. She is asking for a loan of 1000 USD to buy a sink, tile, vat and Ariston (water heater).
In this way she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and stability that will allow them to progress. Each month she will make her payment on time. Help her and her family if possible.

loans.use: to buy a sink, tile, vat and Ariston (water heater).

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry, 30, is married with three children and lives in Naga, Jimenez. Jerry has provided barber services to local community members for 10 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Jerry joined GDMPC. Jerry is requesting a loan of 5,500 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to help improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for his barber service.

loans.name: Chet

texts.en:
Chet, 25, and single, is a farmer from a rural area of Ponhea Krek District of Kampong Cham Province. He plants rice and cultivates rubber to make a living and also supplements his income by germinating rubber tree seeds for selling. Chet has been been involved in these businesses for two years and he could earn approximately 40,000 KHR per day.
 
Chet is now in the second loan with VisionFund. He wisely used the first loan and, as a result, he was able to feed his family well. After the fist loan ended, Chet decided to apply for another and use it to spend on germinating rubber tree seeds. He hopes the second loan will enable him to germinate more seeds so that he can sell them for more money.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and plastic mulch for seeding rubber trees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mabel Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Mabel tiene 53 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos, vive con su hija y tres nietos. Su hija le ayuda con la venta de antojitos como: pasteles, tostadas, yuca, etc. Y sus nietos venden charamuscas, refrescos y chocobananos de casa en casa de los habitantes de la comunidad. Doña Mabel por su parte se encarga de atender la tienda que posee en su casa. Ella cuenta con más de 25 años en el comercio de comida rápida, como lo son: sandwich, hamburguesas, pupusas, hot dog, y la tienda es el proyecto más reciente que posee. Todo los productos que necesita los compra en la ciudad, cada ocho días para mantenerla surtida y cada 4 días si la demanda es mayor. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 quintales de arroz, 4 quintales de fríjol, un quintal de azúcar, 25 cartones de huevos, aceite, entre otros más y para cancelar una deuda que su hija posee con otra institución crediticia. La tienda la administraba su mamá, pero ella enfermo y la tienda decreció, por lo que espera que con el préstamo pueda fortalecerla y obtener ingresos estables para su familia. Su meta es, comprar ropa para venderla ahí mismo en la tienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Mabel is 53 years old and has four children. She lives with her daughter and three grandchildren. Her daughter helps her by selling snacks, such as pastries, tostadas, cassava, etc. and her grandchildren sell popsicles, sodas and chocobananos (frozen chocolate-covered bananas on a stick) from door to door to residents in the community. Doña Mabel in turn is responsible for running the store she has in her house. She has more than 25 years experience in selling fast food, such as sandwiches, hamburgers, pupusas and hot dogs. The store is her most recent business. She purchases all the products she needs in the city every eight days to keep her store stocked, or every four days if the demand is greater.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy four 100 lb sacks of rice, four 100 lb. sacks of beans, a 100 lb. bag of sugar, 25 cartons of eggs and cooking oil, among other items, as well as to pay off a debt that her daughter has with another lender. Her mother used to run the store, however she became ill and the store declined. Consequently Mabel hopes that with the loan she will be able to strengthen the business and obtain a stable income for her family. Her goal is to buy clothing, as well, to sell right there in the store.

loans.use: to purchase four 100 lb sacks of rice, four 100 lb. sacks of beans, a 100 lb. bag of sugar, 25 cartons of eggs and cooking oil, among other items, as well as to pay off a debt that her daughter has with another lender.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is married and has three children. Her spouse is a driver and provides motorcycle transport services to the people in their village, especially students. This is their only source of income. While her spouse provides the services, she is busy taking care of the household and attending to her children's everyday needs.

Felicitas is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy tires and gasoline to use in the motorcycle. She would like to ensure safe travels for the passengers and, especially, her husband's safety. Someday, with funds from the business, she hopes to buy hogs to raise them as an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy tires and gasoline for her husband's motorcycle.

loans.name: Sokhy

texts.en: Sokhy, a 34-year-old father of three school children, is a farmer who has struggled to provide for his family's daily basic needs. He cultivates two and half hectares of rice crops, one and half hectares of cassava-growing, and another one and half hectare of cashew plantings. He has been engaged in this business for 10 years, earning about 36,000 KHR per day and saving about 16,000 KHR after offsetting his expenses each day. Sokhy previously has taken a microloan from VisionFund (Kiva's partner). He successfully has paid back the loan which has supported his business and uplifted his family's livelihood, enabling him to keep all of his sons in school. Now, he is applying for a new loan, as sixth-cycle client, in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR. He will use this loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs plus a plowing fee. He expects to grow his cash crops on time so as he can sell them for a high price. By doing so, he is able to make more income and save some money to buy an additional plot of farmland to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs plus plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Glenda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Glenda, está casada, se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas y hot dog, es una mujer emprendedora capaz dé alcanzar sus  sueños; pero con limitaciones económicas es por ello que nos  ha solicitado un préstamo con el objetivo de generar beneficios económicos a su familia, la venta la tiene en su casa, las realiza todas las tardes, sale con sillas para que  sus cliente puedan desgustar cómodamente  sus productos al igual los ofrece para llevar los productos para su hogar.
El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en materia prima e insumos necesarios como lo son compra de pan, verduras, carnes, bebidas entre otras. Las ganancias que se obtengan serán utilizadas en el sustento de su familia e invertir el resto en su negocio.
Sus sueños y aspiraciones es crecer, tener más ingresos ,sacar adelante a su familia y mantenerse en el mercado.
texts.en:
Glenda is married. She sells hamburgers and hotdogs. She’s an entrepreneur capable of reaching her dreams; but because of her economic limitations she’s requsting a loan with the objective to generate economic benefits for her family. Her business is in her house and she sells every afternoon. She has chairs for her clients so they can enjoy her products comfortably. She also offers food for takeaway. With the loan, she’ll invest in the ingredients and products she needs, like bread, vegetables, meat and drinks among others. The returns she’ll generate will be used to sustain her family and invest in her business.
Her dreams and aspirations are to grow her business, make more income, get ahead with her family and stay in business.

loans.use: buy bread, vegetables, meat and drinks.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: La señora Emma tiene 58 años tiene 5 hijos ya todos independientes, la Sra. Emma se dedica a la elaboración  y venta de comidas (almuerzo),  se dedica a esta actividad hace mas de 21 , la Sra. Emma solicita el  crédito para  la compra de algunos electrodomésticos que le permitirá realizar su trabajo de un amanera rápida y eficaz se encuentra feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que se le están brindando.
texts.en: Emma, 58, has 5 children who are all independent. Emma makes and sells food (lunch). She’s been running her business for more than 21 years. Emma is requesting a loan to buy some kitchen appliances that will allow her to work faster and more efficiently. She is grateful for the opportunity she’s being given.

loans.use: buy kitchen appliances.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Dambae district (Cambodia), Tha is the father of three kids. Two are helping the family's business while a remaining son is a schoolchild in a local public school. He and his wife have overcome their financial burden via the income received from their cash-crops, including beans, cassava, and corn. He has been involved in this business for 28 years.  

Although the declining price of cassava is a big challenge for him, he still puts more effort in producing a good quality of cassava, and therefore, he has formed a group of two, as third-loan clients, to seek a new loan. He is requesting 1,200,000 KHR, and his co-member is applying for 1,400,000 KHR. 

As a group leader, he will use his loan to pay for weeding his cassava field. He hopes to grow a fruitful cash-crop so he can increase his income and improve his family's living condition.

loans.use: To pay for weeding his cassava field.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married and has three children.  She sells different types of fish at the market. Her husband share in the responsibility of providing their children with all of the necessities. 

Rehema is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase larger quantities of fish, enabling her to fulfill orders from her clients who will recommend her to other clients due to her responsibility and freshness of her products.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of fish.

loans.name: Luis Dagoberto

texts.es: Luis Dagoberto de 59 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos, ellos se destacan por ser una familia muy unida y trabajadora. Luis se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijoles, negocio en el  cual trabaja desde hace más de 10 años, así mismo siembra plátano y vende sus hojas. Para mantener su cosecha libre de plagas Luis debe tener todos los cuidados necesarios. Solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar más semillas que sembrará en terreno que aún no ha aprovechado por falta de dinero y controles de plaga y maleza, de manera que pueda producir mayor cantidad de granos sanos, con los cuales garantice su comercialización, con lo que sus clientes, estén satisfechos de tal manera que sea recomendado con otras personas más y de esta forma obtener nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Luis Dagoberto, 59, lives with his wife and two children.  They stand out for being a close and hardworking family.  Luis makes a living growing corn and beans, a business he has worked in for more than 10 years.  He also grows bananas and sells the leaves.

To keep his harvest free of pests Luis needs to take all the necessary precautions, so he's requesting a loan with which he'll be able to buy more seed to plant, so he can produce more basic grains.  He also will buy pesticide, which will guarantee the quality of his products.

His customers will be satisfied in such a way that he'll be recommended to other people and so get new customers.

loans.use: To buy and plant more corn and bean seeds and to be able to control for pests

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables and rice.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.es: La Sra. Constancia tiene 34 años y es casada sigue con la actividad de venta de ropa  en la populosa feria de la ciudad de El Alto este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Constancia   va a usar este préstamo  para el anticrético de una tienda para su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de tener una tienda para vender el resto de los días,  ella va a utilizar los beneficios para dedicarse de tiempo completo a su actividad y todos los días de la semana.
texts.en:
Constancia, 34, is married.  She continues with her job selling clothing in the busy market in the city of El Alto.

This is her fourth loan sequence with the institution.  She's going to use the loan for an antichresis rental arrangement for a store for her business.

Her reason for requesting the loan is the need to have a store for selling on the other days.  She's going to use the profits to devote herself to working full time every day of the week.

loans.use: to pay for an antichresis rental contract for a store

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is from Naga, Jimenez in the Philippines. She is a 29-year-old, single woman with 1 child. Marivic runs a general store where she sells a variety of food and home products to the local community.  She has been in this business for three years and earns 3,000 a month. 

Marivic is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items, such as candy, shampoo, and soap, to supply her store.  She joined Kiva partner Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) this year. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to supply her store

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 34 years old, married and has two children attending to school. She operates a small store to earn income to provide funds for her family’s meals and their needs. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy sardines, sugar, biscuits, eggs and soap to sell. She has acquired more customers and wants to keep providing them with good service. Marites prays for her family's good health and would like to become a successful entrepreneur in the future.

loans.use: to buy food and household supplies to sell

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is a 45-year-old widow with five children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a four-room, brick house with a zinc roof. Amelia opened her kiosk in 2000 and is requesting a loan to improve her business.  She will use the loan to buy additional supplies, including noodles, beer, soft drinks, milk and rice, to stock her store.  She earns a good income and will use the additional revenue to support her children to go to university and enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies to stock her store.

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru: Икрому 36 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Икром еще школьником, присматривался за отцовских скотов, так как он был старшим сыном в семье. Он мечтал учиться на врача, но домашнее условия не позволял ему уехать в столицу и поступить в медицинский институт.  Им жилось трудно, потому что заболел отец. Условия были тяжелые. Икром и его мать занялись выращиванием  скота самостоятельно, а также создали фермерское хозяйство по выращиванию сельхоз продукции. Они много трудились, чтобы прокормить большую семью. Икром сейчас скотовод и земледелец опытный. Икром  обращается в нашу организацию второй раз.  Он запрашивает займ  на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки бычка и корма для скота. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ikrom is 36 years old, married, and has 2 children at home. 

When Ikrom was still a schoolboy, as the oldest child in his family he was expected to help his father take care of the cattle. Ikrom dreamed of becoming a doctor, but his family's circumstances were such that he couldn't leave for the capital city to enter a medical training institute. Life was tough because his father had become ill, and Ikrom and his mother took charge of raising the cattle themselves. They also established a farm where they grew agricultural products. They worked very hard to feed their big family. 

Ikrom is now an experienced stockman and farmer. This is the second time Ikrom has come to IMON International for a loan. He is asking to borrow 1,000 US dollars to purchase a bull and cattle feed.

loans.use: To buy a bull and cattle feed

loans.name: Furkat

texts.en: Furkat is married with three children for whom he wants to provide a good quality of life. It is for this reason that he began his own driving business five years ago. He has gained many customers because he provides good service, but his income is not sufficient to finance his house repairs. He must repair his house because it is in bad condition. He is requesting a loan to buy building materials to repair his home. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his house

loans.name: Hudson

texts.en:
Hudson is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He is married and has three school aged children. Hudson owns an electronic sales and service shop that he has operated for three years. He sells radios, televisions and other electronic gadgets. His business challenges include high taxation and a long process to procure stock. 

Hudson is applying for 41,850 KES loan to purchase more electronics and spare parts for repair and service work. He intends to save the extra income obtained from this loan to purchase a parcel of land.

loans.use: To buy electronics and spare parts for repair and service work.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong is 45 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school and one who is employed. To earn a living, she raises pigs at home and her husband grows beans and cabbages on two hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for 25 years. 

Kong's previous loan with VisionFund, which helped her to better support her business as well as her household, was successfully repaid. Kong is requesting her second loan for $1,500, which she will use to buy more pigs to raise. A portion of this loan will be used to support her husband's business for purchasing a water pump and drilling a well. She hopes to fatten her pigs and sell at a high price so that she can double her income.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 45 years old and has three children. She is married to Henry, a driver. He provides motorcycle transport services to the people in their village and earns P5,000 each month. 

Benedicta wants to increase their income so she is asking for a loan of P7,000 to pay for franchise renewal and gasoline for the motorcyle. This will help their operation. 

Benedicta and her spouse aim for a good income and to someday lift the family out of their poor living condition.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal and gasoline for the motorcyle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, es empleado y al mismo tiempo administra una venta de comida, es persona de hogar vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, en su trabajo fue recomendado por ser una persona capaz, en la venta de comida tiene seis años de estar trabajando y quien mayormente lo atiende es su esposa. 
El ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de gaseosas, pollo carne, pescado chorizos, frijoles y otros produtos,  el crédito le ayudara a mantener el negocio de venta de comida bien fortalecido, generar más ingresos para la familia.
El sueño a futuro es construir su propia casa, preparar a sus hijos con sus estudios y continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Julio is an employee as well as the manager of an inn.  He's a homebody who lives with his wife and two children.  He was recommended in his job for being a capable person.  He has been working in the inn for six years, and the one who most waits on people is his wife.

He has requested a loan to buy soda, chicken, meat, fish, sausage, beans, and other products.  The loan will help him keep his inn business very strong and generate more income for his family.

His dream for the future is to build his own house, prepare his children with their studies, and continue working.

loans.use: to buy soda, chicken, meat, fish, sausage, and beans

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana sells second-hand clothes and meat. She started this business in 2009, and now she is 33 and married. 

She is happy with the income that she is making every day. She is requesting a loan to buy more second-hand clothes and meat. 

Ana has four children to look after. She hopes she will be able to support her children to get a better education and that her family will thrive.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes and meat.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: MARIBEL TIENE 27 AÑOS VIVE EN LA ZONA DE VILLA JULIANA DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO, EN LA CASA DE SUS MADRE, CUENTA CON UN PUESTO DE VENTA DE CD'S CON 8 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO. LA CLIENTE CON EL TRANSCURSO DEL TIEMPO AHORRÓ INVIRTIENDO CON UN PEQUEÑO CAPITAL EN EL PUESTO DE VENTA DE CD'S. EL CRÉDITO ESTA DESTINADO A CAPITAL DE OPERACIÓN, COMPRA DE MERCADERÍA EN CD'S Y EQUIPOS PARA SERIGRAFIADOS, CON EL DINERO SOLICITADO INCREMENTARÁ SU MERCADERÍA PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO, EN CUANTO A SU EXPERIENCIA QUIERE AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO Y SU NIVEL DE INGRESOS, CUENTA CON ACTITUD DE PAGO Y BUEN EMPRENDIMIENTO EN LA ADMINISTRACIÓN DE SU NEGOCIO YA QUE LA CLIENTE SOBRESALIÓ SOLA A PESAR DE TENER 4 HIJOS, A LOS CUALES MANTIENE CON LOS RECURSOS DE SU NEGOCIO, HACIENDO ESTUDIAR A DOS DE ELLOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EL COLEGIO.
texts.en:
Maribel is 27 years old and lives with her mother in the Villa Juliana zone in the city El Alto. She has a CD store and has 8 years of experience in the field. As time went by, she saved up, investing her small amount of capital in the CD store. 

She will use the loan for operational capital--purchasing merchandise, CD’s, and screen printing supplies. With the money requested, she can increase the merchandise to stock her store. 

Regarding her experience, she wants to increase the size of her store and its level of income. She has a good attitude towards payment and is very entrepreneurial in the administration of her business. 

She has succeeded in spite of having 4 children. She supports them with the income from her business. She is making two of them study, and they are currently in school.

loans.use: to purchase blank CD's and a machine for screen printing

loans.name: Kimleang's Group

texts.en:
Kimleang is a rural resident of the Moung Russey District of Battambang Province. She is a 30-year-old mother of two children.  To fight against her family’s hardships, Kimleang has tried to produce a higher rice yields from two hectares of farmland. Her husband also provides extra income as a construction worker. She earns about 14,000 KHR per day from the current business. 

Kimleang has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for three cycles and has paid back the entire loan successfully.  As part of a three-member group, she and one of co-members are requesting a fourth loan of 1,400,000 KHR each and the remaining member, a first-time borrower, is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. Kimleang will use her portion of the loan to add to her existing savings, which she will use to buy a decent motorbike for her husband to use for a motor-taxi service to earn additional income. She hopes to earn more income so as she can maintain better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To add to her existing savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to run a motor-taxi service.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania has a second hand clothing shop in the city, which is her only source of income. She started this business in 2011 with working capital of $300.  The business is very competitive because many people also sell second hand clothes. Epifania is applying for a $1,000 loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Chhaily's Group

texts.en:
Chhaily is a 49-year-old mother of three. She and the rest of her family live in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, where rice farming is common. It is her main source of income. 

She has two-hectares for rice farming, from which she is able to make about 16,000 KHR per day. She has been with this business  for 25 years. For her, the declining price of rice and high price of fertilizer are her main challenges that lower her income. 

Chhaily's group has four female members-- all are first-time borrowers with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She and another two fellow group members are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each, while a remaining member is seeking 500,000 KHR. As a group leader, she will use her loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for transplanting seedlings. She hopes her yield will become more productive so she can increase her income and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice crop and to pay for transplanting seedlings

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: El Sr. Eduardo tiene  46 años y es casado con 2 hijos de la edad de 10 y 9 años, se dedica  a la  venta de leche y queso ya que tiene ganado vacuno y ovino, tambien tiene caballos  el vive en la localidad de Huanocollo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  Eduardo utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de forraje para su ganado,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero y necesita alimentar bien a su ganado para que le proporcione buena cantidad de leche y así de esta manera producir más quesos y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, Eduardo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado,  sueña comprar otras vacas lecheras. en la foto esta en compañia de su hijito.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 46, is married with two children ages 10 and 9. He makes a living selling milk and cheese since he has cattle and sheep. He also has horses.

He lives in the town of Huanocollo. This loan is his first loan cycle with this institution. Eduardo will use this loan to purchase livestock feed for his cattle. The reason he is requesting this loan is that he does not have money and he needs to feed his cattle well so that they provide him a good quantity of milk, and in this way he can produce more cheese and improve his income. 

In his business, Eduardo faces the challenge of purchasing the feed he has to buy every so often, and he will use the proceeds to improve his livestock. He dreams of buying more dairy cows. In the photo he is with his son.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Ten

texts.en:
Ten is 53 years old and a mother of six children, four of whom are employed and the remaining two attend school. Her primary business is rice cultivation, which she has done for 18 years.  Ten is able to save about 12,000 KHR per day after she deducts the necessary expenses. 

This is Ten's second loan cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund. She has used her first loan successfully to sustain her business, cover her children's education costs, and to save some money for future emergencies.  Ten now seeks a new 2,000,000 KHR loan to buy the necessary building materials to repair her house. She hopes to repair her house in a timely fashion so that she and her children do not need to worry during this rainy season.

loans.use: To fix purchase building materials to repair her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Om

texts.en:
Om is 33 years old and a mother of four children. She and her husband have been farming for 15 years on their one hectare of farmland to earn a daily living. 

Om is a new member of Kiva partner VisionFund. She is seeking a new $650 loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed and pay labor costs for her rice field.  She will also use some portion of the loan to buy clothes to resell and earn extra income. She hopes to gain a double yield and sell her rice at a high price so as she can upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay for labor cost for her rice field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Oen

texts.en:
Oen and her husband have been married since 2004 and they do not yet have children. They live in a village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Oen sells bananas and mangos. She buys them from fellow villagers and transports them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. Oen’s husband is a house builder. They also grow rice. 

Oen has requested several previous Kiva loans. She is now asking for a new $400 loan to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm and pay plowing fees.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm and pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Aimkan

texts.ru:
Айымкан 47 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Айымкан в качестве основного дохода с 1992 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки 1 коровы. Благодаря упорному труду Айымкан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 5 овец, ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айымкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота – молодняка для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Айымкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, и на следующий год отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en: Aimkan is 47 years old, married and has three children.  To provide the primary source of income, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 1992, having started this business with one cow.  Thanks to Aimkan's hard work, today her business contains two dairy cows with offspring and five sheep, and the monthly income amounts to 10,000 som.  In order to further develop her business, Aimkan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy young livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and repairing her house next year.

loans.use: to buy young livestock for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana tiene 60 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad y vive con su esposo y un nieto en el municipio de Esparta, Atlántida.
Hace dos años que comenzó con una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como arroz, azúcar, pan, refrescos, churros, dulces, café, frijoles etc. y medicamentos. Ella se dedica a atender su negocio de pulpería en casa y su esposo vende medicinas, como pastillas y otros. Ella solicita un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras para surtir su negocio con más productos como granos básicos, refrescos, churros y medicinas. Su objetivo es que las ventas se mejoren para obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su condición de vida. Ella piensa seguir trabajando y mantener su fuente de ingresos propios.
texts.en: Juana, 60, is married and has five children who are adults; she lives with her husband and grandson in the town of Esparta, Atlántida.  She opened a small grocery store two years ago where she sells food items like rice, sugar, bread, soft-drinks, snacks, candy, coffee, beans, etc. and medicines.  She tends to her grocery store at home and her husband sells medicines like pills and others.  She’s requesting a 5,000 Lempira loan to stock her store with more products like basic grains, soft-drinks, snacks and medicine.  Her goal is to improve sales to earn higher income and improve her quality of life.  She intends to continue working and retaining her own source of income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Adiel

texts.es: Adiel tiene 35 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos y  vive con ellos en el municipio de Morazan, Yoro. Ediel tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la compra y venta de granos básicos, como maíz y frijoles, además vende pan y refrescos. Los granos básicos los compra a los productores al por mayor y lo vende al detalle en su casa. El préstamo que solicita es por 5,000 Lempiras es el primer ciclo con ODEF y lo utilizara para comprar maíz y frijoles para tener surtido y poder incrementar las ventas. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio, piensa vender otros productos comestibles aparte de los granos, pan y refrescos.
texts.en: Adiel, 35, is married and has four children.  He lives with them in Morazán, Yoro.  Adiel has been buying and selling basic grains like corn and beans for ten years.  He also sells bread and soft-drinks.  He buys the grains from growers at wholesale and resells them at retail at home.  He’s asking for a 5,000 Lempira loan which will be his first cycle with ODEF.  He will use it to buy corn and beans to have stock on hand and be able to increase sales.  His goal is that his business grows.  He intends to sell other food items besides the grains, bread and soft-drinks.

loans.use: to buy beans and corn to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
DUO MUJERES SOLIDARIAS
Este dúo lo forma doña Rosa María, quien nos cuenta que es casada y tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando en la escuela, ella se dedica a la elaboración de comales de barro desde hace varios años y nos cuenta que solicita este crédito para comprar materiales para seguir trabajando en la elaboracio de comales y tambien para la compra de leña porque el poco que tenia se le termino y necesita comprar por mayor que es donde le sale más favorable, con su trabajo ella ayuda a sus hijos para sus estudios ya que  su esposo trabaja en la capital y baja cada ocho días o cada quince días y nos cuenta que lo que el le da no le alcanza, y espera que se le autoriza porque necesita superarse ella como mujer y su  familia,
texts.en:
Mujeres Solidarias Duo

Rosa María is part of this duo.  She says she's married and has four children in school.  She has made a living fabricating clay griddles for several years.

She says she's requesting this loan to buy materials to continue making griddles.  She's also going to buy firewood because what little she had ran out and she needs to buy it wholesale to get the best price.

With her job she helps her children with their studies because her husband works in the city and comes back every week or two.  She says what he gives her is not enough.  She hopes her loan is approved because she needs to improve her family and herself as a woman.

loans.use: to buy material to make griddles and to buy firewood

loans.name: Kumush

texts.ru:
Кумуш 64 года, вдова. Кумуш в качестве основного дохода с 1981 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 7,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Кумуш в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 дойные коровы с приплодом, 10 овец, 6 коз, 6 лошадей, ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кумуш обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота – молодняка для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Кумуш планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а также планирует отремонтировать сарай для скота.
texts.en: Kumush is 64 years old, a widow.  To provide the primary source of income, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 1981, having started this business with a sum of 7,000 som.  Thanks to Kumush's hard work, today her business contains three dairy cows with offspring, ten sheep, six goats and six horses, and the monthly income amounts to 10,000 som.  In order to further develop her business, Kumush requested a loan in the amount of 90,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy young livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and repairing a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy young livestock for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Bilimkan

texts.ru:
Билимкан 53 года, замужем. Билимкан в качестве основного дохода с 1982 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки овец. Благодаря упорному труду Билимкан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 20 овец, 10 коз, 2 лошади, ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Билимкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота – молодняка для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Билимкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, и отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en: Bilimkan is 53 years old and married.  To provide the primary source of income, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 1982, having started this business with a purchase of sheep.  Thanks to Bilimkan's hard work, today her business contains two dairy cows with offspring, twenty sheep, ten goats and two horses, and the monthly income amounts to 10,000 som.
