Mwanamkuu is requesting a loan with which she wants to increase her sales. She hopes to buy beans, rice, wheat flour, cooking oil, and all of the necessary ingredients for making the food she sells. She hopes to increase her sales, provide a better food service to her clients, and obtain new clients to generate extra income.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, wheat flour, cooking oil, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en:
Vaqif is a 40-year-old young man who is very hardworking and friendly. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives with his two daughters and wife in an IDP settlement. He raises seasonal fruits and vegetables in his garden. He has 10 years of experience in this field. With the help of AqroInvest, he was able to start his business.

Vaqif usually sells his crops from his yard. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on many families' tables in Azerbaijan and are also used to make fresh punch. He primarily raises grapes, pears, apples, peaches and plums as well as tomatoes, potatoes, cucumbers and carrots. His monthly income is 90 AZN.

Vaqif has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizers to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to increase his income.

loans.name: Vivian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vivian, vive con su esposo, no tienen hijos, ambos trabajan en el hogar, ella tiene el negocio de la venta de pupusas, surgió por el apoyo de una amiga, no tiene un horario establecido para trabajar, su experiencia le permite mantener un buen nivel de clientes.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como el maíz, repollo, gas, aceite, bebidas, esta compra le permite tener lo necesario en el negocio para continuar produciendo pupusas, de esta manera lograra atender de mejor forma a los clientes.
Su aspiración es tener una casa propia con su esposo, crecer en el negocio, crecer en su familia, continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Vivian lives with her husband, but they have no children. Both of them work from home. Vivian has a business selling “pupusas”, which she started with the help of a friend. She does not work according to a set schedule. Her experience has enabled her to maintain a steady number of customers.

Vivian is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as corn, cabbage, gas, oil, and beverages. These purchases will enable her to have what she needs for her business so that she can continue making “pupusas”. As a result, she will be able to provide better service to her customers. She aspires to own a house with her husband, grow her business, start a family, and continue working.

loans.use: to buy corn, cabbage, gas, oil, and beverages.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives together with the husband, who is a farmer, and 8 dependents in Asebu near Cape Coast, Mary sells fried fish and gari, which she has done for 10 years now. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family. 

Mary will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry and sell.  She will also buy bags of gari to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy fish and grai to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha, aged 47, is married and lives in Kakata. She has four children between four and 25. Three of the children live with her and attend school, while the oldest one is independent. For the past twelve years, Martha has been operating a pharmacy in her community. She is proud of this business because she provides first aid to the people in her community, and is always at their service. She learned this field of medicine from a local medical school she attended. She has requested a loan to purchase more medicines (Paracetamol, cough syrup, Amoxicillin, Amodaquine, etc.). Her plan for the future is to extend the pharmacy into a clinic, and give her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines (Paracetamol, cough syrup, Amoxicillin,  Amodaquine, etc.)

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi lives in Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school. She owns a grocery store which she has been operating for three years. In this business, Zawadi sells greens, flour, cooking oil etc.
Zawadi learnt about Milango through a friend, with the aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuation and inflation, purchasing stock and seasonal weather.
Zawadi is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy wholesale vegetables and tomatoes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business. Her plans for the future are to expand to wholesale grocery and to become a supplier.

loans.use: To buy wholesale vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Rorn is a 55-year-old villager from Pursat province, Cambodia. She is married and has four children.

To earn income for her family, she works as a rice farmer on her five hectares of farmland, and she operates a small grocery store to generate additional income. She has been involved in the rice-farming business for 22 years and in the grocery-selling business for five years. Each day she earns approximately 18,000 KHR and is only able to save approximately 4,000 KHR.

This is her first loan cycle with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She would like to use the loan proceeds to pay plowing fees. She hopes to have an abundant crop harvest this year so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia has been selling secondhand ladies' and children's dresses for four years now. Felicia's husband works with a press, and she uses her income to support him in paying their utility and accommodation bills. 

Felicia needs this loan to purchase more secondhand clothing to sell; she plans to expand her business with the resulting new profits.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand ladies' and children's dresses to sell.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinath is a 27-year-old married woman who resides in in the district of Kror Kor, in the province of Pursat. She is blessed with three dependent children --  two daughters and one son. One of her children is currently in school while the other two are too young to attend school. 

Sinath's income comes from her rice-farming business, which she has been doing for eight years. She earns approximately 25,000 KHR per day. The lack of water has challenged her rice-farming business. Sinath received a loan from VisionFund (Kiva's partner) one cycle ago. This loan helped her succeed in meeting her family’s needs and supporting her child’s schooling. 

Sinath is now applying for a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 KHR with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She will buy an additional plot of farmland and fertilizers to support her current rice-farming business via this loan. She hopes to increase her income so she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy an additional plot of farmland and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif is a 50-year-old man who runs a private business. He is on a pension but his primary activity is selling food products. He is a market vendor who sells different kinds of goods such as yogurt, sausages, candies, cookies and macaroni. He has been doing this for the last 18 years. He is responsible for his wife and three children. 

Yusif's business provides a stable income of 100 AZN. His older son helps to sell products from the shop. Yusif would like to increase his income and for this purpose he has applied for a loan of 1,800 AZN. He will use this loan to diversify and purchase more products for his shop. This will be his third loan and he has a good loan history.

loans.use: to buy more food products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and some new colored thread for her sewing business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, de 43 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Edgar, con quien tuvo 5 hijos, a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de su madre hace 5 años. Victoria es una mujer trabajadora, junto a su esposo se dedica al cuidado de su ganado, cuenta que posee toros, vacas y ovejas en cantidad. Pero su principal ingreso económico se centra en el bordado de faldas típicas, de diversos colores y texturas, los cuales vende a diversos comerciantes que llegan a su misma casa para negociarlos, comenta que en épocas de festividades como es “el santiago”, festividad en honor a los animales; vende más faldas y tiene más pedidos. Ahora ella se encuentra trabajando con mucho esfuerzo pues es en esta época donde tiene mayor ingreso, “espero aprovechar el máximo para obtener las ganancias que espero”, comenta muy contenta. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo que le brindaron, pues podrá seguir invirtiendo en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Victoria, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de telas para su bordado y si el dinero le alcanza también comprará ganado.
texts.en:
Victoria is 43 years old and a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband Edgar. They have five children who they care for in the house that she inherited from her mother five years ago. Victoria is an industrious woman who works with her husband to care for their livestock. They own several bulls, cows, and sheep. However, her main source of income is producing traditional embroidered skirts of different colors and textures. She sells her products to different merchants who come to her house to buy them. Victoria says that she sells more skirts and receives more orders during the festival seasons, such as the upcoming “El Santiago”, which is a festival that is held in honor of the animals. She is now working very hard this season in order to generate more income. “I hope to take full advantage of this time so that I can earn the most income,” Victoria says happily.

This is the second loan she has received from MFP. Victoria is grateful for the support that has been provided because she can continue investing toward the progress of her business. In addition, she promises to be punctual with her loan payments. She will invest the money she requested in the purchase of fabrics for her embroideries. If there is money left over, she will also buy livestock.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for making embroideries and acquire livestock with any leftover funds.

loans.name: San Jorge Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal, para ser mejores personas.
La Sra. Isabel, presidenta del grupo,  está  casada, tiene 3 hijas, es una mujer muy activa y promueve el fortalecimiento del comité. Ella cuenta que se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, y por este trabajo da a su familia lo que necesitan para solventar los gastos del día. Es una persona que tiene muchas ganas de progresar y así dar a su familia lo mejor.
Isabel solicita el crédito para la compra de electrodomésticos pequeños y de esa forma tener nuevos productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The members of this communal bank are from the city of San Lorenzo.  Their principle objective is the growth of each and every member, not only economically speaking, but also in terms of personal growth.

Isabel, the president of the group, is married and has three daughters.  She is a very active woman and works to strengthen the group.   She reports that she is in the business of selling appliances.  Through this work she is able to provide her family with what they need to cover their day-to-day expenses.  She is a highly motivated person and wants to give the best of everything to her family.

She is seeking this loan in order to buy small appliances and thus be able to offer new products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy household appliances for resale.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали житель города Истаравшан. Ему 20 лет. Он холост. Сафарали живет с родителями. Его отец находится на заработках за рубежом, а мать домохозяйка. Сам Сафарали имеет среднее образование. Он три года как занимается скотоводством. Сафарали разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Он берет кредит для закупа бычков и телят.
texts.en: Safarali is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  He is 20 years old, single and lives with his parents.  His father works abroad, and mother is a homemaker.  Safarali has a secondary education.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for three years.  Safarali breeds cattle for future sale.  He is requesting this loan to buy bulls and calves.

loans.use: to buy bulls and calves

loans.name: Blanca Herminia

texts.es:
Blanca, se dedica a la venta de carteras, ropa y gorras, ella tiene 34 años de edad, vive con sus tres hijos, es madre soltera, esta alquilando la vivienda, su manera de realizar el negocio es la venta ambulante, ya que esto le ha permitido mejorar el sustento de sus hijos, tiene seis años realizándolo, surgió por iniciativa propia, ya que su esposo la abandono, ella debía buscar los medios para generar los ingresos.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de carteras de cuero y también ropa en variedad de blusas, ropa interior, entre otra mercadería, espera aumentar su condición en el negocio, mejorando su capacidad de comerciante.
El objetivo de Ella es fortalecer el negocio, mejorar sus ingresos para que le den un mejor nivel económico en su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca sells wallets, clothing, and caps. She is a 34-year-old single mother who lives with her three children in a rented house. Blanca conducts her business as a street vendor, which has enabled her to support her children. She started her business six years ago through her own initiative after her husband left her. Blanca knew that she had to find a way to generate income.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy leather wallets and various types of clothing such as blouses, undergarments, and other merchandise. Blanca hopes to improve the condition of her business and increase her capacity as a merchant. Her goals are to strengthen her business and improve her income so that she can provide her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy leather wallets and various types of clothing.

loans.name: Sergio Neftali

texts.es: Sergio Neftalí de 24 años de edad, es un agricultor muy trabajador y responsable con sus clientes. Él vive junto a sus dos hermanos con quienes aportan para el sostenimiento de su hogar, Neftalí se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijoles y también trabaja para otras personas como jornalero junto a sus hermanos. Él solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más semillas para sembrar, abono y pesticidas, de esta forma Neftalí espera producir mayor cantidad de granos básicos y de esta forma aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sergio Neftalí is 24 years old. He is a very hard-working farmer, and responsible with his customers. He lives with his two brothers, and all of them contribute to supporting the household. 

Neftalí grows corn and beans, and also works for other people as a day laborer, along with his brothers. 

He is applying to Integral for a loan, which will enable him to have the money he needs to buy more seeds to plant, fertilizer and pesticides. This way, Neftalí hopes to produce a greater quantity of food staples and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for planting.

loans.name: Renante

texts.en:
Renante is a 31-year-old married man and a father of two young children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He is engaged in maintaining and servicing a mango tree plantation so that they can bear fruit. His work includes spraying mango trees with flower and fruit inducer to hasten the ability of the plant to produce and bear fruit.

Renante has been in this business for more than four years now.

Renante has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy materials to spray mango trees (flowering and fruit inducer). With this, he can cater to more mango growers and augment his income. 

In the future, Renante wants to improve his venture and save for the future schooling of his two children.

loans.use: to buy materials to spray mango trees

loans.name: San Gregorio Group

texts.es:
El comite San Gregorio tiene 12 integrantes  muy responzables en sus obligaciones, todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que día a día se esmeran mas y mas por poder dar lo mejor a sus hijos.
Eulalia es una persona que desde tempranas horas de la mañana trabaja, se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, ya sea infusiones de té, para mate y terere que son bebidas típicas paraguayas. Su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pero pese a ello esta contenta con lo que hace porque es un trabajo digno y por sobre todo honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar más remedios refrescantes, ya que en cantidad es más barato y tiene mejor ganancia.
texts.en: The communal bank San Gregorio has twelve members, all of whom are very responsible in meeting their obligations. All of them are women who are heads of their families. Each day they make more and more effort so that they can give the best possible life to their children. Eulalia is a person who works from the early hours of the morning. She sells natural remedies including traditional Paraguayan tea-infused drinks such as mate and terere. Her work requires a lot of sacrifice, but in spite of this she is happy with what she does, because it is dignified work and above all honest work. She is seeking this loan on order to buy more refreshing remedies. It is cheaper to buy in bulk, so this will result in greater profits.

loans.use: to buy refreshing remedies for resale.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del comité SANTA LUCIA decidieron adentrarse al proyecto   Fundación Paraguaya, para poder superarse ya que es una oportunidad excelente para las mujeres con garras y luchan por un futuro mejor para su familia.
Emilia es una de estas mujeres, ella vende todo tipo de bebidas, como ser vinos, gaseosas, whiskys, energizantes y demás y cuenta que tiene buena venta, ya que su negocio está ubicado en un buen lugar, ella es una persona que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante y lo demuestra día a día dando lo mejor a su familia.
Emilia cuenta que su sueño es poder tener un negocio más grande y así tener mucha más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes y a la vez ganar más dinero.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas en general, para poder surtir su local y seguir trabajando de la forma en que lo está haciendo.
texts.en:
The women of communal bank SANTA LUCIA decided to become involved with Fundación Paraguay to improve their lot. The institution offers an excellent opportunity to energetic women willing to work hard for a better future for their families. Emilia is one of these women. She sells all types of beverages like wine, soda, whiskey, energy drinks, and others. Her sales are good because her location is good. She has always fought to get ahead, and she shows that by providing the best for her family every day.

Emilia dreams of having a larger business and offering her customers a bigger selection, thereby making more money. She is applying for the loan to buy beverages to stock her store and continue working as she does now.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Emprendedoras"se originó a traves de promociones  que se hicieron en el barrio de las miembros, ellas son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio, se vieron contentas a la hora de formar parte del grupo ya que desean salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
La sra. Francisca forma parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de chipas, que es un alimento típico paraguayo. Nos cuenta que ella desde muy joven ha trabajado y sabe que esforzándose es la única forma en la que podrá salir adelante y darle a su familia lo que necesitan para un mejor día a día.
Francisca pide e crédito para la compra de almidón, manteca, queso, etc., con lo cual podrá hacer la chipa que luego venderá.
texts.en:
This "Enterprising Women" Committee originated as a result of recruitment efforts carried out in the members' own barrio. All the members are from the same area, friends and residents from the barrio, who were content to join together from the outset, because they wished to get ahead and help their families.

Francisca is a part of this group; she sells "chipas," the most popular Paraguayan manioc bread. She tells us that since she was very young, she has worked and she knows that putting forth a lot of effort is the only way to get ahead and offer her family what they need to advance day to day. 

Francisca is requesting a loan to purchase manioc (yuca) starch, butter, cheese, etc., with which she will make "chipas" and then sell them.

loans.use: buy manioc (yuca) starch, butter, cheese, etc., to make "chipas" to sell.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el 2º ciclo con 12 integrantes, son señoras trabajadoras que luchan por salir adelante en invertir el crédito en sus respectivas actividades ya sea en el cultivo de verduras y en la venta de comestibles.
La Sra. Celia y todas las integrantes se dedican en la venta de comestibles o también en el cultivo y venta de verduras. Todas las integrantes muy contentas y agradecidas por la ayuda se comprometen a seguir trabajando.
La Sra. Celia solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras para la posterior venta. Ella agradece a la fundación y  a Kiva por la oportunidad de progreso que reciben.
texts.en:
This communal bank is currently in its second loan cycle.  The group is made up of 12 hardworking women who fight to get ahead.  They will invest the loan proceeds in their respective activities, whether they are growing vegetables or selling food products.

Celia and all of the members all are engaged in growing vegetables, selling food, or some combination thereof.  All of the members are very happy and thankful for the help they have been promised so that they can continue working.  

Celia is seeking this loan so that she can buy vegetables for resale.  She thanks the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity to put these funds to work.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.es:
El Sr. Reinerio es cliente de la fundación desde hace varios años, el mismo vive en la ciudad de Luque, es soltero. El cuenta con un taxi desde hace dos año y trabaja en forma independiente desde esa fecha, cuenta con 5 operaciones canceladas en forma excelente con nuestra entidad.
Solicita nuevamente un préstamo el cual quiere invertir en la compra de un nuevo taxi, para que de esa forma pueda explotarlo y tener mayores ingresos. Dicho préstamo le dará un mejor margen de ganancia a su actividad, lo que le ayudara a mejorar su nivel de vida. Él está muy agradecido ya que gracias a la ayuda de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya ha podido crecer mucho.
texts.en:
Reinerio has been a client of the foundation for several years. He is single and lives in the city of Luque. He has had a taxi and been working independently for two years. He has successfully completed five loan cycles with the foundation. 

Reinerio is applying for another loan to buy a new taxi so that he can use it to increase his earnings. The loan will give him a better profit margin and help him raise his standard of living. He is grateful to Kiva and Fundación Paraguay because their help has allowed him to grow.

loans.use: to buy a new taxi.

loans.name: Frances

texts.en: Frances, 41, is a widow with three children who are between 12 and 28 years old. Only one of them stays with her at West Point. The other two are independent. She has been involved in her business for the past six years. She sells biscuits, candy, chewing gum, bread, sardines, milk and other items.  She started first by selling on the   open square of the market. Now she has a table in the market where she sells. She is requesting this loan to purchase more biscuits, candy, chewing gum, and sardines for the business. Her plan for the future is to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, candy, chewing gum, and sardines for the business.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a 23-year-old single beautiful lady who operates a food stall. She has gained a great deal of experience in sales. She has many customers. as people prefer her high-quality foods, her affordable prices and her unbeatable service. She is always there to serve her clients.

Mwanasha is an active lady who wants to get ahead in life. She believes the harder she works, the greater the recompense in the end. In the last few weeks, there has been an increase in demand for her foods and she wants to seize on that as an opportunity to increase her level of investment. 

Consequently, she is applying to Yehu for a loan to help her buy ingredients like wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, etc. She is certain that she will be able to repay her loan in the defined period and, at the same time, she trusts that she will be able to offer herself a better life.

loans.use: buy ingredients like wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor vive en casa propia,tiene 55 años de edad, vive en casa propia tiene tres hijo de dieciocho y treinta años de edad, quienes le ayudan a trabajar en la agricultura obteniendo los ingresos para subsistir.
El tiempo que tiene de trabajar propio en el cultivo es de aproximadamente  veinte años, lo apredio de sus padres ya que ellos se dedican a lo mismo.
Nos ha solicitado un crédito por que necesita capital para comprar tres sacos de abono e insumos tales como herbicidas, insecticidas  y  semilla  para la producción, este le ayudara mucho porque podrá tener el dinero para invertir en la productividad de maíz y obtener una mejor cosecha las cuales le dejaran buenos ingresos económicos. Su sueño es aumentar su nivel económico para salir de la pobreza y tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Victor is 55 years old and lives in his own home along with his three children, who range in age from 18 to 30. They help with the farm work so that they can generate income to support themselves.

Victor has worked by growing his own crops for approximately 20 years. He learned from his parents who were in the same trade. Victor is requesting a loan because he needs capital in order to buy three sacks of compost and supplies such as herbicides, insecticides, and seeds for his production. This will be a great help because he will have money to invest in the production of corn. As a result, he will have a better harvest that will generate good income. His dream is to improve his financial standing so that he can overcome poverty and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, insecticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Maharram

texts.en:
Maharram is 49 years old and married with two sons. He has bred cattle and sheep for the last 10 years. During these years, he gained the necessary skills and knowledge for effective management of his business.
 
He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells them at a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 220 AZN and this business is only one source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. He also sells fur because local people make blanket from it.

Now Maharram would like to buy more animals and for this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. He will buy one cattle and six sheep. This will be his second loan with AqroInvest and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy cattle and sheep

loans.name: Xaqani

texts.en:
Xaqani is a 35-year-old man who runs a private business. He is a market vendor, and his primary activity is selling food products.  Xaqani sells different kinds of goods such as yoghurt, sausages, candies, cookies, and macaronis. He has been doing this for 10 years. He is responsible for his wife and son.
 
His business brings him a stable income of 3,500 AZN, and his spouse helps to sell products in the shop. He would like to increase his income, and for this purpose, he applied for a 1,500 AZN loan. He will use this loan to diversify and purchase more products for his shop. This will be his third loan, and he has a good loan history.

loans.use: To buy more food products to sell

loans.name: Baxtiyar

texts.en:
Baxtiyar is 61 years old and on a pension. He is married and has three adult children. He lives with his wife and runs his small shop in the central bazaar. He has been selling men and women's clothes for the last 10 years. Baxtiyar's wife actively helps him to choose beautiful women's clothes, because she has good taste.  His son also helps Baxtiyar and works three days a week in father's shop. 

His business brings him 300 AZN income per month. However, Baxtiyar would like to increase his sales to 500 AZN. He applied for 2,000 AZN to purchase clothes for this season as well as to buy additional children's clothes to diversify the products he sells.  He is a trusted client of AqroInvest and this will be his second loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for the new season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy new rickshaw tires

loans.name: El Manguito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se identifica como El Manguito  ya que enfrente de  la casa de la representante hay un arbolito de mango, en eso  se fijaron para ponerle un nombre  su grupo  en la que se integra la señora  Maxima ,Lucila y Maria del Rosario ambas vive en un lugar llamado general Sandino . 
 
Quien se entrevisto esta vez es la señora Lucila ella es ama de casa, está casada con el señor   Rosendo  y con quien procreo  tres hijas que  estaña su responsabilidad  y están en primaria y secundaria.
 
  Ella se dedica su  actividad para apoyar a su  esposo con  quien se caso muy joven  para sí  poder obtener ingresos para su hogar  ya  que sus padres no los apoyaban con nada para  iniciar su vida de casados es por eso que decidieron  comenzar a trabajar, con cosecha de  café, maíz y frijol en la que da gracias a dios que les fue bien,  años después su  papa decidió apoyarlo y les dio unos centavos en la que invirtieron en la crianza de marranos  para luego venderlo en pie.

  Lo que desea de su actividad es seguir trabajando en su terreno en la cosecha de maíz y frijol par que con las ganancias que vaya obteniendo lo ahorre y apoyar a sus hijos que están estudiando y quiere que sean alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
This is the El Manguito group.  It is called this because there is a mango tree in front of the house of the representative.  They noticed this and used it for the name of the group.  Maxima is a member of the group.  The other members, Lucila and Maria del Rosario, both live in a place called General Sandino.
Lucila was interviewed this time.  She is a housewife.  She is married to Rosendo, and they have three daughters who are her responsibility.  They are in elementary school and high school.

She devotes herself to her business activity in order to support her husband, whom she married very young.  She works to be able to get income for her household.  Her parents did not support them with anything to start their married life.  

That is why they decided to start working with coffee, corn, and bean crops.  She thanks God that the crops went well for them.  Years later her father decided to support her, and he gave them a little money, which they invested in raising pigs to later sell live.

What she wishes from her business activity is to continue working on her land harvesting corn and beans.  She wants this in order to save the income she will be getting and to support her children who are in school.  She wants them to make something of themselves.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing and selling coffee.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Due to hardship, Elizabeth and her husband hope to earn sufficient income to satisfy their needs. Elizabeth is 47 years old and has four grown-up children. Two of them are still in college level and their parents want them to earn degrees so that they will find a good job someday. Elizabeth and her husband help each other manage their rice farming business to ensure high production. Elizabeth also engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income to support the education of their children. She planned to raise more pigs for sale but she doesn't have enough capital. Therefore, she is requesting an additional PHP 50,000.00 to buy feeds, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. Despite the hardships and difficulties she has encountered, she has the determination to improve the business, for she believes that her patience and hard work will bear good fruit someday.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Duo La Joya 2 Group

texts.es:
Dúo la Joya.
Es integrada por las señoras  Modesta de 51 años de  edad y María paula de 30 años de edad, doña Modesta  tiene una venta de consumo diario en su domicilio desde hace 6 años, el negocio es atendido  por su hija menor quien atiende el negocio desde las 6 de la mañana ya que doña Modesta viaja todos los días a las 3 de la mañana al mercado de  la Terminal a  la venta de verduras   de todas  clases y por la tarde atiende la venta de consumo diario mientras su hija   asiste a sus clases de nivel básico, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles y para la compra de verduras.
texts.en:
The Dúo la Joya group is comprised of 51 year old Modesta and 30 year old María Paula.  Modesta has had a business selling daily consumption products in her home for six years.  

Her youngest daughter tends to the business starting at six in the morning.  She does this because Modesta travels to where they sell all types of vegetables at the Terminal market.  She does this every day at three in the morning.  In the afternoon she tends to her the sale of daily consumption products while her daughter goes to her basic level classes.

She is requesting this loan to buy food products and to buy vegetables.

loans.use: to buy food products and to buy vegetables.

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy artificial jewelry and beads for making & selling jewelry

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien was born in 1967. She has three children. The oldest child is an adult and has been an employee. The two younger children are little and learning in school. She and her husband have made packaging bags for 18 years for a living. The total earnings of her family are about 5,500,000 VND per month. She has taken part in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND to buy metal scrap to recycle. She repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to make and sew more bags to sell. Then, she hopes her business will make enough money to pay for her children’ education fees.

loans.use: to make and sew more bags to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cloth to sell.

loans.name: Aishakhon

texts.ru:
Айшахон 45 лет, замужем, воспитывает 5 детей. Айшахон в качестве основного дохода с 2002 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 40,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Айшахон в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 5 овец, ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айшахон обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Айшахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а в будущем мечтает построить большой просторный дом для своей семьи.
texts.en: Aishakhon is 45 years old, married and raising five children.  To provide the primary source of income, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 2002, having started this business with a sum of 40,000 som.  Thanks to Aishakhon's hard work, today her business contains two dairy cows with offspring and five sheep, and the monthly income amounts to about 15,000 som.  In order to further develop her business, Aishakhon requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.   She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and building a large and spacious house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru:
Чолпон 60 лет, замужем, воспитала 3 детей. Чолпон в качестве основного дохода с 1987 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 500 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Чолпон в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 дойная корова с приплодом, 8 овец, ежемесячный доход составляет около 7,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпон обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку cкота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Чолпон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а также произвести частичный ремонт сарая для скота.
texts.en: Cholpon is 60 years old, married and raised three children.  To provide the primary source of income, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 1987, having started this business with a sum of 500 som.  Thanks to Cholpon's hard work, today her business contains one dairy cow with offspring and eight sheep, and the monthly income amounts to about 7,000 som.  In order to further develop her business, Cholpon requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.   She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and partially repairing a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Ulziijargal

texts.en: Mr. Ulziijargal, 22, is a professional photographer. He operates a photo studio in downtown Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He opened his studio last year and he has been trying to gain experience and improve his business day by day. Currently, he serves approximately 20-25 customers in a day. He takes many kinds of photos for many purposes. Now he needs to buy another multicolor printer with multi-action for his studio. It will give him more opportunity to print his photos with better quality. The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of the multi-color printer for his photo studio.

loans.use: To cover the cost of the multi-color printer for his photo studio.

loans.name: Lidia Ester

texts.es: Lidia Ester, vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores de edad que se dedican a estudiar. Lidia cuenta con una pequeña parcela en la cual se dedica por completo sembrando maíz y frijoles. Lucia tiene 41 años de edad  y a pesar de esto trabajo arduamente junto a su esposo realizando la siembra y corte de granos, gracias a lo cual han logrado salir adelante.  Lidia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar todos los insumos necesarios para la siembra, con lo que ella espera obtener mayor cantidad de cosecha. Así mismo desea comprar más pesticidas para garantizar el bienestar de su cosecha, lo que será de mucho beneficio para su negocio y  su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia Ester lives with her husband, and three minor children who are in school. Lidia has a small parcel of land where devotes herself entirely to growing corn and beans. Lidia is 41 years old, and despite this, she works hard alongside her husband carrying out the planting and harvesting. Thanks to this, she has managed to move forward in life.  

Lidia is applying for a loan, by means of which she will be able to buy all the agricultural supplies she needs for planting, so that she hopes to obtain a greater quantity of harvest. As well, she wishes to buy more pesticides, in order to ensure that the well-being of her harvest, which will be of great benefit to her business and her family.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies for maintaining her crops.

loans.name: Fakhriddin

texts.ru:
Фахриддин родился в 1978 году. Он проживает в городе Истаравшан. Фахриддин живет с женой. Он является отцом четверых детей. Жена Фахриддина домохозяйка.
Фахриддин занимается торговлей на рынке. Он арендует торговую точку, где продает курицу, ножки и куриные грудинки. Торговлей Фахриддин занимается пять лет. Он берет кредит для увеличения оборота.
texts.en: Fakhriddin was born in 1978.  He lives in the city of Istaravshan.  Fakhriddin lives with his wife.  He is a father of four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Fakhriddin is involved in sales at a market.  He leases a retail outlet, where he sells chickens, legs and chicken breasts.  Fakhriddin has been involved in sales for five years.  He is requesting this loan to increase his product turnover.

loans.use: to increase his product turnover

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new lace (used in clothing designs) in bulk.

loans.name: Luz Rene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”PACHAMAMA“;  La socia Luz René tiene 23 años de edad ,01 hijo y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de platería, la socia elabora aretes,colares,pulseras entre otros, la socia tiene un pequeño taller en su casa lugar donde elabora su mercadería, la socia trabaja de forma independiente y distribuyendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan como tiendas del sector turismo, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracia al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.


La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de pulidores, motas y piedras marinas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The partner Luz René belongs to the communal bank "PACHAMAMA", is 23 years old, has one child and has a live-in partner. She alternates her daily activities with her jewelery business. 

She makes earrings, necklaces and bracelets, among other things. She has a small workshop in her house where she makes her merchandise. She works independently and distributes her merchandise to clients who request it from her, such as stores in the tourism sector. 

She has been working at this business for a long time, and it is going well for her thanks to the determination she puts into each day at her business. It is in this way that she is moving her family forward.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of polishers, dusters and sea stones. She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her debt payments.

loans.use: to buy polishers, dusters and sea stones

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотиме 22 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Ее родители очень гордятся Фотимой, так как она честная и трудолюбивая. Фотима имеет опыт в шитье женской одежды. Она хочет реализовать свои умения и организовать собственный бизнес для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить свою семью со всеми не обходимыми средствами для проживания, начиная с продукты питания до современной технологии. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Fotima is 22 years old.  She is not married and lives with her parents.  Her parents are very proud of Fotima because she is honest and hardworking.  Fotima has experience in sewing women's clothing.  She wants to utilize her skills and organize her own business to improve her family's welfare.  With this goal in mind, she completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women and obtained a certificate.  She plans to use the resulting income to provide her family with all of the living necessities, from food products to current technology.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy a sewing machine in order to organize her business.  She relies on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine in order to organize her business

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: El Sr. Paulino  tiene 40 años, se dedica  a la construcción y remodelación de viviendas, el es albañil contratista, el vive en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Paulino va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción y algunas herramientas que le permitan realizar su trabajo de manera eficiente ya que tiene contratos que cumplir  , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en trabajo, el  Sr. Paulino va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar electrodomésticos para su familia, el Sr. Paulino es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: Paulino is 40 years old. He makes a living building and remodeling homes. He is a construction worker and contractor. He lives in the city of El Torno. This is the first loan he has taken out through the communal bank. Paulino will use this loan to buy construction materials and some tools that will allow him to do his work efficiently, since he already has contracts to complete. The reason he has taken out this loan is so that he can continue improving his work. He will use the benefits from the loan to buy household appliances for his family. Paulino is a very hard working person and is happy for the opportunity he is being provided with through this loan, as his construction business is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and some tools.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah, 31, is married and lives with her common-law partner and their three children. One of her children is in secondary school while two are in primary school. Her husband works as a mechanic.

She sells secondhand clothes door-to-door. She works Monday through Saturday in all her activities. She goes to the city to buy merchandise whenever she needs to. She’s been in the clothing business for one year now and it’s the most profitable one she has been in.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes. Her dream is to have a rental house.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Remember Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Remember” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 5,000,000 SLL for the entire group in order to invest in their businesses. 

Mariama is the leader of this group. Mariama is 40 years old and married with 6 children. Two are  in primary school and four are in secondary school. Mariama sells tomato dishes and has been in this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of tomatoes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie, age 30, lives in West Point with her husband and three children. Her husband is a mechanic; two of her children stay with her and are in school, while the other child stays with her aunt. Annie has sold body cream, body powder, body spray, hair grease, and hair accessories for the past three years. She likes this business because she makes a profit. With the profit she can improve the business and help her husband with the household expend. She has requested a loan to purchase more body spray, hair grease, body cream to improve the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more body spray, hair grease, and body cream to improve her business.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de champus,jabones y papeles higienicos,la socia tiene un puesto donde vende estos articulos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local dond epueda vender los articulos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar jabones,champus y papeles higienicos.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member continues her business of selling shampoos, soaps, and toilet paper. She has a stand where she sells these articles. She works from 8 am to 5 pm. With this business, she wants to raise her children. Her dream is to have a shop where she could sell these items. She is applying for the loan to buy soaps, shampoos, and toilet paper to sell. 

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy soap, shampoo, and toilet paper to sell.

loans.name: Simpson A.

texts.en: Pictured above is Simpson, a teacher at one of the schools in Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Thirty-year-old Simpson is married to a teacher and the couple has 2 children. Born in Moyamba in Southern Sierra Leone, Simpson has been in the teaching profession for many years now. Simpson is pursuing further studies in college and would like to use this loan to pay his college fees and use the remainder to buy household equipment.

loans.use: to pay his college fees and use the remainder to buy household equipment.

loans.name: Zagd

texts.en:
Mr. Zagd is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a small house in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Delgertsetseg, is 35 years old. His daugther, Urangoo, is 11 years old and a student in secondary school. His son, Badral is a year old and stays at home. 

Mr. Zagd has been working in Korea and just came back in Mongolia. Now he would like to start a furniture-making business, and his wife will sell the product. He is planning to build a work station for his business. He is a hardworking and able-bodied person. He is asking 4,000,000 MNT to purchase raw materials to make furniture to sell.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make furniture

loans.name: El Aguacate Group

texts.es: Doña Alicia tiene 38 años de edad y es parte del grupo llamado El Aguacate, dice que le pusieron ese nombre a su grupo ya que así se llama su comunidad y para que no se les olvidara el nombre decidieron ponerle el nombre de su comunidad. Ella tiene varios ciclos en este grupo y dice que aunque han tenido varios problemas porque el ciclo pasado dos de sus compañeras quedaron a mal en sus pagos ya que dos de sus compañeras to cumplían con sus pagos pero que ella sigue con el grupo porque  saben que son muy responsables y son personas que  realmente invierten sus créditos en sus negocios y que son personas que pueden pagar sus  créditos y que se apoyan mutuamente. Platica que  su esposo y ella tienen un negocio de elaboración de block, tabique y venta de graba, arena, dice que comenzaron este negocio con su esposo desde hace mas de 7 años y que lo emprendieron por que su esposo trabajaba en otro país en una constructora y cuando llego a México decidieron hacer su propio negocio y así sacar adelante a su familia. Dice que ellos tiene maquinas especiales para hacer block o tabique el cual lo venden por millares para la construcción y también venden carros de graba o arena o lo que pida el cliente. Dice que su negocio le gusta porque es bien pagado y otra por que puede estar el pendiente de sus hijos ya que su negocio lo tiene en su casa. Platica que esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para la compra de cemento, arena, graba, y para reparar unas maquinas con las cuales hacen el block y el tabique, también quieren comprar, tierra especial para hacer el tabique, leña para coserlo ya que es más laborioso el hacerlo pero mas resistente que el block. Dice que su meta es hacer un negocio grande de venta de materiales para la construcción donde pueda vender desde una taza de baño, azulejo hasta materiales para poner la luz. Las otras 10 integrantes del grupo se llaman Angelina, Emilia, Brenda Guadalupe, Alondra, Juana, Blanca, Maria Santos, Yolanda, Maria Cristina y Raquel ellas invertirán sus créditos en la compra de artículos para tienda de abarrotes, perfumes y cosméticos por catalogo, frutas y legumbres de temporada, insumos para cultivo de aguacate, en la compra de colchas por catalogo para vender.
texts.en:
Alicia is 38 years old and is part of the group called "El Aguacate" ["The Avocado"]. She says that they gave their group that name because that's what they call their community; they decided to name the group after their community so that they wouldn't forget the name.

Alicia has been with the group for several cycles. She says that although she has had various problems—in the last cycle, two of her fellow members fell behind on their payments—she is continuing with the group because she knows that they are very responsible, they are people who really invest their loans in their businesses and are able to pay back their loans, and they mutually support one another.

Alicia says that she and her husband have a business that makes cinder blocks and bricks and sells gravel and sand. She says that she started this business with her husband more than seven years ago because her husband was working in construction in another country; when he arrived in Mexico, they decided to start their own business and provide for their family that way. She says that they have special machines for making cinder blocks or bricks, which they sell by the thousand for construction. They also sell loads of gravel or sand or whatever their customer orders. She says that she likes their business because it pays well and because she can be available to her children since the business is run from their house. She says that she is requesting a loan from the lender to purchase cement, sand, and gravel, and to repair some of the machines that they use to make cinder blocks and bricks. They also want to buy special dirt for making bricks and firewood for baking them; it's more labor-intensive to make them, but they are stronger than cinder blocks. 

She says that her goal is to build a large construction-materials business where she can sell everything from toilets and tile to electrical supplies. 

The other ten members are Angelina, Emilia, Brenda Guadalupe, Alondra, Juana, Blanca, María Santos, Yolanda, María Cristina, and Raquel. They will invest their loans in the purchase of inventory for a neighborhood grocery store, perfumes and cosmetics from catalogs, fruits and vegetables in season, avocado-growing supplies, and bedspreads from catalogs to sell.

loans.use: to purchase material for making bricks, concrete blocks, and cinder blocks and to invest in gravel and sand to sell.

loans.name: Rec Pri Sch Russell Group

texts.en:
Pictured in the photo above are teachers from one of the primary schools in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown where “Shine On Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. School staff and other monthly wage earners in SMT’s operational areas come to SMT to apply for our Salary Loan Product. The SMT Salary Loan Product helps staff meet certain financial obligations that, left with their salaries alone, cannot be met. For example, they can pay school fees for their children, invest in their spouse's business or buy pieces of furniture. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar deducts the repayment from their salaries and repays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

Augustine is the leader of this group of teachers. The 35 year old is a native of Boyoh village. He is married to a teacher and the couple has 3 children attending school. Augustine has requested this loan to buy building materials like cement, zinc sheets, nails, etc. in order to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, zinc sheets, nails, etc. in order to build a shop

loans.name: Bazarragchaa

texts.en: Mr. Bazarragchaa, 41, is an army man. He lives with his wife and son in an old house which is located in the ger district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, an area of city with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity. His son is going to marry in the near future and he wanted to build a small house beside his current one as a wedding gift. Building work has started recently and he is planning to install a low pressure furnace to the new house for his son. As he believes, it will cut the coal usage completely and will be a natural oriented idea. The loan he is taking will be used to buy a low pressure furnace for the house.

loans.use: to buy a low pressure furnace for his son's house.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”PACHAMAMA“;  La socia Erika tiene 32 años de edad ,02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de compra y venta de ropa ,zapatillas entre otros, la socia viaja cada cierto tiempo a la ciudad de Tacna para comprar su mercadería para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades y compañeros de trabajo, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio ,la socia a la vez trabaja en un empresa privada 3 años , siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.


La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de zapatillas para su negocio.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: The member belongs to the "Pachamama" communal bank. Erika is 32 years old, has two children, and lives with her partner. Erika alternates her daily activities with her business of buying and selling clothes, sneakers, and other items. She travels every so often to the city of Tacna to buy her merchandise, which she later distributes to her customers, such as friends and colleagues, who request it. Erika has been in this business for a good amount of time, and it's going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. Erika has also been working in a private company for three years, which is how she supports her family. Erika is requesting the loan for the purchase of sneakers for her business. She is happy about the loan, and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase sneakers for her business.

loans.name: Las Peras Group

texts.es: La señora Graciela tiene 36 años de edad y es originaria de una comunidad llamada San Felipe de los Alzati una comunidad muy trabajadora el cual es uno de los primeros a nivel nacional en producción de flor de Noche buena o flor de Pascua, aproximadamente al año se producen arriba de 6 millones de flores las cuales se venden en el país y otras las exportan a otros países ya que hay varios colores y variedades como la color roja, la salmón, la blanca, la pinta y de variedades como la prestige, oreon red, maren, marble star, monet y la free White generando actualmente  624 empleos fijos y 328 temporales y el 60 por ciento de los mismos son para mujeres. Ella platica que le gusta mucho donde vive ya que es un lugar con un clima muy agradable además que por ahí pasan los turista que van al santuario de la mariposa monarca y a las ruinas arqueológicas de Zirahuato.  Dice que ella tiene un negocio de compra y venta de puercos desde hace 12 años y que tiene buenas ventas ya que por eso ha seguido con su negocio y eso la tiene muy contenta porque si ha podido ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. También su esposo y ella se dedican al cultivo de noche buena aunque no es una producción alta pero si les deja ganancias. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de cerdos y comprarles vitaminas y alimento y también para comprar abono para las flores. Dice que sus cerdos ella los vende a diferentes carnicerías de su localidad ya  que tiene sus clientes para vender los animales. La meta que tiene Graciela es hacer un corral mas grande donde sus animales estén en mejores condiciones y asi pueda venderlos a un mejor precio, también dice que le gustaría ampliar el vivero para poder producir mas flores y así darle trabajo a la gente de su localidad.  Las otras tres integrantes del grupo se llaman Emma, Maria Veronica y Maria Angelica ellas invertirán sus créditos en fruta de temporada y para insumos para hacer comida mexicana como quesadillas de diferentes guisados.
texts.en:
Graciela is 36 years old and is originally from a community called San Felipe de los Alzati. This is a very hard-working community and one of the top producers of poinsettias in the nation. Over six million flowers are produced every year. They are sold within the country and exported abroad, since there are several colors such as red, coral, white, and brown, and varieties like Prestige, Oreon Red, Maren, Marble Star, Monet, and Free White. This currently generates 624 permanent jobs and 328 seasonal jobs, 60% of which are for women. She says she really likes where she lives because it is a place with very nice weather and tourist pass through there on their way to the Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary and the archeological ruins of Zirahuato. 

She says she has been in business buying and selling pigs for twelve years. Since sales are good, she has been able to keep the business going and that makes her very happy because it has allowed her to help her husband with home expenses. She and her husband also work growing poinsettias. They don't produce large quantities, but they make a profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase pigs and buy them food and vitamins, and also to purchase fertilizer for the flowers. She says she sells her pigs to different local butcher shops, since she has customers who buy the animals. Graciela's goal is to build a larger corral so that her animals can be better kept and she may sell them at a better price. She also says she would like to expand the nursery so that she can grow more flowers and create jobs for people in her community. 

The other three members of the group are Emma, Maria Veronica, and Maria Angelica. They will invest their loans in seasonal fruit and supplies for making Mexican food like quesadillas with different fillings.

loans.use: to raise and sell pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fast food cart and increase the variety of the products that she offers her customers.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de pan y elaboracion de pan ,la socia tiene una panaderia donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora y su sueño es tener un local mas grande donde pueda vender los panes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos como harina,azucar y manteca para que elabore los panes.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is still working in her business of baking and selling bread. She has a bakery where she works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman, and her dream is to have a larger shop where she can sell her breads. The member is requesting the loan to buy supplies like flour, sugar, and butter to bake the bread.

The member is happy about the loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, sugar, and butter to bake bread.

loans.name: Ovidio De Jesus

texts.es:
Ovidio tiene 2 hijos y se encuentra separado de la madre de sus hijos, por lo que las responsabilidades del sostenimiento de sus hijos están todas a cargo suyo y por esto requiere una buena fuente de ingresos para su familia. Hace 3 años quedó desempleado y en busca de poder responder económicamente con sus obligaciones, un amigo suyo le ofreció el negocio de vender ropa. Fue así como inició con este negocio el cual hasta el día de hoy le ha permitido generar los ingresos que requiere en su hogar y así poder sostener su familia. Debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital, Ovidio busca un préstamo para comprar ropa y responder a los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder seguir saliendo adelante y superar las adversidades que le presenta la vida, ofreciéndoles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en: Ovidio has 2 children and is separated from the mother of his children, so that the responsibility of supporting them rests entirely with him.  For this reason he needs a good source of income for his family.  Three years ago he was unemployed and searching for a way of meeting his financial obligations when a friend offered him a business selling clothing.  In this way he began the business, which has permitted him up until now to earn enough income to support his family.  Because he does not have much capital, Ovidio is requesting a loan to buy clothing in order to fill the orders that he has from his customers.  His dream is to be able to continue getting ahead and overcoming the adversities in his life, and to provide his children with a better quality of life and a better quality education.

loans.use: to buy clothing in order to fill the orders that he has from customers.

loans.name: Edilma De Jesus

texts.es:
Edilma se encuentra casada, tiene 3 hijos y debido a que los ingresos que genera su esposo no eran suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar, decidió comenzar a trabajar en diferentes actividades para poder aportar económicamente a su familia y así poder gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Fue así como inició trabajando en un almacén vendiendo productos de uso personal, posteriormente pasó a trabajar en una cafetería, y debido a que estas actividades eran muy esclavizantes y Edilma necesitaba cuidar a sus hijos, decidió tomar el camino de manera independiente y comenzó a vender productos por su cuenta. Con una conocida suya logró contactar con una empresa de aseo y ahora tiene la oportunidad de vender productos de aseo, y también diversifica sus ventas vendiendo productos de uso personal. Como no cuenta con un gran capital, ha visto como deja de responder a grandes pedidos de sus clientes, pero buscando cambiar esta situación Edilma busca un préstamo para comprar productos de aseo y responder a los pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder sacar este negocio adelante y continuar progresando junto a sus 3 hijos, ofreciéndoles una buena calidad de vida en el hogar y mejores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Edilma is married with three children. Since her husband's income wasn't enough to cover home expenses, she decided to work different jobs so that she could contribute financially to her household and therefore enjoy a better quality of life. That is how she started working in a shop selling cleaning products and later in a coffee shop. But since those jobs were grueling and Edilma had to take care of her children, she decided to start her own business and started selling products on her own. Through an acquaintance of hers, she was able to contact a cleaning company and now has a chance to sell cleaning products and also diversify her sales by selling personal products. Since she doesn't have a lot of capital, she has had to turn down some of her customers' larger orders, so Edilma is requesting a loan so that she can change this situation. She will buy enough cleaning products to respond to the orders she receives from her customers. 

Her dream is to keep the business going and continue moving forward with her three children by offering them a good quality of life at home and better financial opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning products and respond to her customers' orders.

loans.name: Sorbeh Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sorbeh II” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mahawa, a native of Port Loko in Northern Sierra Leone. Currently, she is  residing in Waterloo with her husband and three children. Her husband is a driver and her children are attending primary schools. For many years,  Mahawa has been selling market food  such as rice, palm oil and tomatoes. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy more of these items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Altantsetseg, 33, works as a master in the bakery house. She has been doing her job since 1999 nonstop and most of her customers say her baked creations are very delicious. She lives with her husband and her 7-year-old son in her small family house in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. His husband is an invalid and he receives benefits from the government. In 2007, her family owned their land plot and started building their current house, which is not too spacious. Also, her house becomes cold inside and loses heat through the walls in the winter. So, she decided to insulate the walls and add one more room to her house. Her house will be warm and comfortable after the renovation. The loan she is taking will be used for the wall insulation and house extension.

loans.use: to insulate the walls of her house and add a room extension.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa, 37, works as a nurse in the medical center. She is unmarried and lives with parents and two brothers in her house which was built many years ago. The house loses heat through the walls and some other parts. In the winter, the family is very cold and uses the coal-fired stove to stay warm. Before the next winter, she wants to repair her house and insulate the walls. It will be very beneficial to reduce her cost of coal purchasing. Also, it will be beneficial to the environment to reduce her coal usage in winter. The loan she is taking will be used to buy the insulation materials such as foam and cement for the walls of her old house.

loans.use: to buy the insulation materials such as foam and cement for the walls of her old house.

loans.name: Paula Andrea

texts.es:
Paula se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 9 años de edad, y por la necesidad de ayudar económicamente en su hogar comenzó a vender ropa a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos. A pesar del poco tiempo que lleva con su negocio y la falta de capital que tiene, su esfuerzo le ha permitido ir creciendo poco a poco y así ir ofreciendo en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos y su esposo. Paula busca un préstamo para comprar ropa y así responder a un gran pedido que tiene el cual no ha podido satisfacer por falta de capital.

Su sueño es cada día tener un negocio más grande y en un futuro poderles ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y el acceso a una educación de mejor calidad para sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
Paula is married and has two children who are 4 and 9 years old. Due to the need for her to assist her household economically, she began selling clothing to her friends, family and neighbors. Despite having a short period of time with her business and her lack of capital, her efforts have allowed her to grow little by little. As such she has offered a better quality of life in her home for her children and husband. Paula seeks a loan to buy clothing and as such, respond to a large order that she has not been able to fulfill due to a lack of capital.

Her dream is to grow her business more each day and in the future to be able to offer family a better quality of life and access to a better education for her two children.

loans.use: to buy clothing and as such respond to a large order that she has not been able to fulfill due to a lack of capital.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc was born in 1981. She has a nuclear family and she and her husband are commune officers. Her family’s income is about 6,500,000 VND per month. She has two children. Her youngest child was just born and her eldest is in the first grade. 

Ngoc has been participating in SEDA's credit program since 2008. During the last cycle she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. 

In this loan cycle she is requesting a loan of 9,632,000 VND to buy pig feed and pigs to raise and sell. She hopes that her business will make enough profit to pay for her child's school fees.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Ana Roxana

texts.es: La Sra.  Ana tiene 23 años,  se dedica  a la   venta de variedad de ropa en especial variedad de poleras, ella tiene un puesto fijo en la comunidad de Cutusuma,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ana va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de  poleras por mayor y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio y también que se acerca la época de calor y las poleras tiene n mucha demanda, la Sra. Ana va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa, la Sra. Ana es una persona muy joven trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es su unica actividad con la que se mantiene y mantiene a su familia que esta conpuesta por sus padres y hermanos.
texts.en: Ana, 23, sells a variety of clothing especially assorted t-shirts.  She has a fixed stand in the community of Cutusuma where she sells her products.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution. Ana will use this loan to buy an assortment of t-shirts at wholesale in order to have a wide variety available for her customers and increase profits.  Her reason for requesting the loan is to continue improving her business and also because the hot season is approaching and t-shirts are in high demand.  Ana will use profits to continue buying a variety of clothes.  Ana is a hardworking young woman who feels happy about the opportunity being give her since this is the only activity she has to support herself and her family composed of her parents and siblings.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts.

loans.name: Santusa Leonor

texts.es: La socia es la señora Leonor, ella tiene 74 años de edad, casada con 5 hijos adultos, la socia se dedica al comercio de maíz, el cual distribuye en los mercados de su provincia como semilla, para consumo directo y producción de jora que es el principal insumo para la elaboracion de la chicha de jora, Leonor  realiza este trabajo hace muchos años y esta le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia y ahora le proporciona los medios económicos para vivir. Leonor en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar maíz y capitalizar de esta manera su comercio, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a mantenerse en su actividad, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Leonor pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón Salvador del Mundo” del distrito de San Salvador de la  provincia de Calca en Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Leonor, 74, is married and has five adult children.  She is a corn merchant.  She sells it in seed form to local markets in her province to be consumed as is and also to make “jora” which is the main ingredient used to make “chicha de jora” [corn-based beverage].  Leonor has been doing this for many years and this has made it possible for her to raise her family and now provides her with the means to live.

On this occasion, Leonor is requesting the loan to buy corn and thus capitalize her business.  She is therefore very grateful to Kiva for helping her to stay in business.  She commits to make her installment payments punctually. 

Leonor belongs to the “Patrón Salvador del Mundo” in San Salvador District, Calca Province in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON est formé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Justine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Justine est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un certain Lambert. Le couple a un enfant non scolarisé et à leur charge. Justine vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Justine n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a une huitaine d’année environs que Justine mène comme activité la vente des vêtements et des produits cosmétiques à son domicile. Justine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Justine n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Justine et les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON sollicitent ensemble un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The  MAHUGNON  group is made up of four people who live in the same district.  The leader of the group, named Justine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  This is the third time that this group has requested financial help through ALIDé in order to grow their businesses.  Justine is 30 years old and married to Lambert.  The couple has one child, who does not attend school, in their care.  
Justine lives with her child and husband.   Together, the couple meets the various needs of the household.  Justine did not attend school.  For about eight years, she has been in the business of selling clothing and cosmetic products from her home.  Justine gets her supplies at a market in Bénin.  Her customers’ demand is growing, and considering her limited means, she is no longer able to meet their demand.   In light of this and considering their limited resources, Justine and the other members of the MAHUGNON group are requesting together a third loan through ALIDé.  The first two loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment that he needs to increase the coverage of the cable television signal.

loans.name: Nicolas Alberto

texts.es:
Desde muy joven Nicolas aprendió la actividad de la agricultura por parte de su padre que se dedicaba a esta actividad y se la enseñó para trabajar a su lado.
