In this way, she hopes to keep increasing her sales and overcome the difficulties she has with capital, as well as have more income for her family. Her dream is to open a supermarket where she can generate employment for the neediest people.

loans.use: to do some remodeling on her store, expanding it to have more space where she can offer more products.

loans.name: Srikandi 2 Group

texts.en:
Ni Wayan is 55 years old and lives in Baturiti, in the middle part of Bali.  She is married and her husband works as a farmer.  Though Ni Wayan often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income.  She has been raising pigs for 5 years.  

Ni Wayan is the head of the Srikandi 2 group, which is made up of 8 neighbors from the same village.  This is the group’s first loan with MUK.  With the 2,500,000 IDR that Ni Wayan receives, she will purchase three piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as fattening pigs.  With her earnings, she plans to purchase more piglets.  With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to renovate her kitchen.

Ni Wayan is on the right, wearing glasses.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 42, is a married man and has four children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. He has been a grocery store owner for 12 years. He started his own grocery store with a small amount of capital. He’s a very hardworking man and helps his children have a good life. 

To help continue operations of his business, he is requesting a loan of 350,000 YER to buy rice, sugar, beans, candy, snacks, condiments, soft-drinks, groceries, etc. to expand his product inventory. He hopes to enroll his children in school and keep his store stocked so that he can earn income.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, candy, snacks, condiments, soft-drinks, groceries, etc.  for his business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a happy man who treats everyone well because of his opportunities to get ahead. He has a house where he lives with his five children in Sana`a, Yemen. He is an employer in the ministry of agriculture, and he applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy electronics materials for his house.

loans.use: to buy electronics materials for his house.

loans.name: Loza Group

texts.en:
This group is called Loza and consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Afrah is 30 years old (she is the second woman from the right side in the photo). She has four children. She has been a sewer for only one year. She works hard to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

During her one year of experience with this typical home-based business activity, she has been able to build up a nice clientele, and she has been successfully meeting her clients' orders.  She applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER to buy fabrics for her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Mriam

texts.en: Mriam, 50, is a hardworking woman. She has eight children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a housewife. She says that she likes her business because it provides a steady income for supporting her family. She intends to buy a rickshaw. She saved an amount to buy a rickshaw, but it isn't sufficient to cover the rickshaw price, so she applied for a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy a rickshaw for transportation.  She hopes to have a grocery store and a bus.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for transportation.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam is requesting a new loan to buy more furniture for her food stall and to buy a motorbike for transportation. This purchase will help her to better attract her customers and provide her family with a means of transportation. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more furniture for her food stall and buy a motorbike for transportation.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety of vegetables, such as spinach, garlic, cabbage, and carrots. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of vegetables, such as spinach, garlic, cabbage, and carrots.

loans.name: Guillermo Alexander

texts.es:
Guillermo siempre se ha dedicado a las actividades del campo, pues sus padres generaban los ingresos para el hogar con esta actividad y desde muy joven se la enseñaron para trabajar a su lado. Por esto ahora que se dedica a la crianza de cerdos puede contar con una muy buena experiencia que le permite tener productos de muy buena calidad. Sin embargo, pese a la gran experiencia con la que cuenta, el hecho de ser padre soltero de tres hijos de 11, 7 y 5 años de edad ha hecho que las dificultades económicas en el hogar se presenten constantemente y esto no permita progresar su negocio. Es por esto que Guillermo busca un préstamo para comprar un cerdo de crianza para aumentar su capacidad de producción y así poder aumentar sus ventas.
Su sueño está en poder contar con un negocio más grande donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en: Guillermo has always made a living in activities in the field as his parents generated income for the household with this activity and from a very young age they taught him to work at their side.  It is for this reason that now that he makes a living raising pigs he has very good experience that allows him to have very good quality products.  However, in spite of the great experience that he has, the fact that he is a single father of three children, ages 11, 7 and 5, has made for economic difficulties in the household that arise constantly and this does not allow him to make progress in his business.  This is why Guillermo is seeking a loan to buy a breeding pig in order to increase his production capacity and thus be able to increase his sales.  His dream is to be able to have a larger business where he can generate employment for the neediest people.

loans.use: to buy a breeding pig.

loans.name: Be

texts.en: Be is requesting a new loan to buy a range of products to sell, such as sandwiches, roasted peanut candies and breads. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of products to sell, such as sandwiches, roasted peanut candies and breads.

loans.name: To

texts.en: To is requesting a new loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of materials to make ornaments, such as paper, glues and bamboo frames. To's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of materials to make ornaments, such as paper, glues and bamboo frames.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en: Quyen is requesting a new loan, which she will use to purchase coffee and glasses and repair her family's motorbike. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers and provide her family with a means of transportation. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall thereby increasing sales and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase coffee and glasses and repair the family motorbike.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is requesting a new loan to buy water pipes and materials for making water systems in order to stock his household equipment store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products. 

Dung hopes that this new loan will help him to increase the size of his store and increase sales, thereby enabling him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy water pipes and materials for making water systems.

loans.name: Vailiga

texts.en:
Vailiga is 64 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for 4 years.

Vailiga has requested a loan to buy some fishing gear. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Vailiga will renew her front porch.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear, a spear and fishing net

loans.name: La Buena Union 1 Group

texts.en:
Martha is one of the members of the “La Buena Unión 1 (The Good Union).” They are micro entrepreneurs who sell clothing, shoes, crafts, etc. Their sales points are in the city of Hato Mayor, a farming community in the northeast of the country.

Martha is a single mother of three children, two of whom still live with her. She tells us that her most difficult challenge has been raising her children although she enjoys caring for them and attending church. Martha is very excited about receiving her sixth loan from Esperanza Internacional, having repaid her previous loan satisfactorily and taken an important step toward growing her business. She has had her business for about three years; she started it with her first Esperanza loan.

Martha will use this new loan to buy body lotion, deodorant, shampoo, hair conditioner and other cosmetics. She will use the profits to gradually build her house since her dream is to live in peace with her children in a good house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, and hair and beauty products.

loans.name: La Fortaleza 1 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Edermiro is the coordinator of the La Fortaleza (The Strength) 1 & 3. This group is located in the town of Hato Mayor, whose economy depends on farming and is in the northeastern part of the country. Edermiro has a wife and nine children, three of whom live at home. 

Edermiro will use this loan to buy different meats. He has a butcher shop where he sells beef, pork, chicken and goat meat. He is excited to be taking his thirteenth loan with Kiva partner Esperanza, after having successfully repaid his previous loans and grown his business. Edermiro started his business with his first Esperanza loan nearly seven years ago. His most critical challenge is to save and rebuild his house. 

Edermiro will reinvest the profits in his business and continue to save for the construction of his own house. His dreams are to live comfortably and save with his partner. He became interested in and motivated to join Esperanza after he was encouraged by others in this group to be part of the program and start his business.

loans.use: To buy beef, pork and chicken.

loans.name: Me

texts.en:
Me is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a small business selling barbecue in her community and has been doing this for 3 years.

Me has requested a loan to buy a box of chicken leg quarters, box of mutton flaps (meat from sheep bellies), etc. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Me hopes to expand her business within other nearby villages.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, mutton flaps, soya, onion and sausages

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 21-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Maria has requested a loan to buy sprayers, shovels, crops and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Maria hopes to buy some new uniforms for her children.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, shovels, crops and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: La Fortaleza 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Ana is one of the members of the La Fortaleza (The Strength) group 2 & 4, located in the town of Hato Mayor, whose economy depends on farming. Their principal economic activities are selling food, clothes, shoes and accessories.

Ana is very excited to receive her ninth loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having paid off her previous loans satisfactorily and thereby haven taken a step toward growing her business. She has had her business for about four years. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of jeans, blouses, shirts, t-shirts and other items such as shoes.

Ana is a single mother of four children, all of whom live with her. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is working hard to provide for her family's well-being. Her favorite activity is to be at home with her children. She will use her benefits to reinvest in her business and to maintain her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products of personal use and overcome her capital difficulties and respond to customer orders

loans.name: Noatia

texts.en:
Noatia is a 38-year-old married woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Noatia has requested a loan to buy more equipment such as shovels, a wheelbarrow and chemicals. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Noatia hopes to buy some new iron roofing for her house.

loans.use: to buy shovels, a wheelbarrow and chemicals

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
A 37-year-old married man, Lon resides in a rural area of Moung Russey district located in Battambang province, Cambodia. He is blessed with one son who is employed as a paid worker.

In the family, Lon is a breadwinner who earns income through planting corn and sesame on three hectares of farmland. He has been involving in this business for ten years, earning approximately 26,000 KHR per day.

He received his first loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) one loan-cycle ago and completely paid back the loan. The past loan helped Lon to improve the living standard of his family. Now he is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR to buy a mini-tractor to assist him in his planting business. Via this loan, he hopes to increase his plots of farmland in order to increase his yields as well as his profit.

loans.use: to buy a mini-tractor for his farmland

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala  is a 31-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation where she grows kava to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Kalala has requested a loan to buy chemicals, machetes, a wheelbarrow and shovels. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Kalala hopes to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, machetes, a wheelbarrow and shovels.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Elena comenzó hace 7 años a vender tacos en los mercados de su localidad para ayudar en el gasto familiar, ya que lo que ganaba su esposo no alcanzaba para la manutención de sus 5 hijos. Ella fue incrementado las ganancias gracias a su tenacidad, desempeño y a la expansión de su negocio, ya que como pudo adquirió unas mesas y sillas para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Hoy en día trabaja en los mercados rodantes que se instalan en diferentes colonias y ha visto como su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco. Con el crédito solicitado ella piensa aumentar sus ingresos al ampliar la cantidad de guisos que ofrecerá y que le permitirá seguir ayudando con el gasto en su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Elena started selling tacos at local markets 7 years ago to help with her family's expenditure, as what her husband was making wasn't enough to maintain her 5 children. She slowly incremented her income thanks to her tenacity, performance and to the expansion of her business, as she was able to purchase some tables and chairs to provide a better service for her customers. These days she works at travelling markets that set up in different colonies and has seen her business grow gradually.

With this loan she hopes to increase her income by expanding the number of dishes that she offers which will allow her to keep helping with household expenditures.

loans.use: purchase supplies for her taco business

loans.name: Meapula

texts.en: Meapula is 29 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling BBQ foods in her community and has been doing this for four years. Meapula has requested a loan to buy some chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps and sausages. She joined microfinance organization SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Meapula will help out with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chicken legs, mutton flaps, sausages and onions to sell.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El señor santos de 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de  Olanchito, Yoro.  Santos siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura. Hace 5 años que el realiza sus propios cultivos, donde produce frijoles y café. Sus cultivos los realiza en una zona apta para la producción. La producción la vende en el mercado local y en su casa. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado va pagar mano de obra para sacar la cosecha de frijol y darle mantenimiento de limpieza a la finca de café. Con esta inversión quiere obtener una buena producción. Su meta es darle la educación a sus hijos y el sustento diario a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos, age 32, lives with his common-law partner.  They have four children, and they live in a village in the Olanchito municipality in Yoro.

Santos has always farmed.  He has been growing his own crops for five years.  He grows beans and coffee in an area that is suitable for their production.  He sells his production at the local market and at his house.

He will use the loan he has requested to pay for the labor to gather the bean harvest and to provide maintenance by weeding the coffee farm.  With this investment he wants to get a good production.

His goal is to give his children an education and to provide his family with daily support.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to gather the bean harvest and to weed the coffee farm.

loans.name: Helio Manuel

texts.es: Helio tiene 23 años de estado civil Unión libre tiene un bebe de un año. El trabajaba en una librería pero para mejorar sus ingresos  ahorro dinero para tener su propio negocio. En la actualidad se independizo y puso una tienda. El tipo de negocio es una tienda de víveres y su  trabajo lo realiza con su mujer desde de la 6:00 AM hasta las 9:00 PM.  Con el préstamo quiere comprar enlatados, bebidas, granos etc.  El sueño de Helio es tener su propio comisariato y legalizar los papeles de su casa.
texts.en:
Helio, age 23, is in a common-law marriage and has a one year old baby.

He used to work in a bookstore.  However, in order to improve his income he saved money to have his own business.  He became independent and now has his own store.  His business is a store that sells provisions.  He works with his wife from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.

With the loan he wants to buy canned goods, drinks, and grains, etc.

Helio’s dream is to have his own discount warehouse and to formalize the papers for his house.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, drinks, and grains.

loans.name: Ife Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFE est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui s'approvisionnent au même lieu. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Odounyêmi Maqsoudath est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Odounyêmi Maqsoudath est âgée de 28 ans et est mariée à un certain Deen. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés, et tous à leur charge. Odounyêmi Maqsoudath a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Odounyêmi Maqsoudath vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins du ménage. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Odounyêmi Maqsoudath mène comme activité la vente des plateaux d’oeufsde maïs, du charbon de bois et divers articles dans son quartier. Odounyêmi Maqsoudath exerce cette activité depuis quatre ans. Odounyêmi Maqsoudath s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Odounyêmi Maqsoudath sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe IFE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits et à augmenter leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The IFE group is made up of three friends who stock up at the same place. This is the third time that the group is seeking financial support from ALIDé, in order to boost their business.

Odounyêmi Maqsoudath (the woman who is raising her hand in the photo) is the group's representative. She is 28 years old and married to a man named Deen. The couple has three children, all of whom live in their care. Some of their children have received schooling. Odounyêmi Maqsoudath stopped her studies at the secondary school level. She lives with her husband and children. Odounyêmi Maqsoudath and Deen both provide for the various household needs.

In order to cover the various expenses, Odounyêmi Maqsoudath sells corn, charcoal, trays of eggs, and various other items in her neighborhood. She has been running this business for four years now. She stocks up in her region.

Odounyêmi Maqsoudath, along with the other members of the IFE group, is seeking a third loan from ALIDé to help her achieve her goal of satisfying her customers and increasing both her sales and revenue. The loan will allow the group members to increase their inventory of products and grow their customer base.

loans.use: to buy corn and various other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install security gates on his windows and doors

loans.name: Tafaumu

texts.en:
Tafaumu is 30 years old and married, with six children. 

She runs a small business selling fish in her community, and she has been doing this for a year. Tafaumu has requested a loan to buy a fishing net, a canoe, and other supplies. 

She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tafaumu will help pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: To  buy a canoe, a fishing net, and other supplies.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
More than a decade ago, Christine and her father moved to Abilene, Texas, for work. Her dad, who loved antiques, taught her to always carry a magnet to decipher between brass and metal when shopping yard sales. As she recalls, “We could always buy good, used furniture, hats, pins and buckles.” Christine would accompany her father at trade shows during her high school years. However, she never truly enjoyed any part of it. “It was horrible in high school, selling cowboy hats in the heat,” she said. “Then I found myself getting good buys at garage sales and found a booth at an indoor market.” 

Seeing there was potential to make a profit, Christine decided to launch The Last Remains, a small, environmentally friendly business that refurbishes and sells antiques. 
 
“Everyone throws something away, but we can take those throwaways and sell them.  For instance, at estate sales, I find old suitcases and then ‘upscale’ them as pet beds,” she says.  Suitcases padded with baby blankets and with chair legs attached, are among her bestselling products. “We take another item like a burned-out light bulb, remove the filament, wash it out with water and salt, then create hanging flower baskets."

Christine said she spends hours cleaning her finds and sells the new creations at an affordable price. Currently, she employs her boyfriend, who also works remodeling homes. When on the job, he obtains reusable items for crafts. For example, he brought a window frame that Christine used as a photo frame, and a screen door, which she spray-painted and uses to display earrings and accessories at shows. Christine gives new life to old items that others would have trashed.  Doing this helps cut down on discarded items that end up in landfills.

Christine and her boyfriend are looking to hire a welder to make animal-shaped objects from old tools and other objects such as a wine racks made from horse shoes and wood. In the future, they plan to hire more employees to assist with working multiple flea markets on the weekends, but Christine’s major plan is to open a store within the next five years. 

She discovered Accion Texas Inc., where she applied and was approved for this loan, through the Small Business Development Center (SBDC) in Abilene. Christine says the loan will go a long way toward purchasing furniture, wood and new materials to immediately begin creating items. 

She showcases many photos on her Facebook page at: https://www.facebook.com/thelastremains and her website at http://thelastremains.webs.com. Her father passed away December 2011, but the encouragement and support Christine receives from customers keeps her motivated to continue her father’s trade.

loans.use: To purchase furniture, wood and new materials.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Mohamed from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. He is married and has two children, age 5 years and 9 years. His children are currently attending school. 

In 1990, Mohamed established his clothes business. He began his business because he did not go to school and business became his only hope. Before, he was a house helper.

He works at the business every day, 12 house a day. He says that the main challenge to his business is transportation costs.

Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy more jeans, T shirts and blouses. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his installment and educate his children. In the future, Mohamed plans to expand his business from retail to wholesale. He thanks you for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Mohamed from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more jeans, T shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Rithy's Group

texts.en:
Rithy, a 47-year-old married woman, resides in Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. Rithy has three children, one daughter and two sons, all of whom are still dependent on her and currently in school. 

She earns her living through sewing clothes, which she has done for 15 years.  Her husband works as a construction worker to complement income in the family.   Each day Rithy earns about KHR 22,000 and manages to save around KHR 7,000.  Her main challenge is insufficent  working capital for supporting her business.

She is now leading a group of three females to take out a loan with VisionFund. Rithy is a fourth-time borrower, while her fellow group members are a third-time borrower and a first-time borrower with VisionFund. The past loans enabled her to meet the family’s needs and succeded in supporting her children’s schooling. 

With this new portion of loan, Rithy will use as working capital to buy fruits for resale to gain more income. Via the use of this loan portion, she hopes to lift her family’s living standard higher.

loans.use: To buy fruits for resale.

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa  is 46 years old and married, with two children. 

She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as gel, hair products, and cosmetics, etc. She has been doing this for two years. Temukisa needs a loan to buy some hangers, rolls of material, plastic bags, and a sewing machine. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

She hopes to use her profits to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine, rolls of material, hangers, gels, and shampoo.

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Binta from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is widowed and has two children, age 7 years and 12 years. Her children are currently attending school. As a widow, to educate children in Sierra Leone is very difficult. 

Binta runs a general merchandise store. She sells Maggi (a product for enhancing flavors), onions, tomato paste and salt. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business from 7:30 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She also earns income from small-scale farming. She says that the main challenges to her business are slow sales during rainy season and transportation costs.

Binta has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking seasonings like Maggi, onions, tomato paste and salt. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she plans to become a supplier. She appreciates your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Binta from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more cooking seasonings like Maggi as well as onions, tomato paste and salt.

loans.name: Vavao

texts.en:
Vavao is a 52-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Vavao has requested a loan to buy sprayers, shovels, weed killer and crops. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Vavao hopes to renew her house.

loans.use: to buy sprayers, shovels, weed killer, and crops.

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
Han is 59 years old, married, and lives in a rural area of Mongkul Borey district located in Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She has six children, three of whom are dependent on her. To make a living, she has been involved in a rice-farming business for 34 years, earning around 28,000 KHR per day. 

Han received a microloan from VisionFund seven cycles ago, with which she succeeded in reducing her family’s burden. Now Han is leading a group that consists of four female members to apply for a new loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is seeking 500,000 KHR while her three fellow group members are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. As a group leader, Han will use her requested loan portion to buy rice seed and three sacks of fertilizer to apply in her rice field. She hopes to grow her cash-crop timely so as to double her income in order to attain good living progress in her household and to save some money for building her house.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and three sacks of fertilizer

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Kimhor's Group

texts.en:
Kimhor, 40, is a resident in a rural area of Mongkul Borey district, Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She is married and has five children, four daughters and one son, all of whom are working in Thailand as paid workers. Kimhor makes her living through rice farming as her primary source of income and supplements her income via selling grocery items and sometimes catching fish. She earns around 20,000 KHR per day and is able to save approximately 9,000 KHR. 

Kimhor is leading her group of two female members. Kimhor and her member, Chheang, are requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR and 500,000 KHR, respectively. Kimhor and her group member are second-cycle clients with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. The previous loan has enabled her to secure her business and family’s finances. With this new loan, Kimhor will buy fertilizers to apply on her farmland and buy more grocery items to sell. She believes that via her portion of the loan, she will be able to boost her yield on time so that she can increase her profit and meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and grocery items for sale

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en: Chanthy is 48 years old, married and has five children. She lives in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. One of her children is dependent on her and still in school. Chanthy is a 20-year experienced farmer who does rice farming to feed her family. Each day she earns around 15,000 KHR and, after covering daily expenses, saves approximately 7,000 KHR. The cost of fertilizers is high and the amount of money that she earns from selling her crop yields is too low to meet the family’s needs. Thus, she and her group members are requesting their first loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). As a leader, Chanthy, will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and cover the cost of plowing the rice field. She has high hopes that with the use of this loan portion she can improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing cost

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Phay's Group

texts.en:
A villager, Phay, resides in a rural area of Pursat province’s Kror Kor district, Cambodia. She is 42 years old and married,  a mother of five children. 

She strives for her living through rice farming and pig raising, while her husband catches fish for sale after helping with the rice-field. The current business enables her to earn about KHR 24,000 per day. She has been with VisionFund for four cycles already and successfully paid back the past loans. 

The past loans that she completely paid back enabled her to buy pigs to raise. Now she is leading a group with a member named Sarin, who also is a fourth-cycled client with VisionFund, to take out a new loan in the amount of KHR 1,000,000 each. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice field and a portion to buy a fishing net to support her husband. 

She hopes to maximize her income from her rice-growing business so she can upgrade her family's living conditions better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a fishing net.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 27-year-old Osman from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. He married and has no children. He began his business when he left secondary school education and lost both his parents.

Osman runs a phone accessories shop. He sells mobile phones, phone bags and phone batteries. He has been running this business for 12 years. He works at the business from 7:30 a.m. until 8:00 p.m., seven days per week. His business is the only income he has. Osman says that the main challenges to his business are high taxes and no security.

Osman has requested a loan in order to buy more mobile phones, phone bags and phone batteries. The extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to become a supplier. He thanks you for your support!

video.title: Kiva Borrower Osman from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones, phone bags and phone batteries.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, aged 33, is a resident in a rural area of Ek Phnom district, Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married and has three dependent children, one daughter and two sons, who are either in school or are assisting in the family’s business. To gain income for the family, Mom works as a rice farmer and a tailor and her husband works as a motor-taxi driver. Mom has been involved in her current business for 16 years, enabling her to earn around 33,000 KHR per day and, after deducting her daily cost of living, there’s only around 11,000 KHR left for her savings. 

Mom is leading a group of two, who both are fifth-cycle clients with Kiva’s partner VisionFund to apply for a new loan. The previous loans provided her with enough income to meet the family’s needs. With this new loan portion, she will spend it on the fees of plowing, harvesting her rice field, and buying a sewing machine. She hopes to multiply her income from her business so she can keep a good standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, harvesting fees and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Soksan's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Kror Kor district located in Pursat province, Cambodia, Soksan is a young 25-year-old married woman with two children. To overcome her family's financial difficulty, she and her husband manage their two hectares of farmland for growing rice. Besides working on a rice farm, Soksan also grows vegetables and her husband catches fish to sell. Having been with this business for five years, Soksan is able to earn around 12,000 KHR per day. 

Soksan has been with VisionFund for three cycles already and has completely paid back the past loans. The previous loans have helped her not only to provide the working capital for her rice farm, but also to buy fishing materials such as fish trap and cast net to support her husband's business. Now, she is leading a group of two to request a new loan. Soksan is requesting 600,000 KHR and her member is applying for 500,000 KHR. As a group leader, Soksan will use her loan's portion to buy fertilizer for her rice field and to pay for her rice farm's leasing fee. She expects to manage her crop timely so she can produce more yield and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for the leasing fee of her farmland

loans.name: Theary's Group

texts.en:
Theary, a villager living in a rural area of Kror Kor district in Pursat province, Cambodia, is 41 years old, married, and blessed with one son, who is currently a grade seven student. Theary and her husband earn their living by buying and selling palm sugar, an activity they have been engaged in for 30 years. Each day she earns approximately 21,000KHR.

Theary, who has received five previous loans from VisionFund, is now leading her fellow group members, both of whom have received four previous loans, in requesting a loan of 3,600,000KHR; Theary and one member are applying for 1,400,000 KHR each, while the remaining member is seeking 800,000 KHR.

Theary has repaid her previous loans, which were wisely used to buy household supplies. She will use her current requested loan portion as additional working capital in her palm sugar trading. Through this loan, she hopes to increase her profit and, most importantly, be able to support her son’s education.

loans.use: to buy more palm sugar for resale.

loans.name: Iokapeta

texts.en: Iokapeta  is 30 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling barbeque in her community and has been doing this for four years. Iokapeta has requested a loan to buy some new items such as sausages, chicken leg quarters and mutton flaps. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Iokapeta will buy a new grill to use in her business.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, chickens, sausages, soya, onions.

loans.name: Ludys Margoth

texts.es:
Ludys se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida, es por esto que al ver que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, decidió montar una tienda general donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de la canasta familiar, verduras y otros productos más. Con este negocio ha ido poco a poco superando las dificultades económicas de la familia y es por esto que siempre busca vender más para poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos. Ludys busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de verduras y productos de la canasta familiar que se le han ido agotando y poder así seguir aumentando sus ventas.

Su sueño es poder tener un mejor negocio donde pueda generar mayores ingresos para su familia y desde el cual puedan tener una estabilidad económica en el hogar.
texts.en:
Ludys is married and has two chldren to whom she has always wanted to give a good quality of life. Consequently, on seeing that her husband’s income was insufficient to pay household expenses, she decided to start a general store where she sells her customers products in the typical family's grocery basket, such as vegetables and other products. 

With this business she has gradually overcome her family's financial difficulties and is always looking to sell more in order to give her two children a better quality of life.

Ludys is applying for a loan to purchase a supply of vegetables and other products in the family grocery basket, which have sold out. Thus she will be able to continue increasing her sales. Her dream is to have a better business that generates a higher income for her family so their home will be  economically stable.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of vegetables and products in the family grocery basket, which have been depleted, so that she can continue increasing her sales.

loans.name: Saron's Group

texts.en:
A 33-year-old villager, Saron resides in Pursat Province’s Kror Kor District, Cambodia. She is married and has three dependent children, two daughters and one son. Two of her children are in school and the other one is too young to attend school. Saron and her husband make their living through rice farming and pig raising. To supplement her income, Saron also runs a small grocery store. Due to the lack of money to buy feeds for her pigs, she is now leading a group of two to request the first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.
She is applying for 1,000,000 KHR while her fellow member is seeking 500,000 KHR. As a group leader, her loan portion will be used to buy feed for her pigs. She expects to increase more income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy feed for pigs she is raising.

loans.name: Leata

texts.en:
Leata is 30 years old and married with one child. She runs a small business selling Twisties (snack food), soft drinks, etc., in her community, and has been doing this for a year. Leata has requested a loan to stock up her canteen. 

She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Leata will buy some cement for her driveway.

loans.use: to purchase Twisties (snack food), soft drinks, donuts, etc., to sell in her canteen.

loans.name: Deyanira

texts.es:
Deyanira inició su negocio de venta de productos de uso personal desde hace un tiempo, motivada principalmente por generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo en la parte económica del hogar, pues el salario de su esposo no estaba siendo suficiente para poder sostener a sus 4 hijos. Sin mucho capital pero con un gran esfuerzo, Deyanira sacó su negocio adelante y ahora puede contar con más clientes que le permiten tener unas ventas para aportar en su hogar, y poco a poco ha venido creciendo y mejorando la calidad de vida en su hogar. Gracias a una promoción de la empresa donde compra los productos de uso personal para venderlos, Deyanira busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y aprovechar los grandes descuentos que se están ofreciendo para así aumentar sus beneficios.

De esta manera sus ingresos aumentarán considerablemente y por tanto su familia podrá gozar de una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para salir adelante. Su sueño es montar un almacén donde pueda ofrecer sus productos y generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Deyanira started her business of selling personal use products some time ago.  She was primarily motivated to generate income to support her husband with the household finances.  Her husband’s salary was not enough to be able to support their four children.  

Without much capital, but with great effort, Deyanira got her business ahead.  Now she has more customers, which allows her to have sales to contribute to her household.  Little by little her business has been growing and improving the quality of life in her home.

Thanks to a promotion by the company where she buys the personal use products that she sells, Deyanira is looking for a loan.  She wants the loan to buy personal use products and to take advantage of the big discounts that are being offered.  This way she will increase her profits.

This way her income will increase considerably.  Therefore her family will be able to enjoy a better quality of life and better financial opportunities to get ahead.

Her dream is to establish a warehouse where she is able to offer her products and generate employment for the people who are most in need.

loans.use: to buy personal use products and take advantage of the discounts being offered in order to increase her profits.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Thomas from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married and has four children between the ages of 6 years and 20 years. They are currently attending school. 

In 1995, Thomas established his general store. He began his business because he dropped out of secondary school level, and his uncle taught him business. 

He works at the business every day, 13 hours per day. He says that the main challenges to his business are price inflation and the cost of transportation.

Thomas requires a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, pure water, candles and cigarettes. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his children and change his level of living. In the future, Thomas plans to build a house. He thanks you for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Thomas from Sierra Leone

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks, pure water, candles and cigarettes.

loans.name: Galumulivai

texts.en: Galumulivai  is 33 years old and married with five children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as cigarettes, soft drinks, snacks, canned food, sugar and flour. She has been doing this for five years. Galumulivai needs a loan to buy more items. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's every financial need. She became a member of SPBD to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salts, snacks, cigarettes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Esther Estefania

texts.es:
Esther hace 2 años vendía legumbres en Cotopaxi, Ciudad en la parte Sur del Ecuador por el volcán Cotopaxi, pero como su mama estaba en Guayaquil decidió ayudarla en su negocio y reunir dinero para implementar con una tienda de víveres su nuevo negocio con junto al de su mama.
En la actualidad vende víveres y abarrotes de primera necesidad. Trabaja desde las 7:00am hasta las 23:00pm. 
Esther es soltera no tiene ninguna dificultad en su negocio. Con el préstamo va a comprar helados, frutas y pañales. Una de sus metas es crecer más en su negocio para tener un Mini Marquet
texts.en:
Esther had been selling vegetables for some 2 years in Cotopaxi, a city in the south of Ecuador near the Cotopaxi volcano. But since her mother was in Guayaquil, she decided to help her in her business and she saved up money to launch a grocery store alongside her mother's. At present, in Guayaquil she is selling vegetables and groceries of primary necessity.

With the loan, she will buy ice cream, fruit, and diapers. One of her goals is to make her business grow more, to become a Mini-Market.

loans.use: purchase ice cream, fruit, and diapers to sell in her small store.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Osman from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married and has two children, age 2 years and 5 years. One of his children is currently attending school. 

In 2002, Osman established his clothing business. He began his business because he was a student but he did not have parents to support his education, so he worked as house help to generate income to start his business. 

He works at the business from 7:30 a.m. until 7:30 p.m., seven days per week. He says that the main challenges to his business are high custom taxes, transportation costs and inflation.

Osman requires a loan in order to buy more jeans, T-shirts, blouses, and shoes. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and improve his living. In the future, Osman plans to build a house and be a supplier. He thanks you for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Osman from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more jeans, T-shirts, blouses, and shoes.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Mohamed from eastern area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married and has three children between the ages of 6 years and 23 years. His children are currently attending school and one is in university.

Mohamed runs a clothing business within a busy market area. He sells jeans, ladies' bags, men's shirts and shoes. He has been running this business for 10 years. He works at the business seven days per week and 12 hours per day. His business is the only income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is transportation.

Mohamed has requested a loan in order buy more jeans, ladies' bags, men's shirts and shoes. The extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living and educate his children. In the future, he plans to open another outlet and build a house. He appreciates your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Mohamed from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more jeans, ladies' bags, men's shirts and shoes.

loans.name: Alieu

texts.en:
Alieu is a 23-year-old single parent with a 4-year-old son. 

He runs a general store at Waterloo eastern area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He began his business because he wants to have a permanent source of income to support his family. Before, he was a shopkeeper.

He's been in this business for five years and sells soft drinks, milk, bread, luncheon meat, biscuits, and butter. His business is the only income he has. He described his major problem as competition in the market and price inflation.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more general stock items like soft drinks, milk, bread, luncheon meat. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him start a savings account and educate his child. In the future, he would like to expand his business to a wholesale level. He is grateful for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Alieu from Sierra Leone

loans.use: buy more general stock items like soft drinks, milk, bread and luncheon meat.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh is requesting a new loan to repair her stall and buy furniture, bowls, chopsticks and meat to sell, purchases that will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Hanh's previous loan enabled her to improve her business, and she hopes that her new one will help her to both increase the size of her food stall and her sales, thereby enabling her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her stall and buy furniture, bowls, chopsticks and meat to sell.

loans.name: Mirna Yessenia

texts.es:
Mirna Yessenia, se ha decidido por otro préstamo para comprar más prendas de enchape y de oro, que a continuación se mencionan: cadenas, pulseras, aretes, anillos, dijes, brazaletes y otros.
El efecto que tubo con el crédito anterior fue positivo, ya que mejoro el numero y modelos de prendas de enchape y de oro. 
Comenta que la familia se ha mantenido, los ingresos han aumentado, y sus deseos es mantenerse al margen con las ventas y que su negocio le sea más rentable.
texts.en:
Mirna Yessenia has decided to request another loan so that she can buy more plated and gold jewelry such as chains, bracelets, earrings, rings, pendants, bracelets, and other items.

The effect of her previous loan was positive. She was able to increase the quantity and variety of plated and gold jewelry that she offers. Mirna says that she has been able to support her family with the increase of income. She wants to maintain her level of sales and have a more profitable business.

loans.use: to buy chains, bracelets, earrings, rings, pendants, bracelets, and other items.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy is a 34-year-old mother of three schoolchildren.  She is a rural villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. 

Her main source of income is from paddy rice growing, while growing beans and sesame are supplementary income. She has been in this business for 16 years. Sophy has taken her microloan with VisionFund one cycle ago and has paid it back with success. With that first loan, she started up a micro-business, pig-raising, as an extra income. Now she feels confident that she can sustain her living condition. 

Now she is in a group of three female members.  All are the second-time clients, and they are seeking a new loan of KHR 1,200,000 each. As a group leader, she will use her portion to buy rice seed, insecticide, and gasoline for pumping water for her rice field. She also uses some portion of it to buy more pigs for raising. 

She hopes not only to grow her crops, but also to raise her pigs healthily, so as to sell them at a high price to better her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, insecticide, and gasoline for pumping water.

loans.name: Danilo Amilcar

texts.es: Danilo tiene 37 años de edad, es casado, vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara junto a su esposa y un hijo. Danilo estableció su propio taller de fabricación de muebles para el hogar como ser: puertas, ventanas, muebles de comedor, divisiones, muebles de cocina etc. este negocio lo tiene en su casa desde hace 4 años y tiene buena demanda ya que él es una persona responsable con sus trabajos y los clientes están satisfechos. Con el préstamo que solicita va comprar materiales que utiliza en su negocio como ser: maderas, pegamentos, barniz, clavos, brochas, laca etc. con esta inversión va incrementar el flujo de trabajos y también sus ingresos. Su meta es tener un taller más grande y que sea  reconocido por la calidad de trabajos que realiza y darle una buena calidad de vida a su hijo y a su esposa.
texts.en:
Danilo, 37, is married and lives in the town of Macuelizo, Santa Barbára with his wife and son.  Danilo opened his own home furniture making shop.  He manufactures such things as doors, windows, dining room furniture, room dividers, kitchen furniture, etc.  He’s had the business at home for four years and has good demand because he’s a person who is responsible about his work and his customers are pleased.

He will use the requested loan to buy the materials and supplies like lumber, glue, varnish, nails, brushes, lacquer, etc.  that he uses in his business.  With this investment he will increase the flow of jobs and income.  His goal is to have a larger workshop that is well-known for the quality of the work it does and to provide his son and wife with a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy furniture making supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toilet paper, tooth paste, shampoo, soap and detergent.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Чамшед проживает в районе Бохтар. Чамшед женат. Ему 47 лет. У него пятеро детей. Жена Чамшеда занимается земледелием. Чамшед имеет высшее педагогическое образование, он педагог. Он более 12 лет работает в школе. 
Чамшед хочет заняться своим делом и получить дополнительный доход. Так как на его зарплату трудно обеспечивать большую семью. Чамшед хочет открыть магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товара. Он приобрел и отремонтировал помещение, где намерен открыть магазин. Чамшед просит кредит для покупки товара (продуктов питания, парфюмерии и хозяйственных товаров). Он нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Jamshed lives in the Bohtar district.  He is 47 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is involved in farming.  Jamshed has a higher pedagogical education and is a teacher.  He has been working at a school for over 12 years.  Jamshed wants to get involved in his own business and earn an additional income because it is difficult to provide for his large family with his salary.  He wants to open a store with a mixed variety of merchandise.  He bought and remodeled a space, where he intends to open the store.  Jamshed is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise (food products, perfumes and household goods).  He needs your support.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (food products, perfumes and household goods)

loans.name: Sayram

texts.ru: Сайрам жительница Яванского района. Сайрам родилась в 1980 году. Он замужем, мать троих детей. Ее муж работает разными строительными работами по найму. Сайрам занимается торговлей. Она арендует небольшой магазин, где работает продавщицей. В этой области Сайрам работает два года. У нее продуктовый магазин. Она просит кредит для покупки продуктов (сахара, молочных продуктов, печенья, конфет, смеси для новорожденных, вафель и других видов продуктов) с целью увеличения оборота.
texts.en: Sayram is a resident of the Yavan district.  She was born in 1980.  She is married and a mother of three children.  Her husband works as a contractor construction worker.  Sayram is involved in sales.  She leases a small store, where she works as a salesperson.  Sayram has been working in this field for two years.  She has a food market.  She is requesting this loan to purchase products (sugar, dairy products, cookies, candy, newborn formula, waffles and other types of products) in order to increase her product turnover.

loans.use: to purchase products (sugar, dairy products, cookies, candy, newborn formula, waffles and other types of products) in order to increase her product turnover.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finance strawberry seedlings

loans.name: Chomchaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Paulina está casada tiene 32 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al comercio de verduras, lo compra por mayor y lo vende a otros cliente, inicio este negocio  cuando se caso ya que necesitaba otros ingresos para sostener a su familia, hasta el momento lleva 12 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposos quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

9organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que los utilizara para la compra de mas mercadería y así pueda tener más venta, y poder suplir la demanda de sus cliente. Espera en el futuro tener capital amplio y propio. Las demás integrantes se dedican al comercio, crianza de animales domésticos, y a la artesanía.
texts.en:
Paulina, 32, is married and has three children two of which are in school; she never had the opportunity to attend school.  She sells vegetables.  She buys them at wholesale and resells them to other customers.  She started this business when she got married because she needed extra income to support her family.  To date she has 12 years’ experience and her husband, who does the same kind of work, helps her out.

She organized a group to request a loan that will be used to buy more merchandise to sell and be able to stock up to meet customer demand.  She hopes in future to have large capital of her own.  

The other group members are merchants, raise domestic animals and are craftswomen.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Hever De Jesus

texts.es:
Hever conoce los negocios de la tienda general desde hace más de 25 años cuando vivía en la ciudad de Medellín y allí tenía una tienda general, en la cual se conoció con su actual esposa. Con la tienda en la ciudad duraron mucho tiempo, pero debido a una gran dificultad ajena a su voluntad se vieron en la obligación de dejar la ciudad y se fueron a vivir al municipio donde actualmente residen. Allí se ubicaron y ahora están montando nuevamente una tienda general, pero como no cuentan con el capital suficiente para esto, Hever busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y surtir la tienda general que apenas están iniciando.

Hever espera poder sacar este negocio adelante y poder con este trabajar junto a su esposa y brindarles a sus 6 hijos una calidad de vida digna y el acceso a una educación escolar de buena calidad.
texts.en: Hever has known about running stores for the last 25 years since he lived in the city of Medellín and had a general store; that’s where he met his wife.  They had the store in the city for a long time but due to a great problem that was beyond their control they were forced to leave the city and move to the town they currently live in.  They settled there and are now opening a store once more but don’t have enough capital to do so which is why Hever is looking for financing to buy basic staples to stock the general store he’s just now getting started.  Hever hopes to move this store forward and to work together with his wife to provide their six children with a dignified life and access to a good quality education.

loans.use: to buy basic staples to stock the store he's just opening.

loans.name: Anastasiya

texts.ru:
Анастасия торгует в ТЦ Башни детской обувью. Широкий выбор ассортимента, большая торговая точка. Анастасия часто пользуется бизнес кредитами и всегда выплачивает их во время. Она порядочная, добрая и отзывчивая.

Сейчас у Анастасии есть в наличи шлепки, босоножки, туфли. Этот кредит понадобился для закупки димесезонной обуви - полусапожек, сапог, туфлей.
texts.en: Anastasiya sells shoes at the Bashni shopping center.  She has a wide variety of merchandise and a large retail outlet.  Anastasiya often uses business loans and always repays them on time.  She is decent, kind and responsive.  Currently, Anastasiya has flip-flops, sandals and pumps.  This loan is needed to purchase seasonal shoes, such as booties, boots and pumps.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal shoes, such as booties, boots and pumps

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en: Neang, age 32 and married, is a citizen in a rural village of Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham. She has three children, two of whom are her responsibility as they are they still in school. To provide for her family's daily needs, she works at a rubber plantation. She has done this for 12 years and earns about 9,000 KHR per day. Neang has never worked with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) before. She decided to take a loan as a first-cycle client in a group of four members. The other three group members are second-time borrowers. All of them are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Neang will use her loan portion to fix her house. She hopes that this loan will provide decent shelter for her children, especially during this rainy season.

loans.use: To fix her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy portable welding equipment.

loans.name: Anyela Andrea

texts.es:
Anyela aprendió desde muy joven la actividad de la fabricación de calzado, y gracias a esto logró ubicarse laboralmente en una buena empresa donde trabajó durante 9 años. Debido a que se casó y tuvo su hijo el cual ahora tiene 13 años de edad, Anyela tomó la decisión de dejar su trabajo y montar el taller de fabricación de calzado en su propia casa, para así poder cuidar de su hijo y mejorar la calidad de vida que le ofrecía en el hogar. A pesar de no contar con mucho capital su esfuerzo le permitió sacar el negocio adelante, pero debido a esta dificultad de capital que tiene y a la gran competencia del sector, hace 6 años entró en banca rota y tuvo que buscar alternativas que le permitieran salir adelante. Con un esfuerzo enorme ha logrado recuperar el negocio y continuar trabajando para generar ingresos para el hogar, y buscando ahora seguir progresando busca un préstamo para comprar una máquina industrial de cocer y materia prima para la reparación de calzado.

De esta forma logrará superar esta dificultad de capital que no le ha permitido responder a grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes y seguirá progresando junto a su familia mejorando la calidad de vida del hogar.
texts.en:
Anyela learned how to manufacture shoes when still very young and thanks to this managed to get a good job in a firm where she worked for nine years.  When she got married and had her son who is now 13-years-old she decided to leave her job and start a shoe-making workshop at home so that she could care for her son and improve the quality of life they had at home.  

Despite not having much capital, her efforts made it possible for the business to move forward but because of her lack of capital and the great amount of competition in this sector she went bankrupt six years ago and has to look for other alternatives to get ahead.  With enormous effort she’s managed to recuperate the business and continue working to generate household income and seeking now to find a way to continue making progress is looking for financing to buy an industrial sewing machine and raw materials needed for shoe repair.  In this way she will overcome this problem of capital that has prevented her from responding to large customer orders and she will be able to continue making progress with her family and improving the quality of life at home.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and shoe repair supplies.

loans.name: Fofoaivaoese

texts.en: Fofoaivaoese is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She runs a small business selling BBQ in her community. She has been doing this for two years. Fofoaivaoese has requested a loan to buy some sausages, mutton flaps, and chicken leg quarters. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fofoaivaoese will buy her children some new uniforms.

loans.use: to buy sausages, mutton flaps, and chicken leg quaters

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es: María Josefa de 41 anos de edad, del departamento de Chinandega, madre soltera  responsable de  4 hijos, 23, 16, 15,14, anos  de los cuales los menores estudian la secundaria, y el mayor trabaja con ella, ya que por falta de posibilidades económica no ha podido entrar a la universidad para poder coronar una carrera universitaria. La actividad económica de María Joséfa es comerciante y transportista de lo cual su hijo se encarga de conducir un camión de carga servicio  que ofrece a los comerciantes del mercado, y ella vende mercadería de forma ambulante. María Joséfa esta solicitando el financiamiento para realizar mejoras a su casa las cuales consisten en construir un galerón para protección del camión ya que queda a la intemperie y de esa forma mantenerlo en buen estado, y lo otro es cambio de techo en los cuartos ya que están en mal estado y con el invierno se filtran las gotas. Los sueños y metas personales de María Josefa son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, y brindarles mejor condiciones en su vivienda. Con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de material  de  construcción como: hierro, zinc, cemento, perlin, alambre, bloques. María Josefa  agradece a los inversionista kiva la ayuda que le brindan a las personas de países  pobres como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
María Joséfa is 41 years old and lives in the Department of Chinandega. She is a single mother who is responsible for four children (ages 23, 16, 15, and 14). The younger children are in high school and her oldest child works with her. Due to her financial situation, María is not able to send her children to the university in order to obtain a degree.

María Joséfa is a merchant and a transportation provider. Her son is in charge of driving a cargo truck and offering transport service to the merchants at the market. María sells merchandise as a street vendor. She is requesting a loan in order to make improvements to her house. She wants to build a shed for the cargo truck in order to protect it from the elements and keep it in good condition. María also wants to replace the roof over the rooms that are in bad condition. Rain water seeps through during the winter.

Her dreams and personal goals are to see her children finish their studies and to provide them better living conditions at home. With this loan, she will invest in construction materials such as iron, zinc, cement, crossbeams, wire, and blocks. María Joséfa is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their help and providing assistance to people from poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for repairing her roof and for building a shed to house her cargo truck.

loans.name: Digna Rosabell

texts.es:
Digna, ha solicitado otro préstamo para crecer en sus ventas y ampliar la gama de productos, comprandose ropa en variedad, plátano, yuca, jugos y otros productos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo mucho, ya que hizo las inversiones en el negocio comprandose mercaderia, el cual vino a influir en las ventas y los ingresos. La familia se ha mantenido, el negocio ha mejorado ya que con los ingresos de la venta de ropa y productos comestibles le ayudara ha construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Digna is requesting another loan so that she can increase her sales and expand her range of products. She will buy a variety of clothes, bananas, cassava, juices, and other products.

Her previous loan was a great help. She invested in her business by acquiring merchandise, which influenced both her sales and her earnings. Digna has been able to support her family because her business has improved. The income from selling clothes and food products will help defray the cost of building her house.

loans.use: to buy clothing, bananas, cassava, juices, and other products.

loans.name: Sai's Group

texts.en: Sai is a 46-year-old mother of three children, two (sons) of whom have their own employment, while the remaining one is still in school. She makes a living through selling grocery items at home and her husband supplements the income through a pig-raising business. She has been with this business for 10 years. Sai has been with VisionFund for the past five cycles and has paid back the entire loan with success. The past loan has helped her to better support her business gradually. Now, she has formed a group of two to seek a new loan. She is applying for 200,000 KHR and her co-member is seeking for 1,400,000 KHR. As group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy pig's feed for her pig-raising business. She hopes to fatten her pigs and sell for a good price so she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for her pig-raising business

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es un joven emprendedor que ha montado su propio negocio y con este ha venido sacando adelante a su esposa y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Tomando cursos de fotografía aprendió la actividad, y con un gran esfuerzo practicó la actividad hasta poder perfeccionarla y ahora es reconocido por tener trabajos de muy buena calidad, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante con el negocio y superar las grandes adversidades que se le han presentado. Buscando invertir en publicidad, Fernando requiere un préstamo para comprar un aviso publicitario en una red social y así aumentar sus ventas.

Fernando espera poder salir adelante con su esposa y su hijo de 2 años y continuar realizando esta actividad que tanto le apasiona, además de poder seguir contando con el reconocimiento de tener trabajos de muy buena calidad. Su sueño es montar un estudio fotográfico donde pueda generar empleo para 2 o 3 personas.
texts.en:
Fernando is a young entrepreneur who has started his own business that he’s been supporting his wife and two-year-old son with.  He took photography courses and learned this occupation and with much effort practiced it until he honed his skills and now is well-known for doing very good quality work which has made it possible for him to get ahead with the business and overcome great adversities that have arisen.   He wants to invest in publicity so Fernando needs a loan to pay for an ad in a social network to thus increase his sales.

Fernando hopes to be able to get ahead with his wife and two-year-old son and to continue doing this work that he’s so passionate about as well as to continue having the recognition for doing very good quality work.  His dream is to open a photography studio to generate employment for two or three more people.

loans.use: to buy ad space in a social network to increase sales.

loans.name: Marta Rosa

texts.es:
La  Señora Marta tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, reside en compañía de su familia en el municipio del Quimistan, Departamento de Santa Barbará.
Doña Marta se ha dedicado por más de 12 años a la venta de comida de manera ambulante, ella prepara y vende comida a base de tortillas de maíz, arroz, frijoles y pollo frito. 
Para la venta de la comida utiliza un punto estratégico de la carretera que conduce hacia el occidente de Honduras (desvió de la Ceibita), ofreciendo sus alimentos a las personas que viajan en  los autobuses.
Con el propósito de no endeudarse en los negocios locales (pulperías), decidió solicitar un préstamo por la cantidad de 20,100 Lempiras, los que utiliza para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Sra. Marta is a 57-year-old single mother of two children. She lives with her family in the town of Quimistan, which is located in the Department of Santa Barbará.

Doña Marta has been selling food as a street vendor for more than 12 years. She prepares and sells food such as corn tortillas, rice, beans, and fried chicken. In order to sell her food, Marta has a strategic location along the highway the stretches all the way to western Honduras (up to the town of La Ceibita). She offers her food to the passengers who travel by bus.

Instead of being indebted to the local grocery stores, Marta decided to request a loan in the amount of 20,100 HNL. The money will be spent on supplies used for preparing her dishes.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Dora Elena

texts.es:
Dora comenzó hace unos 3 años con su propio salón de belleza el cual es la actividad que siempre le ha gustado desempeñar. Gracias a esto, ha podido contribuir con su esposo para que en su hogar puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y ofrecer a su hijo una mejor educación. Debido al poco capital con el que cuenta, su negocio lo ha ido poco a poco suministrando de las herramientas necesarias, y es por esto que ahora que sus ventas vienen creciendo Dora busca un préstamo para comprar una silla y herramientas de trabajo que necesita.

Dora sueña con tener un gran salón de belleza donde pueda ofrecer empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
About three years ago Dora opened her own beauty salon, which is the job she always has enjoyed doing.  Thanks to this she has been able to help her husband so they can have a better quality of life at home and offer their child a better education.

Because she has only a small amount of capital, she has been supplying the tools she needs little by little, and now her sales are growing.  Dora needs a loan to buy a chair and the tools she needs for work.

Dora dreams of having a big beauty salon where she can give jobs to the people who most need them.

loans.use: to buy a chair and work tools

loans.name: Chhoang's Group

texts.en:
Chhoang, 37, is a married mother living in Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She has four children, three of whom are still dependent as they are still in school. She manages her two hectares of farmland for growing paddy rice with her husband. Having been with this business for several years, she is able to earn almost 15,000 KHR per day. Chhoang has been with VisionFund for the past four cycles. She has wisely managed her past loans with success, and she has paid them back already to keep up the good progress of her business and keep her children in school. 

Now she has formed a group of two female members to apply for a new loan. She and her co-member are applying for 1,000,000 KHR and 1,400,000 KHR respectively. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fee. She hopes this loan will enable her to timely  boost her yield and make a good profit to keep upgrading her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fee

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Siphan's Group

texts.en:
Siphan is 51 years old, widowed, and has four children who work on a rubber plantation. She is from a rural area of Thbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. Siphan runs a small stall selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 26 years and earns about 12,000 KHR a day. 

This is Siphan's second loan from VisionFund. The previous loan helped her to improve her business and her household with some savings for future needs. Now in a group of four members with Siphan as the leader, she and one of her fellow group member are requesting a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each, another group member is requesting a loan for 1,000,000 KHR, and the last member is requesting a loan for 500,000 KHR. Siphan will use her loan to buy additional items to sell including canned food, soap, and instant noodles. She hopes to earn a bigger profit from her business and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Leinati

texts.en: Leinati is 24 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling food in her community and has been doing this for one year. Leinati has requested a loan to buy some flour, cups, a new oven, and chicken leg quarters. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Leinati hopes to buy some new furniture.

loans.use: flour, sugar, cups, a new oven, chicken legs, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Jose se encuentra casado, tiene un hijo por quien velar y para generar los ingresos que requiere en su familia ha buscado por diferentes negocios la estabilidad económica que requiere. Actualmente se encuentra vendiendo popcorn y otros dulces en un carrito, el cual se encuentra en muy mal estado, y debido a que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para repararlo, Jose busca un préstamo para reparar el carrito donde prepara el popcorn y así ofrecer a sus clientes productos de mejor calidad.

Además de esto tendrá la posibilidad de tener un negocio con mejor apariencia física, lo que hace que sus clientes aumenten considerablemente. Su sueño es sacar su familia adelante ofreciéndoles una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
José’s married and has a son in his care.  In order to generate income his family needs he’s searched through various businesses looking for the economic stability he needs.  He’s currently selling popcorn and other sweets from a little cart that’s in pretty bad shape but he does not have sufficient capital to repair it which is why José is looking for financing to repair his popcorn cart and offer his customers better quality products.  

In addition to this, his business would have an improved appearance which will lead to the number of his customers increasing considerably.  His dream is to move is family forward offering them improved quality of life and better economic opportunities for progress.

loans.use: to repair his popcorn cart.

loans.name: Haidee

texts.es:
Haidee vive junto a su familia, al lado sur del país en zona semiurbana, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos, por el momento posee seis, tres pequeños y tres grandes, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y eso le ha regalado experiencia en la crianza de animales.
