Su negocio esta ubicado en el lugar de su residencia; comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija que la prefieren porque su producto es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles. Ella los compra pequeños, luego engorda y vende vivos para el destazo, en el mercado cercano a su localidad o en su misma casa; Haidee es una mujer admirable, enérgica, luchadora pero sobre todo muy perseverante, quiere alcanzar el éxito y vivir en mejores condiciones, sabe que solo con muchísimo esfuerzo y dedicación podrá lograrlo. 

Ella cuenta con cerdos pequeños los cuales desea engordar y necesita para ello comprar concentrado que engorde los animales, además vacunas para el control de parásitos, por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito. Haidee tienen buenas referencias de pago asegura que saldara la deuda y a la vez tiene confianza que le dará a su familia una vida con mejores oportunidades
texts.en:
Haidee lives with her family in the south of the country in a semi-urban area.  She is a pig merchant and currently has six, three big ones and three little ones.  She’s been in this line of work for many years and has gained much experience raising animals.  

Her business is located in her home and she sells all around the community.  She’s acquired many regular customers who prefer her because her products are top quality at affordable prices.  She buys small pigs and raises them until she can sell them live at the market or from her home for butchering.  Haidee is an admirable, energetic, tenacious but above all, humble woman.  She wants to attain success and improve her living conditions and knows that she’ll be able to do so only through effort and dedication.

In order to raise the pigs she uses special feed and vaccinations against parasites, which is why she’s asking Integral.  Haidee has good payment references and is sure that she will be able to repay the loan while at the same time trusts that she’ll give her family a life with better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy concentrated pig feed and vacinations

loans.name: Javier Alveiro

texts.es:
Javier aprendió la actividad de la crianza de cerdos de manera empírica gracias a que sus padres se dedicaron a las labores del campo. Actualmente tiene esta actividad como la fuente de ingresos para su familia y por esto trabaja fuertemente en el negocio para superar las dificultades de capital que tiene. Gracias a la experiencia que ha adquirido en la actividad, es reconocido por tener crías de muy buena calidad, y últimamente esto le ha permitido venir creciendo mucho, es por esto que ahora requiere un préstamo para comprar 2 lechonas y el cuido necesario para su alimentación.

Su sueño es poder ampliar las cocheras donde cuida sus cerdos y así aumentar su capacidad de producción para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Javier learned how to raise pigs empirically because his parents worked in the fields.  This is his current means of earning family income and this is why he works hard at his business in order to overcome the problems he has with capital.  Thanks to the experience gained in his business he’s well-known for producing very good quality litters which has led to much growth recently.  This is why he now needs a loan to buy two female piglets and the feed required for them.  His dream is to enlarge the pigsties where he cares for his pigs and thus increase his production capacity to increase his income that way.

loans.use: to buy two female piglets and feed for them.

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en: La, a resident from Pursat province's Kror Kor district, is a mother of three children. One child is in school while the remaining two children are still too young. For her children's sake, she has been involving in rice-cropping for 10 years. To add more income, she also sells grocery items. From the current business, she can make almost 12,000 KHR per day. La and her co-member, in the same group, are second-time borrowers with Kiva's partner. The first loan, which has been repaid, has made her able to better support her household better than before. Now, both of them are seeking the same amount: 500,000 KHR. La, as a group leader, will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. She hopes that she can maintain her living condition from her current business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for rice farm

loans.name: Tofi

texts.en: Tofi is 62 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years. Tofi has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, and a frying pan. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tofi will hope to open a flea market stall at the main market.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, and a new frying pan

loans.name: Ufiata

texts.en: Ufiata is 52 years old and married with 10 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years. Ufiata has requested a loan to buy some flour, sugar, cooking oil, and a new oven. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Ufiata will help with her family's financial expenses.

loans.use: to buy some flour, sugar, cooking oil, salts, and a new oven.

loans.name: Toetu

texts.en: Toetu is a 32-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows ava samoa (Kava) to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Toetu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, crops, and two wheelbarrows. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Toetu hopes to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, crops, and two wheelbarrows.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando, vive con su esposa, tiene tres hijos de trece, nueve y cinco años de edad, no tiene parientes en el extranjero, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol lo practica desde hace veinte años, el trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres, el horario es todos los días de seis de la mañana  a tres de la tarde.
El Necesita capital de trabajo es por ello que esta decido solicitar un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicidas, para realizar el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, el cual le ayudara de una manera directa porque comprara todos los insumos agrícolas y de esta manera cooperar con la alimentación de su familia .
Sus sueños y aspiraciones son pagar los estudios a sus hijos, que se superen y que tengan la alimentación diaria.
texts.en:
Armando lives with his wife; he has three children who are 13, 9 and 5 years old.  He does not have any relatives abroad.  He works growing corn and beans, an occupation he’s been in for 20 years.  He learned from his parents and his work schedule is from six in the morning to three in the afternoon.

He needs working capital which is why he decided to request a loan to buy manure and herbicide for his corn and bean crops.  This will help him directly because he’ll buy all the farm supplies and thus help to feed his family.  His dreams and hopes are to pay for his children’s schooling so that they will improve themselves and that they have food every day.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria tiene una tienda general ubicada en el borde la carretera que conduce a su municipio y de esta manera genera ingresos con los cuales contribuye económicamente en su hogar para el sostenimiento de los gastos que allí se generan. Antes su familia tenía grandes dificultades económicas y esto motivó a que Maria comenzara con el negocio, y ahora gracias a esto tiene la oportunidad de brindarles a sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Buscando mejorar sus ventas, Maria busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y surtir su negocio ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder tener una tienda con mejores adecuaciones locativas, y también poderle tener luz propia.
texts.en: Maria owns a general store located on the side of the road that leads into her town.  This is how she earns income with which she contributes to her household expenses.  Previously her family had great difficulty financially, which is what motivated Maria to start this business.  Now thanks to this opportunity she is able to provide her 3 children with a better quality of life.  Seeking to improve her sales, Maria is requesting a loan to buy grocery products and to supply her business so as to offer a greater variety of products to her customers.  Her dream is to be able to own a store in a better location, and to have her own electric lighting.

loans.use: to buy grocery products and supply her business so as to offer a greater variety of products to her customers.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
El Sr. Teofilo tiene 40 años, está casado con la  Sra. Hilda de 35 años, ellos llevan  8 años de casados y de dicha unión tienen la dicha de tener 3 hijos.
El Sr. Teofilo,  es carpintero se dedica a la fabricación de muebles que posteriormente los lleva a vender en alrededores de la Ciudad. Él tiene la aspiración de ir creciendo día a día su negocio con la ayuda de su esposa ya que es el sustento de la familia y gracias a eso les puede brindar una vida digna a su familia.
El Sr. solicita su crédito para la compra de materia prima, maderas, tapizados y otros materiales ya que cuenta con muy buena demanda en la venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Sr. Teofilo is 40 years old and married to Sra. Hilda, age 35. They have been married for eight years and have three children.

Sr. Teofilo is a carpenter who makes furniture and then sells his products in the surrounding neighborhoods of the city. He aspires to grow his business each day with the help of his wife so that they can sustain their family. Thanks to his business, he is able to provide a decent life for his family.

Teofilo is requesting a loan so that he can buy raw materials such as wood, upholstery, and other items since there is a high demand for the products that he sells.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg lives with her four children in a leased ger (Mongolian yurt), in the Bayanzurh district in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is deceased. Her oldest son, Anhbayar, is 25 years old, and her oldest daughter, Hostsetseg, is 24 years old. They each work in a private company. Her youngest daughters, Hoszaya and Hosjargal, both 21 years old, are college students. 

In 2004, Oyunchimeg started a retail socks and footlet  business on rental a counter in a clothes market. She sent her older children to the university with the profits from her business. She is planning to purchase a ger (Mongolian yurt). She is a hardworking and cheerful person, and she is asking for 1,840 000 MNT to buy the ger and to buy modernized warm insulation cover for her ger for her family.

loans.use: To buy the ger and to buy modernized warm insulation cover for her ger for her family

loans.name: Jardin De Paxot Group

texts.es:
La señora Margarita esta casada, tiene 24 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijos el cual esta estudiando, se dedica al tejido de guipiles y su posterior venta, inició este negocio gracia al apoyo de su señora madre, hasta ahora lleva 7 años de experiencia., cuenta con al apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a prestar sus servicios de jornalero.


Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de varios colores y clases, para incrementar su producción, y va compra también cortes para hacer la combinación con los guipiles al venderlos. En el futuro quiere ver su negocio estable, y apoyar a su esposo. Las demás integrantes se dedica a la artesanía, comercio y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Margarita, 24, is married and has a son who is in school; she herself never went to school.  She sews traditional blouses to then sell.  She started this business thanks to her mother’s support and now she has 7 years’ experience.  She gets help from her husband who works as a day laborer.

She organizes a group to request a loan to buy thread of various colors and types to increase production.  She will also buy fabric to combine with the blouses and sell.  She wants her business to be stable in the future and to help out her husband.  The other group members work in crafts, commerce and animal husbandry.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, necesita continuar trabajando pero no tiene suficiente dinero para comprar material para reparación de vehículo tales como: pintura, lija, aceite, y todo lo demas necesario para el buen funcionamiento del taller, este credito sera un gran aporte porque Juan no tiene otras entradas de dinero para poder invertir en el negocio.
El crédito anterior manifiesta que ayudo a fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias ha podido ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Juan needs to continue working but lacks sufficient money to buy supplies like paint, sandpaper, oil and the rest needed to repair cars and for his shop’s smooth operation.  This loan is a great support because Juan has no other source of income to invest in the business.  He states that the previous loan helped him strengthen the business and he was able to help his family with the profits earned.

loans.use: to buy paint, sandpaper, oil.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov, aged 40, is a citizen from the Bakan district of Pursat province. She has three children, all of whom help with the family's business. To earn a daily living, she and her husband manage their area of paddy-planting farmland as their primary source of income. During her spare time, Pov also grows vegetables for extra income. Having been in this business for 20 years, she is able to earn almost 19,000 KHR per day. 

Pov's group is composed of three female members. Pov is in her second loan cycle and the other two women are in their first loan cycle with Kiva's partner VisionFund. Pov used her previous loan in a smart manner to sustain her business. Now, she is taking out a new loan of 500,000 KHR, while one of the other group members is applying for 700,000 KHR, and the third group member is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, Pov will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. She hopes to get her crop on time so as to earn a good living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Loem's Group

texts.en: Loem, a breadwinner in a family of three children, is an inhabitant of the Bakan district of Pursat Province. She earns a living from her desserts-selling business. It is the only business that she has been with for 31 years, from which she is able to earn about 7,000 KHR per day. Loem has never had a loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) before. In this group of two, her co-member is also a first-time borrower. Loem and her co-member are each seeking the same amount of 400,000 KHR. As a group leader, she will use her portion to buy pigs for raising for extra income. She hopes to fatten her pigs and sell for a high price so as to better her living condition.

loans.use: To buy pigs for raising for extra income

loans.name: Sene

texts.en: Sene is a 23 year old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Sene has requested a loan to buy seeds and to pay for her children's school fees. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Sene hopes to expand her business and to save some money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy seeds, weed killer, and a wheelbarrow and to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Pologa

texts.en: Pologa is 58 years old and married with eight children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Pologa has requested a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, frying pans, and an oven. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Pologa will help with her family's financial needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, a new oven, frying pans, yeast, and baking soda.

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en: Kalala is a 47-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Kalala has requested a loan to buy chemicals, shovels, sprayers, crops, and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Kalala hopes to buy her children new school uniforms.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, shovels, sprayers, crops, and a wheelbarrow,.

loans.name: Enebish

texts.en: Enebish is 62 years old and lives with her son in a 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai province, Mongolia.  Her son is a college student. She started her hairdressing business in 1997. She runs her business in a rented space. Her monthly sales amount to 600,000-800,000 MNT.  Her hairdressing is stylish and inexpensive. She cuts around 25-30 people's hair a day. She is a humble and hard-working woman who says, "I want to build my own beauty salon." She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to pay her son's tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Mrs Otgonbayar lives with her husband and three children in a ger in Govisumber province, Mongolia. Her husband started to work in mining company. Her older son, Urtnasan, is 14 years old. He goes to a secondary school. Her younger son, Enhnasan, is seven years old. He joined an elementary school. Her daughter, Munhnasan, is seven years old. She joined an elementary school. 

Mrs Otgonbayar started a meat trade business on a rental counter in 2009. From January she start to sell organic dairy products. Her organic dairy product sales are going well, because she sells at a lower price than other stores. She is a hardworking and a good-hearted person. She needs 885,000 MNT to purchase more organic dairy products from the countryside for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more organic dairy products from the countryside for her business.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs.Altantsetseg is 40 years old and lives with her husband and her two children, in a house, in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband's name is Mandahbayar and he helps her with her business. Her older daughter is a college student and younger daughter goes to secondary school. Mrs.Altantsetseg started her own organic vegetable and watermelon trade business in 1995 and she started her family's organic vegetable growing business in 2011. Her family is growing organic vegetables and watermelon on two hectares uptown. She has years of experience in the organic vegetable growing and trade business. The local residents appreciate her as a open and friendly woman. She needs 5,000,000 MNT loan to pay cost of the food and gas for workers to harvest this year's organic vegetables and to pay cost of transport them to Ulaanbaatar to sell.

loans.use: To pay cost of the food and gas for workers to harvest this year's organic vegetables and to pay cost of transport them to Ulaanbaatar to sell.

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Mrs. Jargalsaihan is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a small house in Uvurhangai Province. Her husband is a carpenter. Her older daughter is a college student and her younger daughter goes to kindergarden. Mrs. Jargalsaihan operates a business selling organic apples in the central market of the province. Her business has improved and now she sells many kinds of fruit. She imports high quality produce from Selenge and Huvsgul provinces and keeps the products in her own storeroom. Her next goals are to enlarge her counter and then to open her own shop. 

Mrs. Jargalsaihan requests 5,000,000 tugriks to buy more organic apples from the countryside to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy more organic apples from the countryside to increase her working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras como tomates,apio,perejil entre otras verduras,la socia vende al por mayor llevando a diferentes lugares como puerto maldonado,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos para que ellos terminen de estudiar,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cebollas,zanahorias,toamtes,apio y perejil al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues selling vegetables like tomatoes, celery and parsley, among other vegetables.  She sells at wholesale in various places like Puerto Maldonado.  It’s by means of this business that she wants to move her children forward so that they can finish their schooling. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the vegetables.  She’s requesting the loan to buy onions, carrots, tomatoes, celery and parsley at wholesale.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy onions, carrots, tomatoes, celery and parsley at wholesale.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de bordados,la socia realiza trabajos de cojines,alfombras y manteles,ella borda con hilos y los vende en forma independiente,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los bordados.La socia solicita el credito para comprar hilos de colores y agujas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues in the embroidery business.  She does work on cushions, mats and tablecloths.  She embroiders with thread and sells them independently.  She works from 8am until 5pm.  Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her embroidery.  She’s requesting the loan to buy colored thread and needles at wholesale.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy colored thread and needles at wholesale.

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosalbina;La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de restaurante,la socia ofrece desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia trabaja en su negocio todos los dias desde las 07:00am hasta las 08:00pm aproximadamente,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como arroz y aceite.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member belongs to the "CUSCO" communal bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.  Her name is Rosalbina, and she operates a restaurant where she serves breakfast, lunch and dinner.  She has been running this business for some time, and it is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day.  She works at her business every day from 7:00 am until approximately 8:00 pm.  She is a responsible and diligent person, and through this business is raising her family.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as rice and oil.  She is happy to receive the loan and commits to making her repayments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice and oil.

loans.name: Duo Flores Del Molino Group

texts.es: Dúo Flores del Molino.  Este Dúo está integrado por la señora María Balvina quien tiene 32 años de edad, ella desde hace más de tres años se ha dedica a la crianza de cerdos ya que ha encontrado en esta labor un ingreso para ayudar a cubrir sus necesidades y de esa forma mantener a su hijo pequeño de tan solo un año de edad, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de cerdos para la crianza ya que ella los crese y ya cuando estén grandes y gordos los vende y es asi como ella obtiene sus ganancias espera que le puedan dar ese apoyo que necesita para salir adelante con su niño.
texts.en:
Flowers of the Mill Duo

María Balvina, 32, has been raising pigs for more than three years because she found in this type of work a way to earn income to help meet her needs and support her little one-year-old son.  She’s requesting this loan to buy piglets to raise because she raises them and when they are big and fat she sells them and this is how she earns profits.  She hopes that she will be able to receive this support she needs to get ahead wither little boy.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en: Marcos is a 46-year-old farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. He is married with three children aged 10, 16 and 18. Marcos has been growing rice for a long time now, which helps support the basic needs of his family. He  works hard on his farm so he can have a good harvest. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for his farm. His profit will be used to buy nutritious food for his family and pay for school fees of his children. In the future, he hopes to have more land he can cultivate for a bigger income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is 30 years old from Gaza.

He has owned a shop for the maintenance and sales of refrigerators and washing machines since 2011. 

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy an electricity generator and build an attic in his shop for storage.

He hopes that this loan will help him buy more refrigerators and washing machines and thus improve his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy an electricity generator and build an attic in his shop for storage.

loans.name: Qapac Qolla Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal QAPAC QOLLA; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Anta  en la provincia  de Anta departamento de Cusco.

La socia Natividad , la socia tiene 49 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa ,la socia vende lo que son pantalones, chompas, casacas,polos entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio cada dia,la socia distribuye su mercadería a sus amistades y familiares que le solicitan ella trabaja de forma independiente ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como casacas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de compra y venta de ganados, crianza de animales, venta de fruta, venta de zapatos, venta de ropa, agricultura, costureria.

Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta son socios que pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Natividad is a member of the Communal Bank “Qapac Qolla” which is located in the District and Province of Anta, Department of Cusco.

She is 49 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. Natividad divides her time between her daily activities and her business of buying and selling clothes. She sells trousers, sweaters, jackets, pullover shirts, and other items. Natividad enjoys managing her business and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day. She delivers the merchandise to friends and relatives who have placed orders. Natividad works independently. She is a responsible and industrious individual who strives to move her family forward.

Natividad is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, such as jackets. The other members engage in businesses such as buying and selling livestock, raising animals, selling fruit, selling shoes, selling clothes, farming, and sewing. The members who appear in the smaller attached photo received permission to arrive late to the meeting because of their work.

Natividad is grateful for the loan she has received and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy jackets and other merchandise.

loans.name: Nardy

texts.es:
La señora Nardy de 42 años de edad, es casada, vive en la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 2 hijos, y cuenta que su marido es contratistas de obras viales del estado.
 Nardy es modista de alta costura, realiza pedidos de trajes para damas, pantalones, camperitas de temporada, tiene su propio taller en su casa. La señora Nardy es una persona muy trabajadora y cuenta que desde joven ha trabajado y cuenta que gracias a eso tiene mucha clientela.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas en cantidades, ya que tiene una buena cantidad de pedidos y quiere poder cumplir con ellos. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues le será muy provechosa.
texts.en:
Sra. Nardy is 42 years old, married, and lives in the city of Villarrica. She has two children. Her husband is contractor who works on the state highways.

Nardy is a seamstress who designs high-end fashion. She receives orders for women’s suits, trousers, and seasonal jackets. Nardy has a workshop in her home. She is an industrious individual who has been working from a young age. Thanks to her efforts, she has acquired many customers.

Nardy is requesting a loan so that she can buy fabric in bulk since she has several orders that she wants to complete. She is grateful for the assistance she has received, which will be very advantageous.

loans.use: to buy fabric in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy glass at wholesale.

loans.name: Jessica Belinda

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo en una lavanderia,ella realiza todo tipo de lavados de ternos,vestidos entre otra ropa,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia esta estudiando y por medio de sus estudios quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tenr su propio negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para terminar de pagar las mensualidades de sus estudios.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: She continues working in a laundry doing all kinds of laundry work; she launders suits, dresses, etc.  She works from 8am until 5pm.  She’s also taking classes and wants to get ahead by means of her studies.  Her dream is to own grocery store.  She’s asking for the loan to finish paying her monthly tuition fees.  She is grateful for the support provided and commits to make her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to finish paying her tuition fees.

loans.name: Kelly Edith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Kelly Edith;La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de brindar servicio de transporte de carga como verduras,frutas,papas entre otros de acuerdo a las necesidades de sus clientes ,la socia transporta esta mercaderia a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado y Sicuani, siendo su esposo quien a veces maneja el camion ya que tambien se dedican a la musica , ambos tienen un grupo musical siendo su esposo el cantante,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.


La socia soliicta el credito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro y para el cambio de aceite.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Kelly Edith is a member of the “Cusco” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She continues working providing cargo, like vegetables, fruit, potatoes and others, transportation services according to her customers’ needs  She transports this merchandise in the cities of Puerto Maldonado and Sicuani.  Her husband sometimes is the one who drives the truck since they are also musicians.  They have a musical group; her husband is the singer.  She is a responsible, dedicated woman who supports her family this way.  She requests the loan to service her car and to do an oil change.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to service her car and do an oil change.

loans.name: Shirley Aracely

texts.es:
Shirley tiene 34 años es madre soltera tiene un niño. Ella empezó a trabajar desde muy pequeña sus padres fueron un pilar muy importante en su vida, ellos le inculcaron principio y valores. Le enseñaron que debía de ser principalmente  responsable y así se fue desarrollándose en el comercio.

El tipo de negocio al que se dedica es la venta de ropa, el trabajo lo realiza sola unos de los métodos para vender es cuando se reúnen con sus amigas aprovecha la oportunidad  para ofrecer la mercadería asegura que ya tiene clientes fijos y que es muy popular en el sector por su negocio. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar ropa para hombres y mujeres. El sueño de Shirley es obtener su propia boutique y desarrollarse en en el mundo de los negocios.
texts.en:
Shirley is a 34-year old single mother who has one son. She began working when she was very young. Her parents were an important mainstay in her life; they instilled principles and values in her. They taught her that she must be principally responsible and in this way, she developed herself in business.

The type of business to which she has dedicated herself is clothing sales. She does the work by herself. One of the ways she does sales is by taking advantage of the opportunity to offer her goods when she meets up with her friends which ensures that she already has loyal customers and is very popular in the area because of her business.

With the loan, she wants to buy men's and women's clothing. Shirley's dream is to have her own boutique and to grow in the business world..

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's clothing, such as pants and shirts

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Karina;continua dedicandose a trabajar en su negocio de agencia de viajes,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia vende diferentes tipos de paquetes turisticos como city tours,valle sagrado,camino inka entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de boletos turisticos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: Karina is a member of the “Cusco” communal bank that’s located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.  She continues working in a travel agency.  She’s been in this job for some time now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work every day.  She sells a variety of tourism packages like city tours, tours to Valle Sagrado, Inca Trail tours, among others.  She’s a responsible, dedicated person who supports her family this way.  She’s requesting the loan to buy tourist entry tickets.  She is grateful for the support being provided her and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy tourist entry fees.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 28-year-old grocery store owner in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is married and blessed with three children, aged eight, six, and four, respectively. She has been running the grocery store successfully for the past six years.

This is Salome’s third business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more green maize, peas, kale, and bananas for sale. 

She will use the anticipated profits to open another grocery store and educate her children. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more green maize, peas, kale, and bananas

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en:
Joweria is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga, in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past two years, Joweria has been working hard to manage her food stall where she cooks and sells matooke, a Ugandan dish. 

To help expand her business, Joweria has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more matooke for resale, and will help Joweria generate greater profits and pay her daughter's school fees. Joweria hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home on it. 

Joweria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more matooke for resale.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia tiene 53 años empezo con el negocio de viveres  en su casa con un pequeño local. Desde que se separo de su esposo ella comenzo a trabajar en su pequeña tienda. 

En la actualidad esta contesta porque tiene surtida su tienda ya que con ezfuerzo y dedicacion ha salido adelantes. Trabaja sola desde las 7:00am hasta las 7:00pm vende azucar arroz aceite y otras cosas mas no tiene ninguna dificultad en su trabajo.

Lucrecia tiene 1 hijo  y uno que ya  es adulto. Con el prestamo quiere comprar vievres para la tienda como  enlatados, bebidas, dulces, arroz etc.  Uno de sus sueños es completar de arreglar su casa y salud para tener fuerzas para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is 53 years old. She has one child and one grown son. She started the food business with a small shop in her house. She started working in the small shop after she splitting up with her husband.

In all actuality, she is happy because she has her store stocked, and now, with effort and dedication, she has gotten ahead. She works by herself from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm. selling sugar, rice, oil and other things. She has no difficulty with her work.

With the loan she wants to buy canned goods, beverages, sweets, etc. One of her dreams is to finish fixing her house, and health to have the strength to keep working.

loans.use: to purchase canned items, beverages, sweets, rice, and other goods

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa  operates a grocery shop at Esuekyir near Abura which she has done for six  years now.   The items in her grocery shop are milk, Milo (cocoa powder), sugar, soups, different kinds of soft  drinks, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish,  biscuits, toffees, powdered milk,  etc.  She is married with two  childern.   

Yaa  uses her income to help her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit,  Yaa plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Johannna Marieliza

texts.es:
Johanna empezo hace 9 años en su taller de confeccion debido a que salio del trabajo porque sus hijos estaban pequeños. Ella comenzó a indagar en las actividades que sabia hacer para poder tener un ingreso, asi que decidió comenzar con confección. 

En la actualidad tiene su taller de confeccion ahora hace su trabajo desde las 9:00 a 14:00pm de lunes a sabado.  Unas de sus dificultades actualmente esta en el espacio que es muy reducido en su taller para hacer la ropa ya que el taller lo tiene en una parte de su casa. 
Johanna esta casada tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 4 años estudian en una escuela fiscal su esposo trabaja en una empacadora de camaron. Con el prestamo va a mejorar su vivienda, para agrandar el taller de confeccion comprando con el prestamo arena, bloques, pintura etc. Unas de sus metas es ampliar su negocio y mejorar su vivienda
texts.en:
Johanna has been working out of her workshop for 9 years now because she had to leave the workforce when her kids were little.  She began working in areas she had knowledge about in order to gain income which is why she later decided to start up her clothing workshop.  

She know has her own textile shop and works from 9AM until 5PM, Monday to Sunday.  Her current challenge is that her work space to make clothes is too small due to the fact her workshop is an extension of her home.
Johanna is married and has 2 children; ages 10 and 4.  Her kids study at a public school and her husband works at a shrimp packaging plant.  With this loan she plans to make home improvements like enlarging the workshop by buying:  sand, cement blocks, paint etc..  One of her goals is to expand her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement blocks, paint, etc..

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is a 24-year-old woman with no children. She has a small plantation and grows banana trees and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Filomena has requested a loan to buy taro plants and chemicals for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Filomena hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy taro plants, chemicals and weed killer

loans.name: Elfrida Cristina

texts.es:
Elfrida inicio con su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien se dedica a la pesca. Poco a poco pudo comprar  mercadería y adquirir una vitrina para la venta de viveres de primera necesidad.
Sus hijos le  ayudan en el negocio y trabaja hasta las 21:00pm.  Unas de sus dificultades  en el trabajo es la enfermedad ya que le gusta atender a su clientela y cuando se enferma ansia retomar sus labores. 

Elfrida está casada su esposo trabaja en la pesca tienen 2 hijas pero ya están casadas pero aun viven en su casa.
Con el préstamo va a comprar arroz, azúcar y snacks para variar los viveres que vende a sus clientes. Unas de sus metas y poder ampliar su local y contar con otros servicios
texts.en:
Elfrida began her business with the help of her husband who is a fisherman.  LIttle by little, they were able to buy merchandise and acquired a glass cabinet for the sales of daily necessities and groceries.

Her children help her in the store and she works until 9:00 p.m.  One of her difficulties in her work is when she gets sick, since she likes to wait on her customers and when she's sick she gets impatient to return to work.

Elfrida is married and her husband works as a fisherman, and she has two daughters, who are both married but still live at home.

With the loan, she will buy rice, sugar, and snacks to increase the variety of groceries she sells to her customers.  One of her goals is to be able to grow her store and provide other services.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and snacks.

loans.name: Maria Del  Rosario

texts.es:
Maria tiene 40 años es madre soltera tienes 3 hijos y estudian en una Isntitucion Fiscal.Hace muchos años unos amigos le enseñanron como fundir metal y hace 3 años se independizo. 

En la actualidad su actividad principal de ingresos es fundir metal para la venta de construcciones, hace su trabajo con un obrero y empieza su trabajo desde la 6:00 AM Hasta la 6:00 PM.El tipo de negocio es una fabrica de fundicion de metales. Con el prestamo quiere comprar herramientas para su negocio. 

El sueño de Maria es tener una fabrica grande,una casa propia y salud para poder lograrlo.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old and a single mother of three children. They study at a public school. Many years ago some friends taught her how to found metal, and three years ago she became independent.

Currently her main source of income is founding metal in order to sell it. She works with a laborer and starts her work from 6 AM until 6 PM. The type of business is a metal foundry. With the loan she wants to buy tools for her business.

Maria's dream is to have a large factory, her own house, and the health to be able to achieve it.

loans.use: to buy tools to found metal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Layaly

texts.en: Layaly is a married woman and a mother of two children. While her husband serves in the military, she has opened a store where she sells decorative flowers and has recently established a section for selling clothes. She has applied to this loan in order to buy a collection of clothes to sell to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy a collection of clothes to sell

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik lives in Kajaran town in the Syunik region with his wife and parents. Garik works at a local mining factory.  He is also involved in beekeeping. He currently keeps 15 beehives. 

In order to gather more honey, Garik has applied for this loan to purchase 10 colonies of bees and 20 hives for the new and old colonies. Garik has a large number of clients for honey, so the expansion of the farm means more sold honey and additional income for him and his family.

loans.use: buy bee colonies and hives

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de alfalfa y maiz es una planta que sirve de alimento para los cuyes y conejos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos y que estos sean profesionales,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el maiz y la alfalfa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz y alfalfa al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to manage her business of buying and selling alfalfa and corn. These crops are used as animal feed for guinea pigs and rabbits. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. Through this business, she is able to help her children move forward so that they can become professionals. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell corn and alfalfa.

The member is requesting a loan so that she can buy corn and alfalfa in bulk. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy corn and alfalfa in bulk to sell as animal feed.

loans.name: Yadigar

texts.en:
Yadigar is a 46 year-old man, married with two sons.   He breeds sheep and cattle and sells them to local butchers. Yadigar has 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, who taught him the best way to raise cattle.

Yadigar usually buys small cattle and lambs, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Fur is also very popular among local people. Fur and meat selling brings 200 AZN in income per month. People use the meat in everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma, and always use yogurt sauce. 

This is the only income in his family, and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Yadigar applied for 1000 AZN to purchase 8 sheep and cattle.

loans.use: to buy 8 sheep and cattle to raise and resell.

loans.name: Fanny Diocelina

texts.es:
Fanny empezó vendiendo comida y la cuñada le vendió la tienda hace 1 año el negocio va creciendo poco a poco, ella tiene 26 años, trabaja todo el día su esposo le ayuda cuando llega del trabajo.

 El esposo  de Fanny es conserje ellos son de estado civil unión libre, tienen un hijo de 2 años .Su negocio es un Mini Mark tienda pues su meta es hacer que crezca su negocio ya que solo se lo puede lograr cumpliendo las necesidades del cliente y con mucha dedicación. Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres de primera necesidad como arroz, maíz, enlatados, frutas etc.
texts.en:
Fanny, 26, began selling food and her sister-in-law sold her the store a year ago.  The business is growing little by little.  She works all day and her husband helps her when he gets home from work.  Fanny's husband is a custodian.  They are in a common-law marriage and have a two-year-old child.

Her business is a corner store.  Her goal is to make her business grow, which she can achieve only by fulfilling the needs of her customers and with great dedication.

With the loan she wants to buy basic necessities such as rice, corn, canned goods, fruits, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, canned goods, and fruit

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en:
Rasela is 18 years old and married, with no children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pork buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, sugar and other things needed for her business. 

In the future, Rasela hopes to expand her business and to save more money for the future of her family. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, baking soda, yeast, and oil.

loans.name: Sorayda

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de medicamentos,vacunas y antibioticos para los animales,la socia tambien anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de tienda de abarrotes pero no le fue muy bien porque los prodcutos que vendian estaban caros,pero la socia es una socia emprendedora y en el futuro le gustaria ampliar el negocio de venta de medicamentos,vacunas y antibioticos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar medicinas,antibioticos y vacunas.

  La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to manage her business of selling medicines, vaccines, and antibiotics for animals. She previously owned a grocery store, but it did not do very well because the products she sold were too expensive. The member is an enterprising woman who would like to expand her business of selling medicines, vaccines, and antibiotics in the future.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy medicines, antibiotics, and vaccines. The member is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy medicines, antibiotics, and vaccines.

loans.name: Sonia Sabina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agencia de viajes,ella tiene una agencia donde vende boletos para viajes a muchipicchu y tambien brinda servicios para turistas a distintos lugares de cusco,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir a pasear con sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agencia de viajes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar boletos turisticos y comprar un escritorio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in the travel agency business.  She has an agency where she sells tickets for trips to Machu Picchu and also provides service to tourists to various places in Cusco.  She works from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m.

In her free time she likes to go out with her children.  Her dream is to expand her travel agency.

She's requesting the loan to buy tickets for tours and also a desk.

She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy tour tickets and a desk

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla, esta decidida a continuar trabajando en la venta de pupusas, para ello necesita dinero para la compra de materiales como lo es: chicharrones, aceite, tomates, carne y quesillo, esto la motivo a solicitar nuevamente credito y poder continuar fortaleciendo el negocio.
Con el crédito anterior tubo efectos muy importantes, ya que mejoro su negocio, aumentaron los clientes y tiene mejor servicio. Ha mejorado su condición económica y su familia se encuentra muy bien de salud.
texts.en:
Karla is determined to continue with her pupusa [filled, grilled corncakes] sales business and to do so needs money to buy supplies like fried pork, oil, tomatoes, meat and string cheese.  This has led her to request financing again to continue strengthening the business.

She had positive effects from the previous loan in that her business improved, customers increased and her service is better.  Her economic situation has improved and her family is all in good health.

loans.use: to buy fried pork, oil, tomtoes, meat and string cheese.

loans.name: Dúo Luz Del Campo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Luz del Campo.
Este dúo está integrado por la señora  Irma quien es originaria de San Martin, tiene 2 hijos pequeños , ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior y cosméticos, gracias a Dios tiene su local en el mercado municipal de la localidad donde ella vive, está contenta porque tiene la oportunidad de crédito ya que en estos momentos lo está necesitando, está solicitando este creditito para la compra de ropa interior y para la compra de cosméticos ya que sus clientes ha aumentado y le piden más variedad en productos.
texts.en:
Luz del Campo Duo

Irma, a native of San Martín, is a member of this duo.  She has two small children and makes a living selling lingerie and cosmetics.  She thanks God she has her place in the municipal market of the town where she lives.  She's happy she has the chance for a loan because she needs one right now.

She's requesting this small loan to buy lingerie and cosmetics because her customers have asked her for a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to buy lingerie and cosmetics

loans.name: Justa Danira

texts.es: Justa tiene 41 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en Olanchito, Yoro. Justa lleva 13 años de dedicarse a la venta de golosinas como pastelitos con carne, tajadas con carne molida, hamburguesas, baleadas (tortilla de harina rellena con frijoles, queso, y otros al gusto) etc. También refrescos, agua en bolsa, jugos etc. este negocio lo tiene establecido en la cafetería de uno de los colegios de educación secundaria de la ciudad, y sus clientes son los estudiantes. Con las ganancias ha mantenido siempre surtido de productos. Ella solicita un préstamo de 6,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar refrescos, jugos, agua y algunos insumos para hacer comidas para la venta. Su idea es mantener producto en inventario pues la demanda que hay en el colegio es bastante. Su meta es que se mejore la situación económica para tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Justa, 41, is married and has three children.  She lives in Olanchito, Yoro.  She’s been selling snacks like meat turnovers, fried plantain with ground meat, hamburgers, ‘baleadas’ (flour tortilla filled with beans, cheese and others to order), etc. for 13 years.  She also sells soft-drinks, water in bags, juice, etc.  She has this business located in one of the local secondary school cafeterias; her customers are students.  She’s always used profits to stock up on products.  

She’s requesting a 6,000 Lempira loan to buy soft-drinks, juice, water and some ingredients to make the food to sell.  Her idea is to keep products in stock because demand at the school is quite high.  Her goal is to improve her economic situation in order to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, water, juice and ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Lezilda

texts.en:
Lezilda is a 35-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with two children, aged 2 and 9. She is working hard as a farmer with her husband. Together, they grow rice for an income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, quality seedlings, and pesticides and to pay for the hired help. These things are needed for her farming to succeed. Her profit will then be invested in her children's education and the family's daily consumption. 

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger farm that she can cultivate for a better profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, quality seedlings, and pesticides and to pay for labor

loans.name: Dúo Arca De Noé Group

texts.es:
Dúo Arca de Noé 
Este Dúo Está conformado por la señora Juana quien tiene 38 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado de su localidad desde hace ya varios años día a día lucha por agrandar su negocio ya que desea generar más ganancias para estar mejor y tener mejores oportunidades , está solicitando este crédito para la compra de verduras para la venta y así seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
This group known as “Arca de Noé” (Noah’s Ark) includes Sra. Juana, age 38. She has been selling vegetables at the local market for many years. Every day, she strives to expand her business so that she can generate more income and have better opportunities.

Juana is requesting a loan so that she can buy vegetables to sell and continue her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Silvera

texts.en:
Silvera is a 35-year-old woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with six children. The oldest is 14, and the youngest is 7 years old. 

Silvera owns a sari-sari store (general store) where she sell basic household needs like toiletries, canned goods, soft drinks, chips, seasoning and milk. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasoning and toiletries. The profit that she will generate will greatly help meet the needs of her family, especially food and school fees. In the future, she would like to have a bigger store that will offer what her customers need.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasoning and toiletries

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en:
Faafetai, a 40-year-old married mother of three, would like to start a business growing taro plants, banana trees and some vegetables to earn a living. A member of SPBD for one year, she has requested a loan to buy chemicals and equipment to start her business.

Faafetai will use her profits to develop and expand the enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, a wheel barrow, weed killers, and shovels.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.en:
Carmelo is 36 years old, from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is engaged in a fishing business. This has been his source of income to provide for his family's needs for three years now. He has three children to support, aged 5, 9 and 11. 

Carmelo is asking for a loan to buy an engine for his fishing boat. He would like to replace his old engine so he can be more productive in his fishing activity. The profit from fishing will enable him to send his children to school and provide a healthy diet for his family. 

In the future, he plans to expand his fishing to make a good profit so his family can live in comfort and abundance.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his fishing boat

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 33-year-old woman from the community of Dagohoy, Bohol. She is married with two children, aged 5 and 7. Her husband works as a welder and she has operated a sari-sari (general) store for a year now. 

She is asking for a loan to buy a variety of merchandise for her store, like seasoning, toiletries, detergent, canned goods and noodles. The income helps in providing her family's daily consumption and allowing her children to go to school. 

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger income by improving her store and variety of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Rosse Mary

texts.es: La Sra. Rosse tiene 40 años, tiene tres hijos  de las edades de 4, 13 y 18 años, ella se dedica al servicio de peinados y de manicurista y también maquillaje en su salón de belleza que se encuentra en la zona Florida de la ciudad de La Paz este préstamo es su tercera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rosse va a utilizar este préstamo  para la compra de productos de peluquería y belleza  y también para  algunos materiales que necesita y así de esta manera incrementar  su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que necesita ampliar su negocio, la Sra. Rosse enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener mayor cobertura del mercado y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando materiales y mejorando su trabajo.
texts.en: Rosse, 40, has three children aged 4, 13 and 18 years.  She provides hair styling, manicure and make-up services in her beauty salon located in the city of La Paz’s Florida zone.  This is her 3rd sequence in the institution and Rosse will use this loan to buy beauty and barber products as well as for some supplies she needs in order to increase her working capital this way.  Her reason for requesting the loan is that she needs to expand the business.  The challenge Rosse faces in her business is to cover a larger market share and she will use profits to continue buying supplies and improving her work.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon products.

loans.name: Marlon Asmel

texts.es:
Marlon, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, esta viviendo con su esposa y tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, el señor Marlon se dedica a dicha actividad desde hace quince años, este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres, realizandolo todo los días dependiendo el ciclo agrícola.
El esta solicitando un crédito  para la compra de insumos para la producción tales como: compra de tres sacos de abono y herbicidas, para el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, de esta manera llevar el sustento diario a su familia.
Sus sueños y aspiraciones son que sus hijos estudien una carrera universitaria  y que su negocio con los materiales agricolas se supere.
texts.en:
Marlon grows basic grains.   He’s living with his wife and has a two-year-old son.  Marlon has been in this occupation for 15 years; he learned it from his parents and works every day depending on the agricultural cycle.  

He’s asking for this loan to buy farming supplies like three sacks of manure and herbicide for the corn and bean crops in order to provide his home with daily sustenance.  His dreams and hopes are that his children study university careers and that the farm supplies help his business to move forward.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of manure and herbicides.

loans.name: Rosayde

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Rosayde; la socia se dedica al negocio de agencia de viajes ,la socia vende diferentes tipos de paquetes turisticos como city tours,valle sagrado,camino inca,entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia sale adelante,la socia lleva poco tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia ,la socia espera que su negocio le valla bien y asi poder agrandar su agencia de viajes.


La socia solicito el credito para la compra de boletos turisticos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en: Rosayde is a member of the “Cusco” communal bank located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.  She’s in the travel agency business.  She sells all sorts of tourist packages like city tours, Valle Sagrado tours, Inca Trail tours, among others.  She’s a responsible, dedicated person who gets ahead this way.  She’s been in business a short time and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  She hopes to do well in her business to be able to enlarge her travel agency.  She requests the loan to buy tourist entry tickets.  She’s grateful for the support she’ll get and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy tourist admission tickets.

loans.name: Eqlas

texts.en:
Eqlas is a 28-year-old married woman from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan. She has three family members. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to buy a sewing machine and she would like to buy materials for sewing such as fabric, beads and silk. 

In the future she hopes to increase her income and she also wants to expand her home.

Since Eqlas is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials for sewing

loans.name: Joseline Yesenia

texts.es:
Joseline, vive con su familia, es una persona muy visionaria, se dedica a la venta de ropa al detalle. Su lugar de venta son los alrededores de la zona de residencia, practica la venta casa por casa  y  en los parques de la ciudad.
La venta la realiza de manera personalizada, tiene muchas estrategias para obtener más clientes, tomo la decisión  de solicitar un crédito porque  manifiesta que su objetivo es buscar su desarrollo como persona y como empresaria. El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de mas mercadería blusas, faldas, ropa interior, para aumentar sus ganancias y obtener empoderamiento en su negocio, así poder comprar una variedad de prendas de vestir, mejorar la calidad de vida en su familia y obtener un establecimiento propio.
texts.en:
Joseline lives with her family. She is a visionary individual who runs a retail clothing business. She sells her garments door-to-door in the areas surrounding her home and in the city parks.
She offers a personalised service and uses many sales strategies to attract more customers. She decided to apply for a loan because, she says, her goal is to develop herself personally and as a business woman. She will invest the loan in the purchase of more stock such as blouses, skirts and underwear in order to increase her earnings and to grow her business; consequently, she will be able to buy a range of clothing garments, improve her family's quality of life and acquire her own premises.

loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Nely Yolanda

texts.es:
Doña Nely tiene 56 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 4 hijos, vive con dos hijos varones en Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Ella tiene aproximadamente 23 años de dedicarse a la confección de ropa como: pantalones, sabanas, cojines, almohadas, y ropa para bebe. El taller de costura lo tiene en su casa y las prendas que confecciona es por medio de pedidos. Ya tiene buena clientela. El préstamo que solicita es el tercero con ODEF y es por 3,500 Lempiras con el cual va comprar telas para la confección de toallitas para bebes  y almohadas. Este préstamo le ayudara a cumplir con los pedidos que le han hecho los clientes y para tener en inventario más productos. Su meta es seguir creciendo con el negocio ya que siempre ha sido su fuente de ingresos familiares.
texts.en: Nelly, 56, is single due to widowhood.  She has four children and lives with two of her sons in Chamelecón, San Pedro Sula, Cortes.  She’s been making clothes like pants, sheets, cushions, pillows and clothes for infants for about 23 years.  Her workshop is at home and she makes the items to order.  She has a good clientele.  The loan she’s requesting from ODEF is her third and it’s for 3,500 Lempiras that she will use to buy fabric to make little towels for babies and pillows.  This loan will help her fill pending customer orders and to have more of her products in stock.  Her goal is to continue growing with the business because it’s always been the source of family income.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make pillows and small towels to sell.

loans.name: Polly Pocket Group

texts.es:
Concepción, es una integrante del grupo Polly Pocket, grupo que se encuentra en el municipio de Guadalupe. Ella es esposa, madre y dueña de su propio micronegocio. Tiene más de 10 años vendiendo ropa de segunda, se dio cuenta que la mercancía tenía demanda, así que se animo a inyectar capital a su negocio para poder vender ropa nueva. 
Hace poco empezó a incluir en sus ventas, algo que inicio como hobbie: bisutería y joyería. Decidió tomar el compromiso de un crédito para seguir con su negocio de ropa, pero también para comprar materia prima que nutriera su nuevo producto  y con ello, ha comenzado a comercializar creaciones que han nacido de imaginación.
Concepción, esta convencida que lo que hace con decisión le produce frutos.
texts.en:
Concepción es a member of the “Polly Pocket” group which es located in the town of Guadalupe.  She’s a wife, mother and owner of her own micro business.  She’s been selling second-hand clothes for more than 10 years.  She noted that this type of merchandise was in high demand so she ventured to inject capital into the business in order to sell new clothes.

She recently started to add to her sales something she started as a hobby: costume and fine jewelry.  She decided to take on the commitment of a loan to continue with her clothing business but also to buy raw materials to nourish her new products and with it start to sell the creations that spring from her imagination.  Concepción is convinced that what she does with determination will yield fruits.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry merchandise.

loans.name: Alatasi

texts.en: Alatasi  is 69 years old and married with 2 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as elei printed material and puletasi (women's clothing). She has been doing this for three years. Alatasi needs a loan to buy some plastic bags, a sewing machine, threads, needles and rolls of material. She hopes to use her profits to buy her family whatever they need. She became a member of SPBD to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, a sewing machine, threads, needles and material

loans.name: Dulce Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Comité Dulce Esperanza se formó con la unión de 19 señoras, vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también trabajan juntas y se ayudan a salir adelante.
Maria Angela tiene una mercería donde vende todo tipo de productos, como ser prendas, artículos de bazar, calzados, etc. Cuenta que gracias a la variedad que tiene puede dar a su clientela gran variedad de productos que necesitan, es por eso que le va muy bien.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de calzados, artículos de bazar, etc., con lo que podrá seguir surtiendo su negocio. Agradece a Kiva y fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad que reciben.
texts.en:
The “Dulce Esperanza” (Sweet Hope) committee was formed when 19 women from the Mariano Roque Alonso neighborhood joined together.  All of the committee members have their independent activities but they also do joint work to help each other get ahead.

María Ángela has a general store where she sells all types of products like clothes, household items, footwear, etc.  She says that thanks to the variety she has she can offer her customers a wide selection of products they need and this is why she does very well.

She requests the loan to buy footwear, household items, etc. to continue stocking her store.  She thanks Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they give them.

loans.use: to buy shoes and household items.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El señor Edgar tiene 43 años, vive en la ciudad de Ità, se dedica a la Olería hace mas de 10 años, la cual es propia y también ayuda a su hermano en la producción de ladrillos en la Olerla familiar que poseen, su clientela está conformada por contratista de obra, arquitectos y particulares que reciben en obra o lo retiran personalmente de la Olería.
El préstamo que el señor Edgar solicita es para la compra de Arena ya que tiene un  pedido importante de ladrillos que desea cubrir y no quiere fallar a su cliente. El  opera exclusivamente con la Fundación Pya. Hace mas de 5 años en forma continua y demostrando responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas, su objetivo es cada día ir ampliando su negocio y formar mayor clientela para mejorar sus ingresos, su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Edgar, 43, lives in the city of Itá.  He has been making clay items for more than 10 years.  It’s his own business and he also helps his brother make bricks in the family clay works they own.  His clientele consists of building contractors, architects and private individuals who receive the items at their construction sites or come get them at the brick factory.  The loan Edgar is requesting is to buy sand because he has an important brick order that he wants to fill and he does not want to disappoint his customer.  He has been working exclusively with Fundación Paraguaya for more than 5 years and has always been responsible with his payments.  His objective every day is to expand his business and acquire more customers to improve his income as well as his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sand to make bricks.

loans.name: Maria Martir

texts.es:
María, tiene cuarenta y nueve años de edad, vive con sus cuatro hijos, ella es viuda, Ella elabora hamacas desde hace treinta y cuatro años, ella tiene un trabajo familiar de generación en generación y trabaja con sus hijos e hijas, la dificultad es la económia ya que no le permite satisfacer los clientes.
Es por ello que nos ha solicitado un crédito porque necesita invertir en la compra de materia prima como lo son hilo de seda de varios colores e hilo de nilón, que son los necesarios para la elaboración de las hamacas, este crédito le ayudara a potenciar el negocio, ya que tiene clientes que le realizan pedidos grandes y con la ayuda de Padecomsm  crédito podrá satisfacer estas necesidades de los clientes. El sueño es remodelar y amueblar su casa y tener especifico un lugar para elaboración de  las hamacas para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old and lives with her children. She is a widow and has been producing hammocks for 34 years. This line of work has been in her family for generations and she manages her business with her children. Her financial difficulty has kept her from meeting the demands of her customers.

For this reason, María is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of raw materials, such as silk thread in various colors and nylon thread, which are necessary for making hammocks. This loan will help boost her business since she already has customers who have placed large orders. With the help of this loan issued by PADECOMSM, she will be able to meet the needs of her customers.

Her dream is to remodel and furnish her home so that she can have a specific place for making hammocks and growing her business.

loans.use: to buy silk and nylon thread for making hammocks.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Trabajadoras, se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá en fecha 20 de octubre de 2010, están en el 5° ciclo, y trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Patricia, la presidenta se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, y nos dice que gracias a su trabajo está saliendo adelante. Cuenta que el comité de le ayuda muchísimo. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y así seguir creciendo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, como ser pantalones, camisas, remeras, etc.
texts.en:
This excellent group of women from the city of Itá is called “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Working Women); it was formed on October 20, 2010 and they are in the 5th cycle.  They work together in the program in a mutually supportive way.  

Patricia is group president and she works selling all sorts of clothes.  She relates that thanks to her work she’s getting ahead.  She comments that the committee helps her very much. Her goal is to be able to continue to work and grow this way.  She’s requesting the loan to buy articles of clothing like pants, shirts, t-shirts, etc.

loans.use: to buy various articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a Department of Water and Power down payment
